Text

[THE suburb of [Saffron Park]1-saffron park]182-the suburb of saffron park lay on [the sunset side of [London]2-london]183-the sunset side of london , as red and ragged as a cloud of sunset . [It]182-the suburb of saffron park was built of a bright brick throughout ; [its]182-the suburb of saffron park sky‑line was fantastic , and even [its]182-the suburb of saffron park ground plan was wild . [It]182-the suburb of saffron park had been the outburst of [a speculative builder]184-a speculative builder , faintly tinged with art , who called [its]182-the suburb of saffron park architecture sometimes Elizabethan and sometimes [Queen Anne]83-queen anne , apparently under the impression that [the two sovereigns]185-the two sovereigns were identical . [It]182-the suburb of saffron park was described with some justice as [an artistic colony]186-an artistic colony , though [it]182-the suburb of saffron park never in any definable way produced any art . But although [its]182-the suburb of saffron park pretensions to be [an intellectual centre]187-an intellectual centre were a little vague , [its]182-the suburb of saffron park pretensions to be [a pleasant place]188-a pleasant place were quite indisputable . [The stranger who looked for the first time]189-the stranger who looked for the first time at [the quaint red houses]190-the quaint red houses could only think how very oddly shaped [the people]191-the people must be who could fit in to [them]190-the quaint red houses . Nor when [he]189-the stranger who looked for the first time met [the people]191-the people was [he]189-the stranger who looked for the first time disappointed in this respect . [The place]193-the place was not only pleasant , but perfect , if once [he]189-the stranger who looked for the first time could regard [it]193-the place not as a deception but rather as a dream . Even if [the people]191-the people were not “ [artists]1931-artists , ”[196-that young man] the whole was nevertheless artistic . [That young man with the long , auburn hair and the impudent face]195-that young man with the long , auburn hair and the impudent face — [that young man]196-that young man was not really [a poet]197-a poet ; but surely [he]196-that young man was a poem . [That old gentleman with the wild , white beard and the wild , white hat]198-that old gentleman with the wild , white beard and the wild , white hat — [that venerable humbug]199-that venerable humbug was not really [a philosopher]200-a philosopher ; but at least [he]198-that old gentleman with the wild , white beard and the wild , white hat was the cause of philosophy in others . [That scientific gentleman with the bald , egg‑like head and the bare , bird‑like neck]201-that scientific gentleman with the bald , egg‑like head and the bare , bird‑like neck had no real right to the airs of science that [he]198-that old gentleman with the wild , white beard and the wild , white hat assumed . [He]198-that old gentleman with the wild , white beard and the wild , white hat had not discovered anything new in biology ; but what biological creature could [he]198-that old gentleman with the wild , white beard and the wild , white hat have discovered more singular than [himself]198-that old gentleman with the wild , white beard and the wild , white hat ? Thus , and thus only , [the whole place]202-the whole place had properly to be regarded ; [it]202-the whole place had to be considered not so much as a workshop for [artists]1931-artists , but as a frail but finished work of art . [A man who stepped into [its]202-the whole place social atmosphere]204-a man who stepped into its social atmosphere felt as if [he]204-a man who stepped into its social atmosphere had stepped into a written comedy . More especially this attractive unreality fell upon it about nightfall , when [the extravagant roofs]205-the extravagant roofs were dark against the afterglow and [the whole insane village]206-the whole insane village seemed as separate as a drifting cloud . This again was more strongly true of the many nights of local festivity , when [the little gardens]207-the little gardens were often illuminated , and the big Chinese lanterns glowed in the dwarfish trees like some fierce and monstrous fruit . And this was strongest of all on one particular evening , still vaguely remembered in [the locality]208-the locality , of which [the auburn‑haired poet]209-the auburn‑haired poet was [the hero]210-the hero . It was not by any means the only evening of which [he]209-the auburn‑haired poet was [the hero]210-the hero . On many nights [those passing by [[his]209-the auburn‑haired poet little back garden]213-his little back garden]212-those passing by his little back garden might hear [his]209-the auburn‑haired poet high , didactic voice laying down the law to [men]214-men and particularly to [women]215-women . The attitude of [women]215-women in such cases was indeed one of the paradoxes of [the place]193-the place . [Most of [the women]219-the women]218-most of the women were of the kind vaguely called emancipated , and professed some protest against male supremacy . Yet [these new women]220-these new women would always pay to [a man]221-a man the extravagant compliment which [no ordinary woman]222-no ordinary woman ever pays to [him]221-a man , that of listening while [he]221-a man is talking . And [Mr. Lucian Gregory]84-mr. lucian gregory , [the red‑haired poet]223-the red‑haired poet , was really ( in some sense ) [a man worth listening to]224-a man worth listening to , even if [one]225-one only laughed at the end of it . [He]84-mr. lucian gregory put the old ca nt of the lawlessness of art and the art of lawlessness with a certain impudent freshness which gave at least a momentary pleasure . [He]84-mr. lucian gregory was helped in some degree by the arresting oddity of [his]84-mr. lucian gregory appearance , which [he]84-mr. lucian gregory worked , as the phrase goes , for all it was worth . [His]84-mr. lucian gregory dark red hair parted in the middle was literally like [a woman]226-a woman ’s , and curved into the slow curls of [a virgin]227-a virgin in a pre‑Raphaelite picture . From within this almost saintly oval , however , [his]84-mr. lucian gregory face projected suddenly broad and brutal , the chin carried forward with a look of cockney contempt . This combination at once tickled and terrified the nerves of [a neurotic population]228-a neurotic population . [He]84-mr. lucian gregory seemed like a walking blasphemy , a blend of [the angel]229-the angel and the ape . This particular evening , if it is remembered for nothing else , will be remembered in [that place]230-that place for [its]230-that place strange sunset . It looked like the end of [the world]231-the world . All [the heaven]232-the heaven seemed covered with a quite vivid and palpable plumage ; [you]233-you could only say that the sky was full of feathers , and of feathers that almost brushed the face . Across the great part of the dome they were grey , with the strangest tints of violet and mauve and an unnatural pink or pale green ; but towards the west the whole grew past description , transparent and passionate , and the last red‑hot plumes of it covered up the sun like something too good to be seen . The whole was so close about [the earth]234-the earth , as to express nothing but a violent secrecy . The very empyrean seemed to be a secret . It expressed that splendid smallness which is the soul of local patriotism . The very sky seemed small . [I]0-i say that there are [some inhabitants who may remember the evening if only by that oppressive sky]235-some inhabitants who may remember the evening if only by that oppressive sky . There are [others who may remember it]236-others who may remember it because it marked the first appearance in the place of [the second poet of [Saffron Park]1-saffron park]237-the second poet of saffron park . For a long time [the red‑haired revolutionary]238-the red‑haired revolutionary had reigned without [a rival]239-a rival ; it was upon the night of the sunset that [his]84-mr. lucian gregory solitude suddenly ended . [The new poet , who introduced [himself]240-the new poet , who introduced himself by the name of gabriel syme by the name of [Gabriel Syme]85-syme]240-the new poet , who introduced himself by the name of gabriel syme was [a very mild - looking mortal , with a fair , pointed beard and faint , yellow hair]241-a very mild - looking mortal , with a fair , pointed beard and faint , yellow hair . But an impression grew that [he]84-mr. lucian gregory was less meek than [he]84-mr. lucian gregory looked . [He]84-mr. lucian gregory signalised [his]84-mr. lucian gregory entrance by differing with [the established poet]242-the established poet , [Gregory]84-mr. lucian gregory , upon the whole nature of poetry . [He]84-mr. lucian gregory said that [he]84-mr. lucian gregory ( [Syme]85-syme ) was [poet of law]243-poet of law , [a poet of order]244-a poet of order ; nay , [he]84-mr. lucian gregory said [he]84-mr. lucian gregory was [a poet of respectability]245-a poet of respectability . So all [the Saffron Parkers]86-the saffron parkers looked at [him]84-mr. lucian gregory as if [he]84-mr. lucian gregory had that moment fallen out of that impossible sky . In fact , [Mr. Lucian Gregory]84-mr. lucian gregory , [the anarchic poet]246-the anarchic poet , connected the two events . “ It may well be , ”[84-mr. lucian gregory] [he]84-mr. lucian gregory said , in [his]84-mr. lucian gregory sudden lyrical manner , “ it may well be on such a night of clouds and cruel colours that there is brought forth upon [the earth]234-the earth such a portent as [a respectable poet]1933-a respectable poet . [You]247-the man with the meek blue eyes and the pale , pointed beard say [you]247-the man with the meek blue eyes and the pale , pointed beard are [a poet of law]1934-a poet of law ; [I]84-mr. lucian gregory say [you]247-the man with the meek blue eyes and the pale , pointed beard are a contradiction in terms . [I]84-mr. lucian gregory only wonder there were not comets and earthquakes on the night [you]247-the man with the meek blue eyes and the pale , pointed beard appeared in [this garden]1935-this garden . ”[84-mr. lucian gregory] [The man with the meek blue eyes and the pale , pointed beard]247-the man with the meek blue eyes and the pale , pointed beard endured these thunders with a certain submissive solemnity . [The third party of the group]248-the third party of the group , [[Gregory]84-mr. lucian gregory ’s sister]249-gregory ’s sister [Rosamond]87-gregory , who had [[her]249-gregory ’s sister brother]250-her brother ’s braids of red hair , but a kindlier face underneath [them]251-them , laughed with such mixture of admiration and disapproval as [she]249-gregory ’s sister gave commonly to [the family oracle]252-the family oracle . [Gregory]87-gregory resumed in high oratorical good humour . “ [An artist]1936-an artist is identical with [an anarchist]1937-an anarchist , ”[87-gregory] [he]87-gregory cried . “ [You]247-the man with the meek blue eyes and the pale , pointed beard might transpose the words anywhere . [An anarchist]1937-an anarchist is [an artist]1936-an artist . [The man who throws a bomb]1940-the man who throws a bomb is [an artist]1936-an artist , because [he]1940-the man who throws a bomb prefers a great moment to everything . [He]1940-the man who throws a bomb sees how much more valuable is one burst of blazing light , one peal of perfect thunder , than the mere common bodies of [a few shapeless policemen]1942-a few shapeless policemen . [An artist]1936-an artist disregards all governments , abolishes all conventions . [The poet]1944-the poet delights in disorder only . If it were not so , the most poetical thing in [the world]231-the world would be [the Underground Railway]1946-the underground railway . ”[87-gregory] “ So it is , ”[85-syme] said [Mr. Syme]85-syme . “ Nonsense ! ”[87-gregory] said [Gregory]87-gregory , who was very rational when [anyone else attempted paradox]253-anyone else attempted paradox . “ Why do all [the clerks]1947-the clerks and navvies in [the railway trains]1948-the railway trains look so sad and tired , so very sad and tired ? [I]87-gregory will tell [you]247-the man with the meek blue eyes and the pale , pointed beard . It is because [they]1947-the clerks know that [the train]1949-the train is going right . It is because [they]1947-the clerks know that whatever place [they]1947-the clerks have taken a ticket for that place [they]1947-the clerks will reach . It is because after [they]1947-the clerks have passed [Sloane Square]1950-sloane square [they]1947-the clerks know that [the next station]1951-the next station must be [Victoria]88-victoria , and nothing but [Victoria]88-victoria . Oh , [their]1947-the clerks wild rapture ! oh , [their]1947-the clerks eyes like stars and [their]1947-the clerks souls again in [Eden]5-eden , if [the next station]1951-the next station were unaccountably [Baker Street]6-baker street ! ”[87-gregory] “ It is [you]247-the man with the meek blue eyes and the pale , pointed beard who are unpoetical , ”[1944-the poet] replied [the poet]1944-the poet [Syme]85-syme . “ If what [you]247-the man with the meek blue eyes and the pale , pointed beard say of [clerks]1953-clerks is true , [they]1953-clerks can only be as prosaic as [your]247-the man with the meek blue eyes and the pale , pointed beard poetry . The rare , strange thing is to hit the mark ; the gross , obvious thing is to miss it . [We]1954-we feel it is epical when [man with one wild arrow strikes a distant bird]1955-man with one wild arrow strikes a distant bird . Is it not also epical when [man with one wild engine]1956-man with one wild engine strikes [a distant station]1957-a distant station ? Chaos is dull ; because in chaos [the train]1949-the train might indeed go anywhere , to [Baker Street]6-baker street or to [Bagdad]7-bagdad . But [man]1959-man is [a magician]1960-a magician , and [his]1959-man whole magic is in this , that [he]1959-man does say [Victoria]88-victoria , and lo ! it is [Victoria]88-victoria . No , take [your]247-the man with the meek blue eyes and the pale , pointed beard books of mere poetry and prose ; let [me]1944-the poet read a time table , with tears of pride . Take [[your]247-the man with the meek blue eyes and the pale , pointed beard Byron , who commemorates the defeats of [man]1959-man]1961-your byron , who commemorates the defeats of man ; give [me]1944-the poet [Bradshaw]89-bradshaw , who commemorates [his]1959-man victories . Give [me]1944-the poet [Bradshaw]89-bradshaw , [I]1944-the poet say ! ”[1944-the poet] “ Must [you]85-syme go ? ”[87-gregory] inquired [Gregory]87-gregory sarcastically . “ [I]85-syme tell [you]247-the man with the meek blue eyes and the pale , pointed beard , ”[85-syme] went on [Syme]85-syme with passion , “ that every time [a train]1963-a train comes in [I]87-gregory feel that it has broken past batteries of [besiegers]1964-besiegers , and that [man]1959-man has won a battle against chaos . [You]247-the man with the meek blue eyes and the pale , pointed beard say contemptuously that when [one]225-one has left [Sloane Square]8-sloane square one must come to [Victoria]88-victoria . [I]87-gregory say that [one]225-one might do a thousand things instead , and that whenever [I]87-gregory really come [there]1968-there [I]87-gregory have the sense of hairbreadth escape . And when [I]87-gregory hear [the guard]1969-the guard shout out the word ‘ [Victoria]88-victoria , ’ it is not an unmeaning word . It is to [me]87-gregory the cry of [a herald announcing conquest]1970-a herald announcing conquest . It is to [me]87-gregory indeed ‘ [Victoria]88-victoria ’ ; it is the victory of [Adam]90-adam . ”[87-gregory] [Gregory]87-gregory wagged [his]87-gregory heavy , red head with a slow and sad smile . “ And even then , ”[87-gregory] [he]87-gregory said , “ [we]1971-we [poets]1972-poets always ask the question , ‘ And what is [Victoria]88-victoria now that [you]1973-you have got [there]1968-there ? ’ [You]1973-you think [Victoria]88-victoria is like the New [Jerusalem]9-jerusalem . [We]1971-we know that [the New Jerusalem]1975-the new jerusalem will only be like [Victoria]88-victoria . Yes , [the poet]1944-the poet will be discontented even in [the streets of heaven]1977-the streets of heaven . [The poet]1944-the poet is always in revolt . ”[87-gregory] “ There again , ”[85-syme] said [Syme]85-syme irritably , “ what is there poetical about being in revolt ? [You]1973-you might as well say that it is poetical to be sea‑sick . Being sick is a revolt . Both being sick and being rebellious may be the wholesome thing on certain desperate occasions ; but [I]85-syme ’m hanged if [I]85-syme can see why they are poetical . Revolt in the abstract is — revolting . It ’s mere vomiting . ”[85-syme] [The girl]255-the girl winced for a flash at the unpleasant word , but [Syme]85-syme was too hot to heed [her]255-the girl . “ It is things going right , ”[85-syme] [he]85-syme cried , “ that is poetical ! [Our]1971-we digestions , for instance , going sacredly and silently right , that is the foundation of all poetry . Yes , the most poetical thing , more poetical than the flowers , more poetical than the stars — the most poetical thing in [the world]231-the world is not being sick . ”[85-syme] “ Really , ”[87-gregory] said [Gregory]87-gregory superciliously , “ the examples [you]85-syme choose — ”[87-gregory] “ [I]85-syme beg [your]87-gregory pardon , ”[85-syme] said [Syme]85-syme grimly , “ [I]85-syme forgot [we]1971-we had abolished all conventions . ”[85-syme] For the first time a red patch appeared on [Gregory]87-gregory ’s forehead . “ [You]85-syme do n’t expect [me]85-syme , ”[85-syme] [he]85-syme said , “ to revolutionise society on [this lawn]1980-this lawn ? ”[85-syme] [Syme]85-syme looked straight into [his]87-gregory eyes and smiled sweetly . “ No , [I]85-syme do n’t , ”[85-syme] [he]85-syme said ; “ but [I]85-syme suppose that if [you]85-syme were serious about [your]85-syme anarchism , that is exactly what [you]85-syme would do . ”[85-syme] [Gregory]87-gregory ’s big bull ’s eyes blinked suddenly like those of an angry lion , and [one]225-one could almost fancy that [his]87-gregory red mane rose . “ Do n’t [you]85-syme think , then , ”[85-syme] [he]85-syme said in a dangerous voice , “ that [I]85-syme am serious about [my]85-syme anarchism ? ”[85-syme] “ [I]85-syme beg [your]87-gregory pardon ? ”[85-syme] said [Syme]85-syme . “ Am [I]87-gregory not serious about [my]87-gregory anarchism ? ”[87-gregory] cried [Gregory]87-gregory , with knotted fists . “ [[My]85-syme dear fellow]1981-my dear fellow ! ”[85-syme] said [Syme]85-syme , and strolled away . With surprise , but with a curious pleasure , [he]85-syme found [Rosamond Gregory]87-gregory still in [his]85-syme company . “ [Mr. Syme]85-syme , ”[257-she] [she]257-she said , “ do [the people who talk like [you]85-syme and [[my]257-she brother]1983-my brother]1982-the people who talk like you and my brother often mean what [they]1982-the people who talk like you and my brother say ? Do [you]85-syme mean what [you]85-syme say now ? ”[257-she] [Syme]85-syme smiled . “ Do [you]255-the girl ? ”[85-syme] [he]85-syme asked . “ What do [you]85-syme mean ? ”[255-the girl] asked [the girl]255-the girl , with grave eyes . “ [[My]85-syme dear]1984-my dear [Miss Gregory]106-gregory , ”[85-syme] said [Syme]85-syme gently , “ there are many kinds of sincerity and insincerity . When [you]85-syme say ‘ thank [you]85-syme ’ for the salt , do [you]85-syme mean what [you]85-syme say ? No . When [you]85-syme say ‘ [the world]231-the world is round , ’ do [you]85-syme mean what [you]85-syme say ? No . It is true , but [you]85-syme do n’t mean it . Now , sometimes [a man like [[your]85-syme brother]1987-your brother]1986-a man like your brother really finds a thing [he]1986-a man like your brother does mean . It may be only a half‑truth , quarter‑truth , tenth‑truth ; but then [he]1986-a man like your brother says more than [he]1986-a man like your brother means — from sheer force of meaning it . ”[85-syme] [She]255-the girl was looking at [him]259-his from under level brows ; [her]255-the girl face was grave and open , and there had fallen upon it the shadow of that unreasoning responsibility which is at the bottom of [the most frivolous woman]260-the most frivolous woman , the maternal watch which is as old as [the world]231-the world . “ Is [he]1986-a man like your brother really [an anarchist]1937-an anarchist , then ? ”[255-the girl] [she]255-the girl asked . “ Only in that sense [I]85-syme speak of , ”[85-syme] replied [Syme]85-syme ; “ or if [you]255-the girl prefer it , in that nonsense . ”[255-the girl] [She]255-the girl drew [her]255-the girl broad brows together and said abruptly — “ [He]1986-a man like your brother would n’t really use — bombs or that sort of thing ? ”[255-the girl] [Syme]85-syme broke into a great laugh , that seemed too large for [his]259-his slight and somewhat dandified figure . “ [Good Lord]92-good lord , no ! ”[259-his] [he]259-his said , “ that has to be done anonymously . ”[259-his] And at that the corners of [her]255-the girl own mouth broke into a smile , and [she]255-the girl thought with a simultaneous pleasure of [Gregory]106-gregory ’s absurdity and of [his]259-his safety . [Syme]85-syme strolled with [her]255-the girl to a seat in the corner of [the garden]262-the garden , and continued to pour out [his]259-his opinions . For [he]259-his was [a sincere man]263-a sincere man , and in spite of [his]259-his superficial airs and graces , at root [a humble one]264-a humble one . And it is always [the humble man]265-the humble man who talks too much ; [the proud man]266-the proud man watches [himself]266-the proud man too closely . [He]259-his defended respectability with violence and exaggeration . [He]259-his grew passionate in [his]259-his praise of tidiness and propriety . All the time there was a smell of lilac all round [him]259-his . Once [he]259-his heard very faintly in [some distant street]267-some distant street a barrel‑organ begin to play , and it seemed to [him]259-his that [his]259-his heroic words were moving to a tiny tune from under or beyond [the world]231-the world . [He]259-his stared and talked at [the girl]255-the girl ’s red hair and amused face for what seemed to be a few minutes ; and then , feeling that the groups in such a place should mix , rose to [his]259-his feet . To [his]259-his astonishment , [he]259-his discovered [the whole garden]270-the whole garden empty . [Everyone]271-everyone had gone long ago , and [he]259-his went [himself]259-his with a rather hurried apology . [He]259-his left with a sense of champagne in [his]259-his head , which [he]259-his could not afterwards explain . In the wild events which were to follow [this girl]272-this girl had no part at all ; [he]259-his never saw [her]272-this girl again until all [his]259-his tale was over . And yet , in some indescribable way , [she]272-this girl kept recurring like a motive in music through all [his]259-his mad adventures afterwards , and the glory of [her]272-this girl strange hair ran like a red thread through those dark and ill‑drawn tapestries of the night . For what followed was so improbable , that it might well have been a dream . When [Syme]85-syme went out into [the starlit street]273-the starlit street , [he]85-syme found [it]273-the starlit street for the moment empty . Then [he]85-syme realised ( in some odd way ) that the silence was rather a living silence than a dead one . Directly outside the door stood a street lamp , whose gleam gilded the leaves of the tree that bent out over the fence behind [him]259-his . About a foot from the lamp‑post stood a figure almost as rigid and motionless as the lamp‑post itself . The tall hat and long frock coat were black ; the face , in an abrupt shadow , was almost as dark . Only a fringe of fiery hair against the light , and also something aggressive in the attitude , proclaimed that it was [the poet [Gregory]106-gregory]274-the poet gregory . [He]274-the poet gregory had something of the look of [a masked bravo waiting sword in hand for [[his]274-the poet gregory foe]276-his foe]275-a masked bravo waiting sword in hand for his foe . [He]274-the poet gregory made a sort of doubtful salute , which [Syme]85-syme somewhat more formally returned . “ [I]106-gregory was waiting for [you]85-syme , ”[106-gregory] said [Gregory]106-gregory . “ Might [I]106-gregory have a moment ’s conversation ? ”[106-gregory] “ Certainly . About what ? ”[85-syme] asked [Syme]85-syme in a sort of weak wonder . [Gregory]106-gregory struck out with [his]274-the poet gregory stick at the lamp‑post , and then at the tree . “ About this and this , ”[274-the poet gregory] [he]274-the poet gregory cried ; “ about order and anarchy . There is [your]85-syme precious order , that lean , iron lamp , ugly and barren ; and there is anarchy , rich , living , reproducing itself — there is anarchy , splendid in green and gold . ”[274-the poet gregory] “ All the same , ”[85-syme] replied [Syme]85-syme patiently , “ just at present [you]85-syme only see the tree by the light of the lamp . [I]85-syme wonder when [you]85-syme would ever see the lamp by the light of the tree . ”[85-syme] Then after a pause [he]274-the poet gregory said , “ But may [I]274-the poet gregory ask if [you]85-syme have been standing out here in the dark only to resume [our]1989-our little argument ? ”[274-the poet gregory] “ No , ”[106-gregory] cried out [Gregory]106-gregory , in a voice that rang down [the street]277-the street , “ [I]106-gregory did not stand here to resume [our]1989-our argument , but to end it for ever . ”[106-gregory] The silence fell again , and [Syme]85-syme , though [he]85-syme understood nothing , listened instinctively for something serious . [Gregory]106-gregory began in a smooth voice and with a rather bewildering smile . “ [Mr. Syme]85-syme , ”[274-the poet gregory] [he]274-the poet gregory said , “ this evening [you]85-syme succeeded in doing something rather remarkable . [You]85-syme did something to [me]274-the poet gregory that [no man born of woman]1990-no man born of woman has ever succeeded in doing before . ”[274-the poet gregory] “ Indeed ! ”[106-gregory] “ Now [I]106-gregory remember , ”[106-gregory] resumed [Gregory]106-gregory reflectively , “ [one other person]1991-one other person succeeded in doing it . [The captain of [a penny steamer]1993-a penny steamer]1992-the captain of a penny steamer ( if [I]106-gregory remember correctly ) at [Southend]10-southend . [You]85-syme have irritated [me]106-gregory . ”[106-gregory] “ [I]85-syme am very sorry , ”[85-syme] replied [Syme]85-syme with gravity . “ [I]106-gregory am afraid [my]106-gregory fury and [your]85-syme insult are too shocking to be wiped out even with an apology , ”[106-gregory] said [Gregory]106-gregory very calmly . “ [No duel]1994-no duel could wipe it out . If [I]106-gregory struck [you]85-syme dead [I]106-gregory could not wipe it out . There is only one way by which that insult can be erased , and that way [I]106-gregory choose . [I]106-gregory am going , at the possible sacrifice of [my]106-gregory life and honour , to prove to [you]85-syme that [you]85-syme were wrong in what [you]85-syme said . ”[106-gregory] “ In what [I]106-gregory said ? ”[106-gregory] “ [You]106-gregory said [I]106-gregory was not serious about being [an anarchist]1937-an anarchist . ”[106-gregory] “ There are degrees of seriousness , ”[85-syme] replied [Syme]85-syme . “ [I]85-syme have never doubted that [you]106-gregory were perfectly sincere in this sense , that [you]106-gregory thought what [you]106-gregory said well worth saying , that [you]106-gregory thought a paradox might wake [men]214-men up to a neglected truth . ”[85-syme] [Gregory]106-gregory stared at [him]85-syme steadily and painfully . “ And in no other sense , ”[85-syme] [he]85-syme asked , “ [you]85-syme think [me]85-syme serious ? [You]85-syme think [me]85-syme [a flâneur who lets fall occasional truths]1997-a flâneur who lets fall occasional truths . [You]85-syme do not think that in a deeper , a more deadly sense , [I]85-syme am serious . ”[85-syme] [Syme]85-syme struck [his]85-syme stick violently on the stones of [the road]278-the road . “ Serious ! ”[85-syme] [he]85-syme cried . “ [Good Lord]1998-good lord ! is [this street]1999-this street serious ? Are [these damned Chinese lanterns]2000-these damned chinese lanterns serious ? Is the whole caboodle serious ? [One]225-one comes here and talks a pack of bosh , and perhaps some sense as well , but [I]85-syme should think very little of [a man who did n’t keep something in the background of [his]2002-a man who did n’t keep something in the background of his life that was more serious than all this talking — something more serious , whether it was religion or only drink life that was more serious than all this talking — something more serious , whether it was religion or only drink]2002-a man who did n’t keep something in the background of his life that was more serious than all this talking — something more serious , whether it was religion or only drink . ”[85-syme] “ Very well , ”[106-gregory] said [Gregory]106-gregory , [his]85-syme face darkening , “ [you]85-syme shall see something more serious than either drink or religion . ”[85-syme] [Syme]85-syme stood waiting with [his]85-syme usual air of mildness until [Gregory]106-gregory again opened [his]85-syme lips . “ [You]85-syme spoke just now of having a religion . Is it really true that [you]85-syme have one ? ”[85-syme] “ Oh , ”[85-syme] said [Syme]85-syme with a beaming smile , “ [we]2003-we are [all Catholics]2004-all catholics now . ”[85-syme] “ Then may [I]85-syme ask [you]85-syme to swear by whatever gods or [saints]2005-saints [your]85-syme religion involves that [you]85-syme will not reveal what [I]85-syme am now going to tell [you]85-syme to [any son of [Adam]90-adam]2006-any son of adam , and especially not to [the police]2007-the police ? Will [you]85-syme swear that ! If [you]85-syme will take upon [yourself]85-syme this awful abnegations if [you]85-syme will consent to burden [your]85-syme soul with a vow that [you]85-syme should never make and a knowledge [you]85-syme should never dream about , [I]85-syme will promise [you]85-syme in return — ”[85-syme] “ [You]85-syme will promise [me]85-syme in return ? ”[85-syme] inquired [Syme]85-syme , as [the other]279-the other paused . “ [I]279-the other will promise [you]85-syme a very entertaining evening . ”[279-the other] [Syme]85-syme suddenly took off [his]85-syme hat . “ [Your]85-syme offer , ”[85-syme] [he]85-syme said , “ is far too idiotic to be declined . [You]85-syme say that [a poet]197-a poet is always [an anarchist]1937-an anarchist . [I]85-syme disagree ; but [I]85-syme hope at least that [he]197-a poet is always [a sportsman]2010-a sportsman . Permit [me]85-syme , here and now , to swear as [a Christian]2011-a christian , and promise as [a good comrade]2012-a good comrade and [a fellow‑artist]2013-a fellow‑artist , that [I]85-syme will not report anything of this , whatever it is , to [the police]2007-the police . And now , in the name of [Colney Hatch]93-colney hatch , what is it ? ”[85-syme] “ [I]106-gregory think , ”[106-gregory] said [Gregory]106-gregory , with placid irrelevancy , “ that [we]281-the two will call [a cab]2015-a cab . ”[85-syme] [He]85-syme gave two long whistles , and a hansom came rattling down [the road]278-the road . [The two]281-the two got into [it]282-it in silence . [The cab]286-the cab whisked itself away again , and in it [these two fantastics]287-these two fantastics quitted [[their]287-these two fantastics fantastic town]288-their fantastic town . [THE SECRET OF]289-the secret of [GABRIEL SYME]85-syme THE cab pulled up before [a particularly dreary and greasy beershop]290-a particularly dreary and greasy beershop , into which [Gregory]106-gregory rapidly conducted [[his]85-syme companion]291-his companion . [They]281-the two seated [themselves]281-the two in a close and dim sort of bar‑parlour , at a stained wooden table with one wooden leg . [The room]292-the room was so small and dark , that very little could be seen of [the attendant who was summoned , beyond a vague and dark impression of something bulky and bearded]293-the attendant who was summoned , beyond a vague and dark impression of something bulky and bearded . “ Will [you]85-syme take a little supper ? ”[106-gregory] asked [Gregory]106-gregory politely . “ [The pâté de foie gras]2016-the pâté de foie gras is not good here , but [I]106-gregory can recommend the game . ”[106-gregory] [Syme]85-syme received the remark with stolidity , imagining it to be a joke . Accepting the vein of humour , [he]85-syme said , with a well‑bred indifference — “ Oh , bring [me]85-syme some lobster mayonnaise . ”[85-syme] To [his]85-syme indescribable astonishment , [the man]294-the man only said “ Certainly , [sir]2017-sir ! ”[294-the man] and went away apparently to get it . “ What will [you]85-syme drink ? ”[106-gregory] resumed [Gregory]106-gregory , with the same careless yet apologetic air . “ [I]106-gregory shall only have a crême de menthe [myself]106-gregory ; [I]106-gregory have dined . But the champagne can really be trusted . Do let [me]106-gregory start [you]85-syme with a half‑bottle of Pommery at least ? ”[106-gregory] “ Thank [you]2017-sir ! ”[85-syme] said the motionless [Syme]85-syme . “ [You]2017-sir are very good . ”[85-syme] [His]85-syme further attempts at conversation , somewhat disorganised in [themselves]295-themselves , were cut short finally as by a thunderbolt by the actual appearance of the lobster . [Syme]85-syme tasted it , and found it particularly good . Then [he]85-syme suddenly began to eat with great rapidity and appetite . “ Excuse [me]85-syme if [I]85-syme enjoy [myself]85-syme rather obviously ! ”[85-syme] [he]85-syme said to [Gregory]106-gregory , smiling . “ [I]85-syme do n’t often have the luck to have a dream like this . It is new to [me]85-syme for a nightmare to lead to a lobster . It is commonly the other way . ”[85-syme] “ [You]85-syme are not asleep , [I]106-gregory assure [you]85-syme , ”[106-gregory] said [Gregory]106-gregory . “ [You]85-syme are , on the contrary , close to the most actual and rousing moment of [your]85-syme existence . Ah , here comes [your]85-syme champagne ! [I]85-syme admit that there may be a slight disproportion , let [us]2018-we say , between the inner arrangements of [this excellent hotel]2019-this excellent hotel and [its]2019-this excellent hotel simple and unpretentious exterior . But that is all [our]2018-we modesty . [We]2018-we are [the most modest men that ever lived on [earth]2021-earth]2020-the most modest men that ever lived on earth . ”[85-syme] “ And who are [we]2018-we ? ”[85-syme] asked [Syme]85-syme , emptying [his]85-syme champagne glass . “ It is quite simple , ”[106-gregory] replied [Gregory]106-gregory . ” [We]2018-we are [the serious anarchists]2022-the serious anarchists , in whom [you]85-syme do not believe . ”[106-gregory] “ Oh ! ”[85-syme] said [Syme]85-syme shortly . “ [You]85-syme do [yourselves]85-syme well in drinks . ”[85-syme] “ Yes , [we]2018-we are serious about everything , ”[106-gregory] answered [Gregory]106-gregory . Then after a pause [he]85-syme added — “ If in a few moments this table begins to turn round a little , do n’t put it down to [your]85-syme inroads into the champagne . [I]85-syme do n’t wish [you]85-syme to do [yourself]85-syme an injustice . ”[85-syme] “ Well , if [I]85-syme am not drunk , [I]85-syme am mad , ”[85-syme] replied [Syme]85-syme with perfect calm ; “ but [I]85-syme trust [I]85-syme can behave like [a gentleman]2023-a gentleman in either condition . May [I]85-syme smoke ? ”[85-syme] “ Certainly ! ”[106-gregory] said [Gregory]106-gregory , producing a cigar‑case . “ Try one of [mine]106-gregory . ”[85-syme] [Syme]85-syme took the cigar , clipped the end off with a cigar - cutter out of [his]85-syme waistcoat pocket , put it in [his]85-syme mouth , lit it slowly , and let out a long cloud of smoke . It is not a little to [his]85-syme credit that [he]85-syme performed these rites with so much composure , for almost before [he]85-syme had begun [them]296-them the table at which [he]85-syme sat had begun to revolve , first slowly , and then rapidly , as if at an insane séance . “ [You]85-syme must not mind it , ”[106-gregory] said [Gregory]106-gregory ; “ it ’s a kind of screw . ”[106-gregory] “ Quite so , ”[85-syme] said [Syme]85-syme placidly , “ a kind of screw . How simple that is ! ”[85-syme] The next moment the smoke of [his]85-syme cigar , which had been wavering across [the room]292-the room in snaky twists , went straight up as if from [a factory chimney]298-a factory chimney , and [the two]281-the two , with [their]281-the two chairs and table , shot down through the floor as if the earth had swallowed [them]281-the two . [They]281-the two went rattling down a kind of roaring chimney as rapidly as a lift cut loose , and [they]281-the two came with an abrupt bump to the bottom . But when [Gregory]106-gregory threw open a pair of doors and let in a red subterranean light , [Syme]85-syme was still smoking with one leg thrown over the other , and had not turned a yellow hair . [Gregory]106-gregory led [him]85-syme down [a low , vaulted passage]300-a low , vaulted passage , at the end of which was the red light . It was an enormous crimson lantern , nearly as big as a fireplace , fixed over a small but heavy iron door . In the door there was a sort of hatchway or grating , and on this [Gregory]106-gregory struck five times . A heavy voice with a foreign accent asked [him]85-syme who [he]85-syme was . To this [he]85-syme gave the more or less unexpected reply , “ [Mr. Joseph Chamberlain]94-mr. joseph chamberlain . ”[85-syme] The heavy hinges began to move ; it was obviously some kind of password . Inside the doorway [the passage]301-the passage gleamed as if [it]301-the passage were lined with a network of steel . On a second glance , [Syme]85-syme saw that the glittering pattern was really made up of ranks and ranks of rifles and revolvers , closely packed or interlocked . “ [I]106-gregory must ask [you]85-syme to forgive [me]106-gregory all these formalities , ”[106-gregory] said [Gregory]106-gregory ; “ [we]304-we have to be very strict here . ”[106-gregory] “ Oh , do n’t apologise , ”[85-syme] said [Syme]85-syme . “ [I]85-syme know [your]85-syme passion for law and order , ”[85-syme] and [he]85-syme stepped into [the passage lined with the steel weapons]302-the passage lined with the steel weapons . With [his]85-syme long , fair hair and rather foppish frock‑coat , [he]85-syme looked a singularly frail and fanciful figure as [he]85-syme walked down [that shining avenue of death]303-that shining avenue of death . [They]304-we passed through [several such passages]305-several such passages , and came out at last into [a queer steel chamber with curved walls , almost spherical in shape , but presenting , with [its]306-a queer steel chamber with curved walls , almost spherical in shape , but presenting , with its tiers of benches , something of the appearance of a scientific lecture - theatre tiers of benches , something of the appearance of [a scientific lecture - theatre]307-a scientific lecture - theatre]306-a queer steel chamber with curved walls , almost spherical in shape , but presenting , with its tiers of benches , something of the appearance of a scientific lecture - theatre . There were no rifles or pistols in [this apartment]308-this apartment , but round the walls of [it]308-this apartment were hung more dubious and dreadful shapes , things that looked like the bulbs of iron plants , or the eggs of iron birds . They were bombs , and [the very room]309-the very room itself seemed like the inside of a bomb . [Syme]85-syme knocked [his]85-syme cigar ash off against the wall , and went in . “ And now , [[my]106-gregory dear]1984-my dear [Mr. Syme]85-syme , ”[106-gregory] said [Gregory]106-gregory , throwing [himself]106-gregory in an expansive manner on the bench under the largest bomb , “ now [we]304-we are quite cosy , so let [us]304-we talk properly . Now no human words can give [you]1984-my dear any notion of why [I]106-gregory brought [you]1984-my dear [here]2025-here . It was one of those quite arbitrary emotions , like jumping off a cliff or falling in love . Suffice it to say that [you]1984-my dear were [an inexpressibly irritating fellow]2026-an inexpressibly irritating fellow , and , to do [you]1984-my dear justice , [you]1984-my dear are still . [I]106-gregory would break twenty oaths of secrecy for the pleasure of taking [you]1984-my dear down a peg . That way [you]1984-my dear have of lighting a cigar would make [a priest]2027-a priest break the seal of confession . Well , [you]1984-my dear said that [you]1984-my dear were quite certain [I]106-gregory was not [a serious anarchist]2028-a serious anarchist . Does [this place]2029-this place strike [you]1984-my dear as being serious ? ”[106-gregory] “ [It]2029-this place does seem to have a moral under all its gaiety , ”[85-syme] assented [Syme]85-syme ; “ but may [I]85-syme ask [you]1984-my dear two questions ? [You]1984-my dear need not fear to give [me]85-syme information , because , as [you]1984-my dear remember , [you]1984-my dear very wisely extorted from [me]85-syme a promise not to tell [the police]2007-the police , a promise [I]85-syme shall certainly keep . So it is in mere curiosity that [I]85-syme make [my]85-syme queries . First of all , what is it really all about ? What is it [you]1984-my dear object to ? [You]1984-my dear want to abolish Government ? ”[85-syme] “ To abolish [God]95-god ! ”[106-gregory] said [Gregory]106-gregory , opening the eyes of [a fanatic]310-a fanatic . “ [We]2031-we do not only want to upset a few despotisms and police regulations ; that sort of anarchism does exist , but it is a mere branch of [the Nonconformists]2032-the nonconformists . [We]2031-we dig deeper and [we]2031-we blow [you]1984-my dear higher . [We]2031-we wish to deny all those arbitrary distinctions of vice and virtue , honour and treachery , upon which [mere rebels]2033-mere rebels base [themselves]2033-mere rebels . [The silly sentimentalists of the French Revolution]2034-the silly sentimentalists of the french revolution talked of the Rights of [Man]1959-man ! [We]2031-we hate Rights as [we]2031-we hate Wrongs . [We]2031-we have abolished Right and Wrong . ”[106-gregory] “ And Right and Left , ”[85-syme] said [Syme]85-syme with a simple eagerness , “ [I]85-syme hope [you]106-gregory will abolish [them]2034-the silly sentimentalists of the french revolution too . [They]2034-the silly sentimentalists of the french revolution are much more troublesome to [me]85-syme . ”[85-syme] “ [You]85-syme spoke of a second question , ”[106-gregory] snapped [Gregory]106-gregory . “ With pleasure , ”[85-syme] resumed [Syme]85-syme . “ In all [your]1984-my dear present acts and surroundings there is a scientific attempt at secrecy . [I]106-gregory have [an aunt]2036-an aunt who lived over [a shop]2037-a shop , but this is the first time [I]106-gregory have found [people]2038-people living from preference under [a public‑house]2039-a public‑house . [You]1984-my dear have a heavy iron door . [You]1984-my dear can not pass [it]2040-it without submitting to the humiliation of calling [yourself]1984-my dear [Mr. Chamberlain]94-mr. joseph chamberlain . [You]1984-my dear surround [yourself]1984-my dear with steel instruments which make [the place]193-the place , if [I]106-gregory may say so , more impressive than [homelike]2042-homelike . May [I]106-gregory ask why , after taking all this trouble to barricade [yourselves]1984-my dear in [the bowels of [the earth]234-the earth]2043-the bowels of the earth , [you]1984-my dear then parade [your]1984-my dear whole secret by talking about anarchism to [every silly woman in [Saffron Park]1-saffron park]2045-every silly woman in saffron park ? ”[106-gregory] [Gregory]106-gregory smiled . “ The answer is simple , ”[311-i] [he]311-i said . “ [I]85-syme told [you]106-gregory [I]85-syme was [a serious anarchist]2028-a serious anarchist , and [you]106-gregory did not believe [me]85-syme . Nor do [they]2047-they believe [me]85-syme . Unless [I]85-syme took [them]2047-they into [this infernal room]2048-this infernal room [they]2047-they would not believe [me]85-syme . ”[85-syme] [Syme]85-syme smoked thoughtfully , and looked at [him]311-i with interest . [Gregory]106-gregory went on . “ The history of the thing might amuse [you]106-gregory , ”[311-i] [he]311-i said . “ When first [I]311-i became one of [the New Anarchists]2049-the new anarchists [I]311-i tried all kinds of respectable disguises . [I]311-i dressed up as [a bishop]2050-a bishop . [I]311-i read up all about [bishops]2051-bishops in [our]2052-our anarchist pamphlets , in Superstition [the Vampire and Priests of Prey]2053-the vampire and priests of prey . [I]311-i certainly understood from [them]2053-the vampire and priests of prey that [bishops]2051-bishops are strange and [terrible old men]2055-terrible old men keeping a cruel secret from [mankind]2056-mankind . [I]311-i was misinformed . When on [my]311-i first appearing in episcopal gaiters in [a drawing‑room]2057-a drawing‑room [I]311-i cried out in a voice of thunder , ‘ Down ! down ! presumptuous human reason ! ’ [they]2053-the vampire and priests of prey found out in some way that [I]311-i was not [a bishop]2050-a bishop at all . [I]311-i was nabbed at once . Then [I]311-i made up as [a millionaire]2059-a millionaire ; but [I]311-i defended [Capital]11-capital with so much intelligence that [a fool]2060-a fool could see that [I]311-i was quite poor . Then [I]311-i tried being [a major]2061-a major . Now [I]311-i am [a humanitarian [myself]311-i]2062-a humanitarian myself , but [I]311-i have , [I]311-i hope , enough intellectual breadth to understand the position of those who , like [Nietzsche]96-nietzsche , admire violence — the proud , mad war of Nature and all that , [you]2063-you know . [I]311-i threw [myself]311-i into [the major]2064-the major . [I]311-i drew [my]311-i sword and waved it constantly . [I]311-i called out ‘ Blood ! ’ abstractedly , like [a man calling for wine]2065-a man calling for wine . [I]311-i often said , ‘ Let [the weak]2066-the weak perish ; it is the Law . ’ Well , well , it seems [majors]2067-majors do n’t do this . [I]311-i was nabbed again . At last [I]311-i went in despair to [the President of [the Central Anarchist Council]2069-the central anarchist council , who is [the greatest man in [Europe]12-europe]2070-the greatest man in europe]2068-the president of the central anarchist council , who is the greatest man in europe . ”[311-i] “ What is [his]2068-the president of the central anarchist council , who is the greatest man in europe name ? ”[85-syme] asked [Syme]85-syme . “ [You]2063-you would not know it , ”[106-gregory] answered [Gregory]106-gregory . “ That is [his]2068-the president of the central anarchist council , who is the greatest man in europe greatness . [Caesar]97-caesar and [Napoleon]98-napoleon put all [their]2071-their genius into being heard of , and [they]2071-their were heard of . [He]2068-the president of the central anarchist council , who is the greatest man in europe puts all [his]2068-the president of the central anarchist council , who is the greatest man in europe genius into not being heard of , and [he]2068-the president of the central anarchist council , who is the greatest man in europe is not heard of . But [you]2063-you can not be for five minutes in [the room]292-the room with [him]2068-the president of the central anarchist council , who is the greatest man in europe without feeling that [Caesar]97-caesar and [Napoleon]98-napoleon would have been [children]2073-children in [his]2068-the president of the central anarchist council , who is the greatest man in europe hands . ”[312-he] [He]312-he was silent and even pale for a moment , and then resumed — “ But whenever [he]2068-the president of the central anarchist council , who is the greatest man in europe gives advice it is always something as startling as an epigram , and yet as practical as [the Bank of [England]13-england]2074-the bank of england . [I]85-syme said to [him]312-he , ‘ What disguise will hide [me]85-syme from [the world]231-the world ? What can [I]85-syme find more respectable than [bishops]2051-bishops and [majors]2067-majors ? ’ [He]312-he looked at [me]85-syme with [his]312-he large but indecipherable face . ‘ [You]85-syme want a safe disguise , do [you]85-syme ? [You]85-syme want a dress which will guarantee [you]85-syme harmless ; a dress in which [no one]2078-no one would ever look for a bomb ? ’ [I]85-syme nodded . [He]312-he suddenly lifted [his]312-he lion ’s voice . ‘ Why , then , dress up as [an anarchist]1937-an anarchist , [[you]85-syme fool]2080-you fool ! ’ [he]312-he roared so that [the room]292-the room shook . ‘ [Nobody]2082-nobody will ever expect [you]85-syme to do anything dangerous then . ’ And [he]312-he turned [his]312-he broad back on [me]85-syme without another word . [I]85-syme took [his]312-he advice , and have never regretted it . [I]85-syme preached blood and murder to [those women]2083-those women day and night , and — by [God!—they]99-god!—they would let [me]85-syme wheel [[their]2083-those women perambulators]2084-their perambulators . ”[85-syme] [Syme]85-syme sat watching [him]313-he with some respect in [his]313-he large , blue eyes . “ [You]85-syme took [me]313-he in , ”[313-he] [he]313-he said . “ It is really a smart dodge . ”[313-he] Then after a pause [he]313-he added — “ What do [you]85-syme call [this tremendous President of [yours]85-syme]2085-this tremendous president of yours ? ”[313-he] “ [We]2086-we generally call [him]316-him Sunday , ”[106-gregory] replied [Gregory]106-gregory with simplicity . ‘ [You]314-you see , there are [seven members of the [Central Anarchist Council]14-central anarchist council]315-seven members of the central anarchist council , and [they]315-seven members of the central anarchist council are named after days of the week . [He]316-him is called Sunday , by some of [[his]316-him admirers]317-his admirers Bloody Sunday . It is curious [you]314-you should mention the matter , because the very night [you]314-you have dropped in ( if [I]0-i may so express it ) is the night on which [[our]318-our [London]2-london branch]319-our london branch , which assembles in [this room]320-this room , has to elect [[its]319-our london branch own deputy to fill a vacancy in [the Council]322-the council]321-its own deputy to fill a vacancy in the council . [The gentleman who has for some time past played , with propriety and general applause , the difficult part of Thursday]323-the gentleman who has for some time past played , with propriety and general applause , the difficult part of thursday , has died quite suddenly . Consequently , [we]318-our have called a meeting this very evening to elect [a successor]324-a successor . ” [He]0-i got to [his]0-i feet and strolled across [the room]292-the room with a sort of smiling embarrassment . “[0-i] [I]0-i feel somehow as if [you]314-you were [[my]0-i mother]325-my mother , [Syme]85-syme , ” [he]0-i continued casually . “[314-you] [I]0-i feel that [I]0-i can confide anything to [you]314-you , as [you]314-you have promised to tell [nobody]2082-nobody . In fact , [I]0-i will confide to [you]314-you something that [I]0-i would not say in so many words to [the anarchists who will be coming to [the room]292-the room]327-the anarchists who will be coming to the room in about ten minutes . [We]329-we shall , of course , go through a form of election ; but [I]0-i do n’t mind telling [you]314-you that it is practically certain what the result will be . ” [He]0-i looked down for a moment modestly . “[0-i] It is almost a settled thing that [I]0-i am to be Thursday . ” “[1981-my dear fellow] [[My]0-i dear fellow]1981-my dear fellow . ” said [Syme]85-syme heartily , “[1981-my dear fellow] [I]0-i congratulate [you]0-i . A great career ! ” [Gregory]106-gregory smiled in deprecation , and walked across [the room]292-the room , talking rapidly . “[0-i] As a matter of fact , everything is ready for [me]0-i on this table , ” [he]0-i said , “[0-i] and the ceremony will probably be the shortest possible . ” [Syme]85-syme also strolled across to the table , and found lying across it a walking‑stick , which turned out on examination to be a sword‑stick , a large Colt ’s revolver , a sandwich case , and a formidable flask of brandy . Over the chair , beside the table , was thrown a heavy‑looking cape or cloak . “[0-i] [I]0-i have only to get the form of election finished , ” continued [Gregory]106-gregory with animation , “[0-i] then [I]0-i snatch up this cloak and stick , stuff these other things into [my]0-i pocket , step out of a door in [this cavern]331-this cavern , which opens on [the river]285-the river , where there is a steam‑tug already waiting for [me]0-i , and then — then — oh , the wild joy of being [Thursday]100-thursday ! ” And [he]0-i clasped [his]0-i hands . [Syme]85-syme , who had sat down once more with [his]85-syme usual insolent languor , got to [his]85-syme feet with an unusual air of hesitation . “[100-thursday] Why is it , ” [he]85-syme asked vaguely , “[0-i] that [I]0-i think [you]0-i are quite [a decent fellow]333-a decent fellow ? Why do [I]0-i positively like [you]0-i , [Gregory]106-gregory ? ” [He]85-syme paused a moment , and then added with a sort of fresh curiosity , “[0-i] Is it because [you]0-i are such [an ass]334-an ass ? ” There was a thoughtful silence again , and then [he]0-i cried out — “[334-an ass] Well , damn it all ! this is the funniest situation [I]0-i have ever been in in [my]0-i life , and [I]0-i am going to act accordingly . [Gregory]106-gregory , [I]0-i gave [you]106-gregory a promise before [I]0-i came into [this place]2029-this place . That promise [I]0-i would keep under red‑hot pincers . Would [you]106-gregory give [me]0-i , for [my]0-i own safety , a little promise of the same kind ? ” “[106-gregory] A promise ? ” asked [Gregory]106-gregory , wondering . “[106-gregory] Yes , ” said [Syme]85-syme very seriously , “[106-gregory] a promise . BEFORE one of the fresh faces could appear at the doorway , [Gregory]106-gregory ’s stunned surprise had fallen from [him]339-you . [He]339-you was beside the table with a bound , and a noise in [his]339-you throat like a wild beast . [He]339-you caught up [the Colt]103-the colt ’s revolver and took aim at [Syme]85-syme . Yes , and [jolly sea‑sick]104-jolly sea‑sick . ” [Gregory]106-gregory could not speak , but [he]85-syme could not fire either , and [he]85-syme looked [his]85-syme question . “[104-jolly sea‑sick] Do n’t [you]339-you see [we]347-we ’ve checkmated [each other]349-each other ? ” cried [Syme]85-syme . “[339-you] [I]0-i ca n’t tell [the police]2007-the police [you]339-you are [an anarchist]1937-an anarchist . [You]339-you ca n’t tell [the anarchists]337-the anarchists [I]0-i ’m [a policeman]353-a policeman . Here are [[your]339-you friends]345-your friends . ” [The mass of [the anarchists]337-the anarchists]2094-the mass of the anarchists entered [the room]292-the room heavily , with a slouching and somewhat weary gait ; but [one little man , with a black beard and glasses]2097-one little man , with a black beard and glasses — [a man somewhat of the type of [Mr. Tim Healy]105-mr. tim healy]2098-a man somewhat of the type of mr. tim healy — detached [himself]2097-one little man , with a black beard and glasses , and bustled forward with some papers in [his]2097-one little man , with a black beard and glasses hand . “[345-your friends] [Comrade Gregory]106-gregory , ” [he]0-i said , “[106-gregory] [I]0-i suppose [this man]360-this man is [a delegate]361-a delegate ? ” [Gregory]106-gregory , taken by surprise , looked down and muttered the name of [Syme]85-syme ; but [Syme]85-syme replied almost pertly — “[361-a delegate] [I]0-i am glad to see that [[your]106-gregory gate]362-your gate is well enough guarded to make it hard for [anyone]363-anyone to be here who was not [a delegate]361-a delegate . ” The brow of [the little man with the black beard]2099-the little man with the black beard was , however , still contracted with something like suspicion . “[0-i] What branch do [you]106-gregory represent ? ” [he]0-i asked sharply . “[106-gregory] [I]0-i should hardly call it a branch , ” said [Syme]85-syme , laughing ; “[0-i] [I]0-i should call it at the very least a root . ” “[106-gregory] What do [you]106-gregory mean ? ” “[106-gregory] The fact is , ” said [Syme]85-syme serenely , “[106-gregory] the truth is [I]0-i am [a Sabbatarian]365-a sabbatarian . Evidently the awful President , whose name was [Sunday]107-sunday , did sometimes send down [such irregular ambassadors]2102-such irregular ambassadors to [such branch meetings]2103-such branch meetings . “[0-i] Well , [comrade]366-comrade , ” said [the man with the papers]2104-the man with the papers after a pause , “[366-comrade] [I]0-i suppose [we]367-we ’d better give [you]366-comrade a seat in the meeting ? ” “[367-we] If [you]366-comrade ask [my]0-i advice as [a friend]368-a friend , ” said [Syme]85-syme with severe benevolence , “[366-comrade] [I]0-i think [you]366-comrade ’d better . ” When [Gregory]106-gregory heard the dangerous dialogue end , with a sudden safety for [[his]2100-the little man rival]2105-his rival , [he]2100-the little man rose abruptly and paced the floor in painful thought . [He]2100-the little man was , indeed , in an agony of diplomacy . It was clear that [Syme]85-syme ’s inspired impudence was likely to bring [him]2100-the little man out of all merely accidental dilemmas . Little was to be hoped from [them]2106-them . [He]2100-the little man could not [himself]2100-the little man betray [Syme]85-syme , partly from honour , but partly also because , if [he]2100-the little man betrayed [him]85-syme and for some reason failed to destroy [him]85-syme , [the Syme who escaped]2107-the syme who escaped would be [a Syme freed from all obligation of secrecy]2108-a syme freed from all obligation of secrecy , [a Syme who would simply walk to [the nearest police station]2110-the nearest police station]2109-a syme who would simply walk to the nearest police station . [He]0-i would let out as little as possible of [their]369-we plans that night , and then let [Syme]85-syme go , and chance it . [He]0-i strode across to [the group of anarchists]2112-the group of anarchists , which was already distributing itself along the benches . “[0-i] [I]0-i think it is time [we]369-we began , ” [he]0-i said ; “[0-i] [the steam‑tug]370-the steam‑tug is waiting on [the river]285-the river already . [I]0-i move that [Comrade Buttons]108-comrade buttons takes the chair . ” This being approved by a show of hands , [the little man with the papers]2113-the little man with the papers slipped into the presidential seat . “[372-comrades] [Comrades]372-comrades , ” [he]0-i began , as sharp as a pistol‑shot , “[372-comrades] [our]369-we meeting to‑night is important , though it need not be long . [This branch]373-this branch has always had the honour of electing Thursdays for [the Central European Council]16-the central european council . [We]369-we have elected many and splendid Thursdays . [We]369-we all lament the sad decease of [the heroic worker who occupied the post until last week]374-the heroic worker who occupied the post until last week . As [you]375-you know , [his]374-the heroic worker who occupied the post until last week services to the cause were considerable . [He]374-the heroic worker who occupied the post until last week organised the great dynamite coup of [Brighton]17-brighton which , under happier circumstances , ought to have killed [everybody]376-everybody on [the pier]377-the pier . As [you]375-you also know , [his]374-the heroic worker who occupied the post until last week death was as self - denying as [his]374-the heroic worker who occupied the post until last week life , for [he]374-the heroic worker who occupied the post until last week died through [his]374-the heroic worker who occupied the post until last week faith in a hygienic mixture of chalk and water as a substitute for milk , which beverage [he]374-the heroic worker who occupied the post until last week regarded as barbaric , and as involving cruelty to the cow . Cruelty , or anything approaching to cruelty , revolted [him]374-the heroic worker who occupied the post until last week always . But it is not to acclaim [his]374-the heroic worker who occupied the post until last week virtues that [we]369-we are met , but for a harder task . It is difficult properly to praise [his]374-the heroic worker who occupied the post until last week qualities , but it is more difficult to replace them . Upon [you]375-you , [comrades]372-comrades , it devolves this evening to choose out of the company present [the man who shall be Thursday]379-the man who shall be thursday . If [any comrade]380-any comrade suggests a name [I]0-i will put it to the vote . If [no comrade]381-no comrade suggests a name , [I]0-i can only tell [myself]0-i that [that dear dynamiter , who is gone from [us]369-we , has carried into the unknowable abysses the last secret of [his]374-the heroic worker who occupied the post until last week virtue and [his]374-the heroic worker who occupied the post until last week innocence]382-that dear dynamiter , who is gone from us , has carried into the unknowable abysses the last secret of his virtue and his innocence . ” There was a stir of almost inaudible applause , such as is sometimes heard in [church]2114-church . Then [a large old man]2115-a large old man , with a long and venerable white beard , perhaps [the only real working‑man present]2116-the only real working‑man present , rose lumberingly and said — “[0-i] [I]0-i move that [Comrade Gregory]106-gregory be elected Thursday , ” and sat lumberingly down again . “[363-anyone] Does [anyone]363-anyone second ? ” asked [the chairman]2117-the chairman . [A little man with a velvet coat and pointed beard seconded]2118-a little man with a velvet coat and pointed beard seconded . “[363-anyone] Before [I]0-i put the matter to the vote , ” said [the chairman]2117-the chairman , “[0-i] [I]0-i will call on [Comrade Gregory]106-gregory to make a statement . ” [Gregory]106-gregory rose amid a great rumble of applause . [His]2115-a large old man face was deadly pale , so that by contrast [his]2115-a large old man queer red hair looked almost scarlet . But [he]2115-a large old man was smiling and altogether at ease . [He]2115-a large old man had made up [his]2115-a large old man mind , and [he]2115-a large old man saw [his]2115-a large old man best policy quite plain in front of [him]2115-a large old man like [a white road]2120-a white road . [His]2115-a large old man best chance was to make a softened and ambiguous speech , such as would leave on [the detective]2121-the detective ’s mind the impression that [the anarchist brotherhood]2122-the anarchist brotherhood was a very mild affair after all . [He]2115-a large old man believed in [his]2115-a large old man own literary power , [his]2115-a large old man capacity for suggesting fine shades and picking perfect words . [He]2115-a large old man thought that with care [he]2115-a large old man could succeed , in spite of all [the people around [him]2115-a large old man]2123-the people around him , in conveying an impression of the institution , subtly and delicately false . [Syme]85-syme had once thought that [anarchists]2124-anarchists , under all [their]2124-anarchists bravado , were only playing [the fool]2125-the fool . Could [he]85-syme not now , in the hour of peril , make [Syme]85-syme think so again ? “[372-comrades] [Comrades]372-comrades , ” began [Gregory]106-gregory , in a low but penetrating voice , “[372-comrades] it is not necessary for [me]0-i to tell [you]372-comrades what is [my]0-i policy , for it is [your]372-comrades policy also . [Our]385-we belief has been slandered , it has been disfigured , it has been utterly confused and concealed , but it has never been altered . [Those who talk about anarchism and its dangers]386-those who talk about anarchism and its dangers go everywhere and anywhere to get [their]386-those who talk about anarchism and its dangers information , except to [us]385-we , except to the fountain head . [They]386-those who talk about anarchism and its dangers learn about [anarchists]2124-anarchists from sixpenny novels ; [they]386-those who talk about anarchism and its dangers learn about [anarchists]2124-anarchists from [tradesmen]389-tradesmen ’s newspapers ; [they]386-those who talk about anarchism and its dangers learn about [anarchists]2124-anarchists from Ally Sloper ’s Half‑Holiday and the Sporting Times . [They]386-those who talk about anarchism and its dangers never learn about [anarchists]2124-anarchists from [anarchists]2124-anarchists . [We]385-we have no chance of denying the mountainous slanders which are heaped upon [our]385-we heads from [one end of [Europe]12-europe]393-one end of europe to another . [The man who has always heard that [we]385-we are walking plagues]394-the man who has always heard that we are walking plagues has never heard [our]385-we reply . [I]0-i know that [he]394-the man who has always heard that we are walking plagues will not hear it to­night , though [my]0-i passion were to rend the roof . For it is deep , deep under [the earth]234-the earth that [the persecuted]396-the persecuted are permitted to assemble , as [the Christians]397-the christians assembled in [the Catacombs]398-the catacombs . But if , by some incredible accident , there were here to‑night [a man who all [his]399-a man who all his life life]399-a man who all his life had thus immensely misunderstood [us]385-we , [I]0-i would put this question to [him]399-a man who all his life : ‘ When [those Christians]400-those christians met in [those Catacombs]401-those catacombs , what sort of moral reputation had [they]400-those christians in [the streets]402-the streets above ? What tales were told of [their]400-those christians atrocities by [one educated Roman to another]403-one educated roman to another ? Suppose ’ ( [I]0-i would say to [him]399-a man who all his life ) , ‘ suppose that [we]385-we are only repeating that still mysterious paradox of history . Suppose [we]385-we seem as shocking as [the Christians]397-the christians because [we]385-we are really as harmless as [the Christians]109-the christians . Suppose [we]385-we seem as mad as [the Christians]109-the christians because [we]385-we are really as meek . ” ’ The applause that had greeted the opening sentences had been gradually growing fainter , and at the last word it stopped suddenly . In the abrupt silence , [the man with the velvet jacket]2126-the man with the velvet jacket said , in a high , squeaky voice — “[385-we] [I]0-i ’m not meek ! ” “[110-comrade witherspoon] [Comrade Witherspoon]110-comrade witherspoon tells [us]385-we , ” resumed [Gregory]106-gregory , “[110-comrade witherspoon] that [he]110-comrade witherspoon is not meek . Ah , how little [he]110-comrade witherspoon knows [himself]110-comrade witherspoon ! [His]110-comrade witherspoon words are , indeed , extravagant ; [his]110-comrade witherspoon appearance is ferocious , and even ( to an ordinary taste ) unattractive . But only the eye of a friendship as deep and delicate as [mine]0-i can perceive the deep foundation of solid meekness which lies at the base of [him]110-comrade witherspoon , too deep even for [himself]110-comrade witherspoon to see . [I]0-i repeat , [we]385-we are [the true early Christians]405-the true early christians , only that [we]385-we come too late . [We]385-we are simple , as [they]405-the true early christians revere simple — look at [Comrade Witherspoon]110-comrade witherspoon . [We]385-we are modest , as [they]405-the true early christians were modest — look at [me]0-i . [We]385-we are merciful — ” “[385-we] No , no ! ” called out [Mr. Witherspoon]111-mr. witherspoon with the velvet jacket . “[0-i] [I]0-i say [we]385-we are merciful , ” repeated [Gregory]106-gregory furiously , “[0-i] as [the early Christians]406-the early christians were merciful . Yet this did not prevent [their]406-the early christians being accused of eating human flesh . [We]385-we do not eat human flesh — ” “[385-we] Shame ! ” cried [Witherspoon]111-mr. witherspoon . “[385-we] Why not ? ” “[110-comrade witherspoon] [Comrade Witherspoon]110-comrade witherspoon , ” said [Gregory]106-gregory , with a feverish gaiety , “[110-comrade witherspoon] is anxious to know why [nobody]2082-nobody eats [him]110-comrade witherspoon ( laughter ) . In [our]385-we society , at any rate , which loves [him]110-comrade witherspoon sincerely , which is founded upon love — ” “[110-comrade witherspoon] No , no ! ” said [Witherspoon]110-comrade witherspoon , “[110-comrade witherspoon] down with love . ” “[110-comrade witherspoon] Which is founded upon love , ” repeated [Gregory]106-gregory , grinding [his]0-i teeth , “[110-comrade witherspoon] there will be no difficulty about the aims which [we]385-we shall pursue as a body , or which [I]0-i should pursue were [I]0-i chosen as [the representative of that body]408-the representative of that body . Superbly careless of the slanders that represent [us]385-we as [assassins and enemies of human society]409-assassins and enemies of human society , [we]385-we shall pursue with moral courage and quiet intellectual pressure , the permanent ideals of brotherhood and simplicity . ” [Gregory]106-gregory resumed [his]0-i seat and passed [his]0-i hand across [his]0-i forehead . The silence was sudden and awkward , but [the chairman]2117-the chairman rose like [an automaton]2128-an automaton , and said in a colourless voice — “[363-anyone] Does [anyone]363-anyone oppose the election of [Comrade Gregory]106-gregory ? ” [The assembly]2129-the assembly seemed vague and sub‑consciously disappointed , and [Comrade Witherspoon]110-comrade witherspoon moved restlessly on [his]110-comrade witherspoon seat and muttered in [his]110-comrade witherspoon thick beard . By the sheer rush of routine , however , the motion would have been put and carried . But as [the chairman]2117-the chairman was opening [his]2117-the chairman mouth to put it , [Syme]85-syme sprang to [his]85-syme feet and said in a small and quiet voice — “[363-anyone] Yes , [Mr. Chairman]112-mr. chairman , [I]0-i oppose . ” The most effective fact in oratory is an unexpected change in the voice . [Mr. Gabriel Syme]85-syme evidently understood oratory . Having said these first formal words in a moderated tone and with a brief simplicity , [he]85-syme made [his]85-syme next word ring and volley in [the vault]2131-the vault as if one of the guns had gone off . “[372-comrades] [Comrades]372-comrades ! ” [he]85-syme cried , in a voice that made [every man]2132-every man jump out of [his]2132-every man boots , “[112-mr. chairman] have [we]372-comrades come here for this ? Do [we]372-comrades live underground like rats in order to listen to talk like this ? This is talk [we]372-comrades might listen to while eating buns at [a Sunday School treat]412-a sunday school treat . Do [we]372-comrades line these walls with weapons and bar that door with death lest [anyone]363-anyone should come and hear [Comrade Gregory]106-gregory saying to [us]372-comrades , ‘ Be good , and [you]372-comrades will be happy , ’ ‘ Honesty is the best policy , ’ and ‘ Virtue is its own reward ’ ? There was not a word in [Comrade Gregory]106-gregory ’s address to which [a curate]2092-a curate could not have listened with pleasure ( hear , hear ) . But [I]0-i am not [a curate]2092-a curate ( loud cheers ) , and [I]0-i did not listen to it with pleasure ( renewed cheers ) . [The man who is fitted to make a good curate]416-the man who is fitted to make a good curate is not fitted to make [a resolute , forcible , and efficient Thursday ( hear , hear )]417-a resolute , forcible , and efficient thursday ( hear , hear ) . ” “[106-gregory] [Comrade Gregory]106-gregory has told [us]372-comrades , in only too apologetic a tone , that [we]372-comrades are not [the enemies of society]418-the enemies of society . But [I]0-i say that [we]372-comrades are the enemies of society , and so much the worse for society . [We]372-comrades are [the enemies of society]418-the enemies of society , for society is [the enemy of humanity]420-the enemy of humanity , [[its]420-the enemy of humanity oldest and its most pitiless enemy]421-its oldest and its most pitiless enemy ( hear , hear ) . [Comrade Gregory]106-gregory has told [us]372-comrades ( apologetically again ) that [we]372-comrades are not [murderers]422-murderers . There [I]0-i agree . [We]372-comrades are not [murderers]422-murderers , [we]372-comrades are [executioners ( cheers )]424-executioners ( cheers ) . ” Ever since [Syme]85-syme had risen [Gregory]106-gregory had sat staring at [him]85-syme , [his]85-syme face idiotic with astonishment . Now in the pause [his]85-syme lips of clay parted , and [he]85-syme said , with an automatic and lifeless distinctness — “[106-gregory] [[You]106-gregory damnable hypocrite]425-you damnable hypocrite ! ” [Syme]85-syme looked straight into those frightful eyes with [his]85-syme own pale blue ones , and said with dignity — “[106-gregory] [Comrade Gregory]106-gregory accuses [me]0-i of hypocrisy . [He]426-he knows as well as [I]0-i do that [I]0-i am keeping all [my]0-i engagements and doing nothing but [my]0-i duty . [I]0-i do not mince words . [I]0-i do not pretend to . [I]0-i say that [Comrade Gregory]106-gregory is unfit to be [Thursday]100-thursday for all [his]426-he amiable qualities . [He]426-he is unfit to be [Thursday]100-thursday because of [his]426-he amiable qualities . [We]427-we do not want [the Supreme Council of Anarchy]428-the supreme council of anarchy in­fected with a maudlin mercy ( hear , hear ) . This is no time for ceremonial politeness , neither is it a time for ceremonial modesty . [I]0-i set [myself]0-i against [Comrade Gregory]106-gregory as [I]0-i would set [myself]0-i against [all the Governments of [Europe]12-europe]429-all the governments of europe , because [the anarchist who has given [himself]430-the anarchist who has given himself to anarchy to anarchy]430-the anarchist who has given himself to anarchy has forgotten modesty as much as [he]430-the anarchist who has given himself to anarchy has forgotten pride ( cheers ) . [I]0-i am not [a man]221-a man at all . [I]0-i am a cause ( renewed cheers ) . [I]0-i set [myself]0-i against [Comrade Gregory]106-gregory as impersonally and as calmly as [I]0-i should choose one pistol rather than another out of that rack upon the wall ; and [I]0-i say that rather than have [Gregory]106-gregory and [his]432-his milk‑and‑water methods on [the Supreme Council]433-the supreme council , [I]0-i would offer [myself]0-i for election — ” [His]0-i sentence was drowned in a deafening cataract of applause . The faces , that had grown fiercer and fiercer with approval as [his]0-i tirade grew more and more uncompromising , were now distorted with grins of anticipa­tion or cloven with delighted cries . At the moment when [he]0-i announced [himself]0-i as ready to stand for the post of Thursday , a roar of excitement and assent broke forth , and became uncontrollable , and at the same moment [Gregory]106-gregory sprang to [his]0-i feet , with foam upon [his]0-i mouth , and shouted against the shouting . “[0-i] Stop , [[you]106-gregory blasted madmen]434-you blasted madmen ! ” [he]0-i cried , at the top of a voice that tore [his]0-i throat . “[106-gregory] Stop , [you]106-gregory — ” But louder than [Gregory]106-gregory ’s shouting and louder than the roar of [the room]292-the room came the voice of [Syme]85-syme , still speaking in a peal of pitiless thunder — “[106-gregory] [I]0-i do not go to [the Council]322-the council to rebut that slander that calls [us]436-us [murderers]422-murderers ; [I]0-i go to earn it ( loud and prolonged cheering ) . To [the priest who says [these men]439-these men]438-the priest who says these men are [the enemies of religion]440-the enemies of religion , to [the judge]441-the judge who says [these men]439-these men are [the enemies of law]443-the enemies of law , to [the fat parliamentarian who says [these men]439-these men]444-the fat parliamentarian who says these men are [the enemies of order and public decency]446-the enemies of order and public decency , to all these [I]0-i will reply , ‘ [You]447-you are [false kings]448-false kings , but [you]447-you are [true prophets]449-true prophets . [I]0-i am come to destroy [you]447-you , and to fulfil [your]447-you prophecies . ’ ” The heavy clamour gradually died away , but before it had ceased [Witherspoon]110-comrade witherspoon had jumped to [his]110-comrade witherspoon feet , [his]110-comrade witherspoon hair and beard all on end , and had said — “[0-i] [I]0-i move , as an amendment , that [Comrade Syme]113-syme be appointed to the post . ” “[113-syme] Stop all this , [I]0-i tell [you]447-you ! ” cried [Gregory]106-gregory , with frantic face and hands . “[0-i] Stop it , it is all — ” The voice of [the chairman]2117-the chairman clove [his]0-i speech with a cold accent . “[0-i] Does [anyone]363-anyone second this amendment ? ” [he]0-i said . [A tall , tired man , with melancholy eyes and an American chin beard]2135-a tall , tired man , with melancholy eyes and an american chin beard , was observed on the back bench to be slowly rising to [his]2135-a tall , tired man , with melancholy eyes and an american chin beard feet . [Gregory]106-gregory had been screaming for some time past ; now there was a change in [his]0-i accent , more shocking than any scream . “[0-i] [I]0-i end all this ! ” [he]0-i said , in a voice as heavy as stone . “[0-i] [This man]360-this man can not be elected . [He]360-this man is a — ” “[360-this man] Yes , ” said [Syme]113-syme , quite motionless , “[360-this man] what is [he]360-this man ? ” [Gregory]106-gregory ’s mouth worked twice without sound ; then slowly the blood began to crawl back into [his]0-i dead face . “[360-this man] [He]360-this man is [a man quite inexperienced in [our]453-our work]452-a man quite inexperienced in our work , ” [he]0-i said , and sat down abruptly .
