Before [he]0-i had done so , [the long , lean man with the American beard]2136-the long , lean man with the american beard was again upon [his]2136-the long , lean man with the american beard feet , and was repeating in a high American monotone — “[360-this man] [I]0-i beg to second the election of [Comrade Syme]113-syme . ” “[0-i] The amendment will , as usual , be put first , ” said [Mr. Buttons]114-mr. buttons , [the chairman]2117-the chairman , with mechanical rapidity . “[0-i] The question is that [Comrade Syme]113-syme — ” [Gregory]106-gregory had again sprung to [his]0-i feet , panting and passionate . “[372-comrades] [Comrades]372-comrades , ” [he]0-i cried out , “[0-i] [I]0-i am not [a madman]455-a madman . ” “[0-i] Oh , oh ! ” said [Mr. Witherspoon]111-mr. witherspoon . “[0-i] [I]0-i am not [a madman]455-a madman , ” reiterated [Gregory]106-gregory , with a frightful sincerity which for a moment staggered [the room]292-the room , “[455-a madman] but [I]0-i give [you]372-comrades a counsel which [you]372-comrades can call mad if [you]372-comrades like . No , [I]0-i will not call it a counsel , for [I]0-i can give [you]372-comrades no reason for it . [I]0-i will call it a command . Call it a mad command , but act upon it . Strike , but hear [me]0-i ! Kill [me]0-i , but obey [me]0-i ! Do not elect [this man]360-this man . ” Truth is so terrible , even in fetters , that for a moment [Syme]113-syme ’s slender and insane victory swayed like a reed . But [you]372-comrades could not have guessed it from [Syme]113-syme ’s bleak blue eyes . [He]113-syme merely began — “[106-gregory] [Comrade Gregory]106-gregory commands — ” Then the spell was snapped , and [one anarchist]2139-one anarchist called out to [Gregory]106-gregory — “[106-gregory] Who are [you]106-gregory ? [You]106-gregory are not [Sunday]107-sunday ” ; and [another anarchist]2140-another anarchist added in a heavier voice , “[106-gregory] And [you]106-gregory are not [Thursday]100-thursday . ” “[372-comrades] [Comrades]372-comrades , ” cried [Gregory]106-gregory , in a voice like that of [a martyr who in an ecstacy of pain has passed beyond pain]2141-a martyr who in an ecstacy of pain has passed beyond pain , “[372-comrades] it is nothing to [me]0-i whether [you]372-comrades detest [me]0-i as [a tyrant]459-a tyrant or detest [me]0-i as [a slave]460-a slave . If [you]372-comrades will not take [my]0-i command , accept [my]0-i degradation . [I]0-i kneel to [you]106-gregory . [I]0-i throw [myself]0-i at [your]106-gregory feet . [I]0-i implore [you]106-gregory . Do not elect [this man]360-this man . ” “[106-gregory] [Comrade Gregory]106-gregory , ” said [the chairman]2117-the chairman after a painful pause , “[106-gregory] this is really not quite dignified . ” For the first time in the proceedings there was for a few seconds a real silence . Then [Gregory]106-gregory fell back in [his]0-i seat , [a pale wreck of a man]2143-a pale wreck of a man , and [the chairman]2117-the chairman repeated , like a piece of clock‑work suddenly started again — “[106-gregory] The question is that [Comrade Syme]113-syme be elected to the post of Thursday on the General Council . ” The roar rose like [the sea]2145-the sea , the hands rose like [a forest]2146-a forest , and three minutes afterwards [Mr. Gabriel Syme]85-syme , of [the Secret Police Service]2147-the secret police service , was elected to the post of Thursday on [the General Council of [the Anarchists of [Europe]12-europe]2149-the anarchists of europe]2148-the general council of the anarchists of europe . [[Everyone]271-everyone in [the room]292-the room]2151-everyone in the room seemed to feel the tug waiting on [the river]285-the river , the sword‑stick and the revolver , waiting on the table . The instant the election was ended and irrevocable , and [Syme]113-syme had received the paper proving [his]113-syme election , [they]271-everyone all sprang to [their]271-everyone feet , and [the fiery groups]2154-the fiery groups moved and mixed in [the room]292-the room . [Syme]113-syme found [himself]113-syme , somehow or other , face to face with [Gregory]106-gregory , who still regarded [him]113-syme with a stare of stunned hatred . [They]2156-they were silent for many minutes . “[113-syme] [You]462-you are [a devil]463-a devil ! ” said [Gregory]106-gregory at last . “[462-you] And [you]462-you are [a gentleman]2023-a gentleman , ” said [Syme]113-syme with gravity . “[462-you] It was [you]462-you that entrapped [me]0-i , ” began [Gregory]106-gregory , shaking from head to foot , “[462-you] entrapped [me]0-i into — ” “[462-you] Talk sense , ” said [Syme]113-syme shortly . “[462-you] Into what sort of [devils ’ parliament]465-devils ’ parliament have [you]462-you entrapped [me]0-i , if it comes to that ? [You]462-you made [me]0-i swear before [I]0-i made [you]462-you . Perhaps [we]466-we are both doing what [we]466-we think right . But what [we]466-we think right is so damned different that there can be nothing between [us]466-we in the way of concession . There is nothing possible between [us]466-we but honour and death , ” and [he]0-i pulled the great cloak about [his]0-i shoulders and picked up the flask from the table . “[0-i] [The boat]467-the boat is quite ready , ” said [Mr. Buttons]114-mr. buttons , bustling up . “[0-i] Be good enough to step this way . ” With a gesture that revealed [the shop - walker]2157-the shop - walker , [he]0-i led [Syme]113-syme down [a short , iron‑bound passage]2158-a short , iron‑bound passage , the still agonised [Gregory]106-gregory following feverishly at [their]466-we heels . At the end of [the passage]301-the passage was a door , which [Buttons]114-mr. buttons opened sharply , showing a sudden blue and silver picture of [the moonlit river]2160-the moonlit river , that looked like a scene in [a theatre]2161-a theatre . Close to the opening lay a dark , dwarfish steam - launch , like a baby dragon with one red eye . Almost in the act of stepping on board , [Gabriel Syme]85-syme turned to the gaping [Gregory]106-gregory . “[468-you] [You]468-you have kept [your]468-you word , ” [he]0-i said gently , with [his]0-i face in shadow . “[468-you] [You]468-you are [a man of honour]469-a man of honour , and [I]0-i thank [you]468-you . [You]468-you have kept it even down to a small particular . There was one special thing [you]468-you promised [me]0-i at the beginning of the affair , and which [you]468-you have certainly given [me]0-i by the end of it . ” “[468-you] What do [you]468-you mean ? ” cried the chaotic [Gregory]106-gregory . “[468-you] What did [I]0-i promise [you]468-you ? ” “[0-i] A very entertaining evening , ” said [Syme]85-syme , and [he]85-syme made a military salute with the sword‑stick as [the steamboat]2162-the steamboat slid away . [GABRIEL SYME]85-syme was not merely [a detective who pretended to be [a poet]197-a poet]2163-a detective who pretended to be a poet ; [he]85-syme was really [a poet who had become [a detective]2166-a detective]2165-a poet who had become a detective . Nor was [his]85-syme hatred of anarchy hypocritical . [He]85-syme was [one of those who are driven early in life into too conservative an attitude by the bewildering folly of [most revolutionists]2168-most revolutionists]2167-one of those who are driven early in life into too conservative an attitude by the bewildering folly of most revolutionists . [He]85-syme had not attained it by any tame tradition . [His]85-syme respectability was spontaneous and sudden , a rebellion against rebellion . [He]85-syme came of [a family of cranks]2169-a family of cranks , in which [all the oldest people]2170-all the oldest people had all the newest notions . [One of [[his]85-syme uncles]2172-his uncles]2171-one of his uncles always walked about without a hat , and another had made an unsuccessful attempt to walk about with a hat and nothing else . [[His]85-syme father]2173-his father cultivated art and self‑realisation ; [[his]85-syme mother]2174-his mother went in for simplicity and hygiene . Hence [the child]2175-the child , during [his]85-syme tenderer years , was wholly unacquainted with any drink between the extremes of absinth and cocoa , of both of which [he]85-syme had a healthy dislike . The more [[his]85-syme mother]2174-his mother preached a more than Puritan abstinence the more did [[his]85-syme father]2173-his father expand into a more than pagan latitude ; and by the time [the former]2178-the former had come to enforcing vegetarianism , [the latter]2179-the latter had pretty well reached the point of defending cannibalism . Being surrounded with every conceivable kind of revolt from infancy , [Gabriel]85-syme had to revolt into something , so [he]85-syme revolted into the only thing left — sanity . But there was just enough in [him]85-syme of the blood of [these fanatics]2180-these fanatics to make even [his]85-syme protest for common sense a little too fierce to be sensible . [His]85-syme hatred of modern lawlessness had been crowned also by an accident . It happened that [he]85-syme was walking in [a side street]2181-a side street at the instant of a dynamite outrage . [He]85-syme had been blind and deaf for a moment , and then seen , the smoke clearing , the broken windows and the bleeding faces . After that [he]85-syme went about as usual — quiet , courteous , rather gentle ; but there was a spot on [his]85-syme mind that was not sane . [He]85-syme did not regard [anarchists]2124-anarchists , as most of [us]2183-us do , as [a handful of [morbid men , combining ignorance with intellectualism]2185-morbid men , combining ignorance with intellectualism]2184-a handful of morbid men , combining ignorance with intellectualism . [He]85-syme regarded [them]2124-anarchists as a huge and pitiless peril , like a Chinese invasion . [He]85-syme poured perpetually into newspapers and [their]2124-anarchists waste‑paper baskets a torrent of tales , verses and violent articles , warning [men]214-men of this deluge of barbaric denial . But [he]85-syme seemed to be getting no nearer [[his]85-syme enemy]2187-his enemy , and , what was worse , no nearer a living . As [he]85-syme paced [the Thames embankment]2188-the thames embankment , bitterly biting a cheap cigar and brooding on the advance of Anarchy , there was [no anarchist with a bomb in [his]85-syme pocket so savage or so solitary as [he]85-syme]2189-no anarchist with a bomb in his pocket so savage or so solitary as he . Indeed , [he]85-syme always felt that [Government]115-government stood alone and desperate , with its back to the wall . [He]85-syme was too quixotic to have cared for it otherwise . [He]85-syme walked on [the Embankment]2190-the embankment once under a dark red sunset . [The red river]2191-the red river reflected the red sky , and [they]2192-they both reflected [his]85-syme anger . The sky , indeed , was so swarthy , and the light on [the river]285-the river relatively so lurid , that [the water]2194-the water almost seemed of fiercer flame than the sunset it mirrored . [It]2191-the red river looked like a stream of literal fire winding under [the vast caverns of [a subterranean country]2196-a subterranean country]2195-the vast caverns of a subterranean country . [Syme]85-syme was shabby in those days . [He]85-syme wore an old - fashioned black chimney‑pot hat ; [he]85-syme was wrapped in a yet more old‑fashioned cloak , black and ragged ; and the combination gave [him]85-syme the look of [the early villains in Dickens and [Bulwer Lytton]116-bulwer lytton]2197-the early villains in dickens and bulwer lytton . Also [his]85-syme yellow beard and hair were more unkempt and leonine than when they appeared long afterwards , cut and pointed , on [the lawns of [Saffron Park]1-saffron park]2198-the lawns of saffron park . A long , lean , black cigar , bought in [Soho]19-soho for twopence , stood out from between [his]85-syme tightened teeth , and altogether [he]85-syme looked a very satisfactory specimen of [the anarchists upon whom [he]85-syme had vowed a holy war]2199-the anarchists upon whom he had vowed a holy war . Perhaps this was why [a policeman on the Embankment]2200-a policeman on the embankment spoke to [him]85-syme , and said “[0-i] Good evening . ” [Syme]85-syme , at a crisis of [his]85-syme morbid fears for humanity , seemed stung by the mere stolidity of [the automatic official]2201-the automatic official , a mere bulk of blue in the twilight . “[0-i] A good evening is it ? ” [he]0-i said sharply . “[0-i] [[You]470-you fellows]471-you fellows would call the end of [the world]231-the world a good evening . Look at that bloody red sun and [that bloody river]473-that bloody river ! [I]0-i tell [you]470-you that if that were literally human blood , spilt and shining , [you]470-you would still be standing here as solid as ever , looking out for [some poor harmless tramp whom [you]470-you could move on]474-some poor harmless tramp whom you could move on . [[You]470-you policemen]475-you policemen are cruel to [the poor]476-the poor , but [I]0-i could forgive [you]470-you even [your]470-you cruelty if it were not for [your]470-you calm . ” “[0-i] If [we]477-we are calm , ” replied [the policeman]2202-the policeman , “[0-i] it is the calm of organised resistance . ” “[0-i] Eh ? ” said [Syme]85-syme , staring . “[0-i] [The soldier]478-the soldier must be calm in the thick of the battle , ” pursued [the policeman]2202-the policeman . “[478-the soldier] The composure of [an army]479-an army is the anger of [a nation]480-a nation . ” “[95-god] Good [God]95-god , [the Board Schools]481-the board schools ! ” said [Syme]85-syme . “[95-god] Is this undenominational education ? ” “[95-god] No , ” said [the policeman]2202-the policeman sadly , “[95-god] [I]0-i never had any of those advantages . [The Board Schools]20-the board schools came after [my]0-i time . What education [I]0-i had was very rough and old - fashioned , [I]0-i am afraid . ” “[0-i] Where did [you]0-i have it ? ” asked [Syme]85-syme , wondering . “[0-i] Oh , at [Harrow]21-harrow , ” said [[the policeman]2202-the policeman]2202-the policeman The class sympathies which , false as they are , are the truest things in [so many men]2207-so many men , broke out of [Syme]85-syme before [he]85-syme could control [them]2207-so many men . “[0-i] But , good Lord , [man]1959-man , ” [he]85-syme said , “[1959-man] [you]1959-man ought n’t to be [a policeman]353-a policeman ! ” [The policeman]2202-the policeman sighed and shook [his]2202-the policeman head . “[0-i] [I]0-i know , ” [he]2202-the policeman said solemnly , “[0-i] [I]0-i know [I]0-i am not worthy . ” “[0-i] But why did [you]0-i join [the police]2007-the police ? ” asked [Syme]85-syme with rude curiosity . “[0-i] For much the same reason that [you]0-i abused [the police]2007-the police , ” replied [the other]279-the other . “[0-i] [I]0-i found that there was a special opening in the service for [those whose fears for humanity were concerned rather with the aberrations of the scientific intellect]486-those whose fears for humanity were concerned rather with the aberrations of the scientific intellect than with the normal and excusable , though excessive , outbreaks of the human will . [I]0-i trust [I]0-i make [myself]0-i clear . ” “[0-i] If [you]0-i mean that [you]0-i make [your]0-i opinion clear , ” said [Syme]85-syme , “[0-i] [I]0-i suppose [you]0-i do . But as for making [yourself]0-i clear , it is the last thing [you]0-i do . How comes [a man like [you]0-i to be talking philosophy in a blue helmet on [the Thames embankment]2188-the thames embankment]487-a man like you to be talking philosophy in a blue helmet on the thames embankment ? “ [You]0-i have evidently not heard of the latest develop­ment in [[our]2210-our police system]2211-our police system , ”[279-the other] replied [the other]279-the other . “ [I]279-the other am not surprised at it . [We]2210-our are keeping it rather dark from [the educated class]2212-the educated class , because that class contains most of [[our]2210-our enemies]2213-our enemies . But [you]0-i seem to be exactly in the right frame of mind . [I]279-the other think [you]0-i might almost join [us]2210-our . ”[279-the other] “ Join [you]2202-the policeman in what ? ”[85-syme] asked [Syme]85-syme . “ [I]2202-the policeman will tell [you]0-i , ”[2202-the policeman] said [the policeman]2202-the policeman slowly . “ This is the situation : [The head of one of [[our]2210-our departments]2215-our departments]2214-the head of one of our departments , [one of [the most celebrated detectives in [Europe]12-europe]2217-the most celebrated detectives in europe]2216-one of the most celebrated detectives in europe , has long been of opinion that a purely intellectual conspiracy would soon threaten the very existence of civilisation . [He]2214-the head of one of our departments is certain that the scientific and artistic worlds are silently bound in a crusade against [the Family]2218-the family and [the State]2219-the state . [He]2214-the head of one of our departments has , therefore , formed [a special corps of [policemen]2221-policemen]2220-a special corps of policemen , [policemen who are also philosophers]2222-policemen who are also philosophers . It is [their]2220-a special corps of policemen business to watch the beginnings of this conspiracy , not merely in [a criminal]2223-a criminal but in a controversial sense . [I]2202-the policeman am [a democrat]2224-a democrat [myself]2202-the policeman , and [I]2202-the policeman am fully aware of the value of [the ordinary man]2225-the ordinary man in matters of ordinary valour or virtue . But it would obviously be undesirable to employ [the common policeman]2226-the common policeman in an investigation which is also a heresy hunt . ”[2202-the policeman] [Syme]85-syme ’s eyes were bright with a sympathetic curiosity . “ What do [you]491-the man in blue do , then ? ”[85-syme] [he]85-syme said . “ The work of [the philosophical policeman]2227-the philosophical policeman , ”[491-the man in blue] replied [the man in blue]491-the man in blue , “ is at once bolder and more subtle than that of [the ordinary detective]2228-the ordinary detective . [The ordinary detective]2228-the ordinary detective goes to [pot‑houses]2230-pot‑houses to arrest [thieves]2231-thieves ; [we]2232-we go to artistic tea‑parties to detect [pessimists]2233-pessimists . [The ordinary detective]2228-the ordinary detective discovers from a ledger or a diary that a crime has been committed . [We]2232-we discover from a book of sonnets that a crime will be committed . [We]2232-we have to trace the origin of those dreadful thoughts that drive [men]214-men on at last to intellectual fanaticism and intellectual crime . [We]2232-we were only just in time to prevent the assassination at [Hartle pool]22-hartle pool , and that was entirely due to the fact that [[our]2232-we Mr. [Wilks]117-wilks]2236-our mr. wilks ( [a smart young fellow]2237-a smart young fellow ) thoroughly understood a triolet . ”[491-the man in blue] “ Do [you]2202-the policeman mean , ”[85-syme] asked [Syme]85-syme , “ that there is really as much connection between crime and the modern intellect as all that ? ”[85-syme] “ [You]2202-the policeman are not sufficiently democratic , ”[2202-the policeman] answered [the policeman]2202-the policeman , “ but [you]2202-the policeman were right when [you]2202-the policeman said just now that [our]2232-we ordinary treatment of [the poor criminal]2238-the poor criminal was a pretty brutal business . [I]2202-the policeman tell [you]2202-the policeman [I]2202-the policeman am sometimes sick of [my]2202-the policeman trade when [I]2202-the policeman see how perpetually it means merely a war upon [the ignorant]2239-the ignorant and the desperate . But this new movement of [ours]2232-we is a very different affair . [We]2232-we deny the snobbish English assumption that [the uneducated]2240-the uneducated are [the dangerous criminals]2241-the dangerous criminals . [We]2232-we remember [the Roman Emperors]118-the roman emperors . [We]2232-we remember [the great poisoning princes of the Renaissance]2242-the great poisoning princes of the renaissance . [We]2232-we say that [the dangerous criminal]2243-the dangerous criminal is [the educated criminal]2244-the educated criminal . [We]2232-we say that [the most dangerous criminal]2245-the most dangerous criminal now is [the entirely lawless modern philosopher]2246-the entirely lawless modern philosopher . Compared to [him]2246-the entirely lawless modern philosopher , [burglars]2247-burglars and [bigamists]2248-bigamists are essentially [moral men]2249-moral men ; [my]2202-the policeman heart goes out to [them]2249-moral men . [They]2249-moral men accept the essential ideal of [man]1959-man ; [they]2249-moral men merely seek it wrongly . [Thieves]2231-thieves respect property . [They]2231-thieves merely wish the property to become [their]2231-thieves property that [they]2231-thieves may more perfectly respect it . But [philosophers]2252-philosophers dislike property as property ; [they]2252-philosophers wish to destroy the very idea of personal possession . [Bigamists]2248-bigamists respect marriage , or [they]2248-bigamists would not go through the highly ceremonial and even ritualistic formality of bigamy . But [philosophers]2252-philosophers despise marriage as marriage . [Murderers]119-murderers respect human life ; [they]119-murderers merely wish to attain a greater fulness of human life in [themselves]119-murderers by the sacrifice of what seems to [them]119-murderers to be lesser lives . But [philosophers]2252-philosophers hate life itself , [their]2252-philosophers own as much as [other people]2256-other people ’s . ”[2202-the policeman] [Syme]85-syme struck [his]85-syme hands together . “ How true that is , ”[85-syme] [he]85-syme cried . “ [I]85-syme have felt it from [my]85-syme boyhood , but never could state the verbal antithesis . [The common criminal]2257-the common criminal is [a bad man]2258-a bad man , but at least [he]2257-the common criminal is , as it were , [a conditional good man]2259-a conditional good man . [He]2257-the common criminal says that if only a certain obstacle be removed — say [a wealthy uncle]2260-a wealthy uncle — [he]2257-the common criminal is then prepared to accept [the universe]2261-the universe and to praise [God]95-god . [He]2257-the common criminal is [a reformer]2262-a reformer , but not [an anarchist]1937-an anarchist . [He]2257-the common criminal wishes to cleanse the edifice , but not to destroy it . But [the evil philosopher]2264-the evil philosopher is not trying to alter things , but to annihilate them . Yes , [the modern world]2265-the modern world has retained all those parts of police work which are really oppressive and ignominious , the harrying of [the poor]476-the poor , the spying upon [the unfortunate]2267-the unfortunate . [It]2265-the modern world has given up [its]2265-the modern world more dignified work , the punishment of [powerful traitors the in the State and powerful [heresiarchs in the Church]2269-heresiarchs in the church]2268-powerful traitors the in the state and powerful heresiarchs in the church . [The moderns]2270-the moderns say [we]2270-the moderns must not punish [heretics]2271-heretics . [My]85-syme only doubt is whether [we]2270-the moderns have a right to punish [anybody else]2272-anybody else . ”[85-syme] “ But this is absurd ! ”[2202-the policeman] cried [the policeman]2202-the policeman , clasping [his]2202-the policeman hands with an excitement uncommon in persons of [his]2202-the policeman figure and costume , “ but it is intolerable ! [I]2202-the policeman do n’t know what [you]2202-the policeman ’re doing , but [you]2202-the policeman ’re wasting [your]2202-the policeman life . [You]2202-the policeman must , [you]2202-the policeman shall , join [[our]2270-the moderns special army]2273-our special army against anarchy . [Their]2273-our special army armies are on [[our]2270-the moderns frontiers]2274-our frontiers . [Their]2273-our special army bolt is ready to fall . A moment more , and [you]2202-the policeman may lose the glory of working with [us]2270-the moderns , perhaps the glory of dying with [the last heroes of [the world]231-the world]2275-the last heroes of the world . ”[2202-the policeman] “ It is a chance not to be missed , certainly , ”[85-syme] assented [Syme]85-syme , “ but still [I]85-syme do not quite understand . [I]85-syme know as well as [anybody]2277-anybody that [the modern world]2265-the modern world is full of [lawless little men]2279-lawless little men and [mad little movements]2280-mad little movements . But , beastly as [they]2273-our special army are , [they]2273-our special army generally have the one merit of disagreeing with each other . How can [you]2202-the policeman talk of [[their]2273-our special army leading [one army]2282-one army]2281-their leading one army or hurling one bolt . What is this anarchy ? ”[85-syme] “ Do not confuse it , ”[494-the constable] replied [the constable]494-the constable , “ with those chance dynamite outbreaks from [Russia]23-russia or from [Ireland]24-ireland , which are really the outbreaks of [oppressed , if mistaken , men]2283-oppressed , if mistaken , men . This is [a vast philosophic movement , consisting of an outer and an inner ring]2284-a vast philosophic movement , consisting of an outer and an inner ring . [You]2202-the policeman might even call [the outer ring]2285-the outer ring [the laity]2286-the laity and [the inner ring the priesthood]2287-the inner ring the priesthood . [I]494-the constable prefer to call the outer ring [the innocent section]2288-the innocent section , [the inner ring the supremely guilty section]2289-the inner ring the supremely guilty section . The outer ring — [the main mass of [[their]2273-our special army supporters]2291-their supporters]2290-the main mass of their supporters — are merely [anarchists]2124-anarchists ; that is , [men who believe that rules and formulas]2293-men who believe that rules and formulas have destroyed human happiness . [They]2273-our special army believe that all the evil results of human crime are the results of the system that has called it crime . [They]2273-our special army do not believe that the crime creates the punishment . [They]2273-our special army believe that the punishment has created the crime . [They]2273-our special army believe that if [a man]221-a man seduced [seven women]2295-seven women [he]221-a man would naturally walk away as blameless as the flowers of spring . [They]2273-our special army believe that if [a man]221-a man picked a pocket [he]221-a man would naturally feel exquisitely good . These [I]494-the constable call [the innocent section]2288-the innocent section . ”[494-the constable] “ Oh ! ”[85-syme] said [Syme]85-syme . “ Naturally , therefore , [these people]2298-these people talk about ‘ a happy time coming ’ ; ‘ the paradise of the future ’ ; ‘ [mankind]2056-mankind freed from the bondage of vice and the bondage of virtue , ’ and so on . And so also [the men of the inner circle]2300-the men of the inner circle speak — the sacred priesthood . [They]2300-the men of the inner circle also speak to applauding [crowds of the happiness of the future]2301-crowds of the happiness of the future , and of [mankind]2056-mankind freed at last . But in [their]2300-the men of the inner circle mouths ”[85-syme] — and [the policeman]2202-the policeman lowered [his]2202-the policeman voice—“in [their]2300-the men of the inner circle mouths these happy phrases have a horrible meaning . [They]2300-the men of the inner circle are under no illusions ; [they]2300-the men of the inner circle are too intellectual to think that man upon [this earth]2303-this earth can ever be quite free of original sin and the struggle . And [they]2300-the men of the inner circle mean death . When [they]2300-the men of the inner circle say that mankind shall be free at last , [they]2300-the men of the inner circle mean that [mankind]2056-mankind shall commit suicide . When [they]2300-the men of the inner circle talk of a paradise without right or wrong , [they]2300-the men of the inner circle mean the grave . [They]2300-the men of the inner circle have but two objects , to destroy [first humanity]2305-first humanity and then [themselves]2300-the men of the inner circle . That is why [they]2300-the men of the inner circle throw bombs instead of firing pistols . [The innocent rank and file]2306-the innocent rank and file are disappointed because the bomb has not killed [the king]2307-the king ; but [the high - priesthood]2308-the high - priesthood are happy because it has killed [somebody]2309-somebody . ”[2202-the policeman] “ How can [I]85-syme join [you]2202-the policeman ? ”[85-syme] asked [Syme]85-syme , with a sort of passion . “ [I]2202-the policeman know for a fact that there is a vacancy at the moment , ”[2202-the policeman] said [the policeman]2202-the policeman , “ as [I]2202-the policeman have the honour to be somewhat in the confidence of [the chief of whom [I]2202-the policeman have spoken]2310-the chief of whom i have spoken . [You]85-syme should really come and see [him]2310-the chief of whom i have spoken . Or rather , [I]2202-the policeman should not say see [him]2310-the chief of whom i have spoken , [nobody]2082-nobody ever sees [him]2310-the chief of whom i have spoken ; but [you]85-syme can talk to [him]2310-the chief of whom i have spoken if [you]85-syme like . ”[2202-the policeman] “ Telephone ? ”[85-syme] inquired [Syme]85-syme , with interest . “ No , ”[2202-the policeman] said [the policeman]2202-the policeman placidly , “ [he]2310-the chief of whom i have spoken has a fancy for always sitting in [a pitch - dark room]2312-a pitch - dark room . [He]2310-the chief of whom i have spoken says it makes [his]2310-the chief of whom i have spoken thoughts brighter . Do come along . ”[2202-the policeman] Somewhat dazed and considerably excited , [Syme]85-syme allowed [himself]85-syme to be led to a side‑door in [the long row of buildings of [Scotland Yard]15-scotland yard]498-the long row of buildings of scotland yard . Almost before [he]85-syme knew what [he]85-syme was doing , [he]85-syme had been passed through the hands of about [four intermediate officials]499-four intermediate officials , and was suddenly shown into [a room]500-a room , the abrupt blackness of which startled [him]85-syme like a blaze of light . It was not the ordinary darkness , in which forms can be faintly traced ; it was like going suddenly stone‑blind . “ Are [you]85-syme [the new recruit]2313-the new recruit ? ”[294-the man] asked a heavy voice . And in some strange way , though there was not the shadow of a shape in the gloom , [Syme]85-syme knew two things : first , that it came from [a man of massive stature]501-a man of massive stature ; and second , that [the man]294-the man had [his]294-the man back to [him]294-the man . “ Are [you]85-syme [the new recruit]2313-the new recruit ? ”[503-the invisible chief , who seemed to have heard all about it] said [the invisible chief , who seemed to have heard all about it]503-the invisible chief , who seemed to have heard all about it . “ All right . [You]85-syme are engaged . ”[503-the invisible chief , who seemed to have heard all about it] [Syme]85-syme , quite swept off [his]85-syme feet , made a feeble fight against this irrevocable phrase . “ [I]85-syme really have no experience , ”[85-syme] [he]85-syme began . “ [No one]2078-no one has any experience , ”[279-the other] said [the other]279-the other , “ of the Battle of [Armageddon]25-armageddon . ”[279-the other] “ But [I]85-syme am really unfit — ”[2316-the other—“martyrs] “ [You]85-syme are willing , that is enough , ”[505-the unknown] said [the unknown]505-the unknown . “ Well , really , ”[85-syme] said [Syme]85-syme , “ [I]85-syme do n’t know any profession of which mere willingness is the final test . ”[85-syme] “ [I]279-the other do , ”[2316-the other—“martyrs] said [the other—“martyrs]2316-the other—“martyrs . [I]85-syme am condemning [you]85-syme to death . Good day . ”[85-syme] Thus it was that when [Gabriel Syme]85-syme came out again into the crimson light of evening , in [his]85-syme shabby black hat and shabby , lawless cloak , [he]85-syme came out a member of [the New Detective Corps]506-the new detective corps for the frustration of the great conspiracy . Acting under the advice of [[his]85-syme friend]507-his friend [the policeman ( who was professionally inclined to neatness )]508-the policeman ( who was professionally inclined to neatness ) , [he]85-syme trimmed [his]85-syme hair and beard , bought a good hat , clad [himself]85-syme in an exquisite summer suit of light blue - grey , with a pale yellow flower in the button‑hole , and , in short , became [that elegant and rather insupportable person whom [Gregory]106-gregory had first encountered in [the little garden of [Saffron Park]1-saffron park]510-the little garden of saffron park]509-that elegant and rather insupportable person whom gregory had first encountered in the little garden of saffron park . Before [he]85-syme finally left [the police]2007-the police premises [[his]85-syme friend]507-his friend provided [him]85-syme with a small blue card , on which was written , “ [The Last Crusade]2317-the last crusade , ”[507-his friend] and a number , the sign of [his]85-syme official authority . [He]85-syme put this carefully in [his]85-syme upper waistcoat pocket , lit a cigarette , and went forth to track and fight [the enemy]513-the enemy in [all the drawing‑rooms of [London]2-london]514-all the drawing‑rooms of london . Where [his]85-syme adventure ultimately led [him]85-syme [we]515-we have already seen . At about half - past one on a February night [he]85-syme found [himself]85-syme steaming in a small tug up [the silent Thames]516-the silent thames , armed with swordstick and revolver , [the duly elected Thursday of the Central Council of Anarchists]517-the duly elected thursday of the central council of anarchists . When [Syme]85-syme stepped out on to the steam‑tug [he]85-syme had a singular sensation of stepping out into something entirely new ; not merely into the landscape of [a new land]518-a new land , but even into the landscape of [a new planet]519-a new planet . This was mainly due to the insane yet solid decision of that evening , though partly also to an entire change in the weather and the sky since [he]85-syme entered [the little tavern]520-the little tavern some two hours before . Every trace of the passionate plumage of the cloudy sunset had been swept away , and a naked moon stood in a naked sky . The moon was so strong and full that ( by a paradox often to be noticed ) it seemed like a weaker sun . It gave , not the sense of bright moonshine , but rather of a dead daylight . Over the whole landscape lay a luminous and unnatural discoloration , as of that disastrous twilight which [Milton]120-milton spoke of as shed by the sun in eclipse ; so that [Syme]85-syme fell easily into [his]85-syme first thought , that [he]85-syme was actually on [some other and emptier planet]521-some other and emptier planet , which circled round some sadder star . But the more [he]85-syme felt this glittering desolation in [the moonlit land]522-the moonlit land , the more [his]85-syme own chivalric folly glowed in the night like a great fire . Even the common things [he]85-syme carried with [him]85-syme — the food and the brandy and the loaded pistol — took on exactly that concrete and material poetry which [a child]523-a child feels when [he]523-a child takes a gun upon a journey or a bun with [him]523-a child to bed . The sword‑stick and the brandy‑flask , though in themselves only the tools of [morbid conspirators]524-morbid conspirators , became the expressions of [his]85-syme own more healthy romance . The sword‑stick became almost the sword of chivalry , and the brandy the wine of the stirrup - cup . For even the most dehumanised modern fantasies depend on [some older and simpler figure]525-some older and simpler figure ; the adventures may be mad , but [the adventurer]526-the adventurer must be sane . The dragon without [St. George]121-george would not even be grotesque . So [this inhuman landscape]527-this inhuman landscape was only imaginative by the presence of [a man really human]528-a man really human . To [Syme]85-syme ’s exaggerative mind [the bright , bleak houses and terraces by [the Thames]26-the thames]529-the bright , bleak houses and terraces by the thames looked as empty as [the mountains of [the moon]531-the moon]530-the mountains of the moon . But even the moon is only poetical because there is [a man]221-a man in the moon . The tug was worked by [two men]533-two men , and with much toil went comparatively slowly . The clear moon that had lit up [Chiswick]27-chiswick had gone down by the time that [they]533-two men passed [Battersea]28-battersea , and when [they]533-two men came under the enormous bulk of [Westminster]122-westminster day had already begun to break . It broke like the splitting of great bars of lead , showing bars of silver ; and these had brightened like white fire when the tug , changing its onward course , turned inward to [a large landing stage rather beyond [Charing Cross]29-charing cross]534-a large landing stage rather beyond charing cross . [The great stones of [the Embankment]30-the embankment]535-the great stones of the embankment seemed equally dark and gigantic as [Syme]85-syme looked up at [them]535-the great stones of the embankment . [They]535-the great stones of the embankment were big and black against the huge white dawn . [They]535-the great stones of the embankment made [him]85-syme feel that [he]85-syme was landing on [the colossal steps of [some Egyptian palace]537-some egyptian palace]536-the colossal steps of some egyptian palace ; and , indeed , the thing suited [his]85-syme mood , for [he]85-syme was , in [his]85-syme own mind , mounting to attack the solid thrones of [horrible and heathen kings]538-horrible and heathen kings . [He]85-syme leapt out of [the boat]467-the boat on to one slimy step , and stood , a dark and slender figure , amid the enormous masonry . [The two men in the tug]540-the two men in the tug put [her]541-her off again and turned up [stream]542-stream . [They]540-the two men in the tug had never spoken a word . AT first the large stone stair seemed to [Syme]85-syme as deserted as a pyramid ; but before [he]85-syme reached the top [he]85-syme had realised that there was [a man leaning over the parapet of the Embankment]543-a man leaning over the parapet of the embankment and looking out across [the river]285-the river . As [a figure]545-a figure [he]543-a man leaning over the parapet of the embankment was quite conventional , clad in a silk hat and frock‑coat of the more formal type of fashion ; [he]543-a man leaning over the parapet of the embankment had a red flower in [his]543-a man leaning over the parapet of the embankment buttonhole . As [Syme]85-syme drew nearer to [him]543-a man leaning over the parapet of the embankment step by step , [he]543-a man leaning over the parapet of the embankment did not even move a hair ; and [Syme]85-syme could come close enough to notice even in the dim , pale morning light that [his]543-a man leaning over the parapet of the embankment face was long , pale and intellectual , and ended in a small triangular tuft of dark beard at the very point of the chin , all else being clean - shaven . This scrap of hair almost seemed a mere oversight ; the rest of the face was of the type that is best shaven — clear‑cut , ascetic , and in its way noble . [Syme]85-syme drew closer and closer , noting all this , and still [the figure]546-the figure did not stir . At first an instinct had told [Syme]85-syme that this was [the man whom [he]85-syme was meant to meet]547-the man whom he was meant to meet . Then , seeing that [the man]294-the man made no sign , [he]85-syme had concluded that [he]294-the man was not . And now again [he]85-syme had come back to a certainty that [the man]294-the man had something to do with [his]294-the man mad adventure . For [the man]294-the man remained more still than would have been natural if [a stranger]551-a stranger had come so close . [He]294-the man was as motionless as a wax‑work , and got on the nerves somewhat in the same way . [Syme]85-syme looked again and again at the pale , dignified and delicate face , and the face still looked blankly across [the river]285-the river . Then [he]85-syme took out of [his]85-syme pocket the note from [Buttons]114-mr. buttons proving [his]85-syme election , and put it before that sad and beautiful face . Then [the man]294-the man smiled , and [his]294-the man smile was a shock , for it was all on one side , going up in the right cheek and down in the left . There was nothing , rationally speaking , to scare [anyone]363-anyone about this . [Many people]555-many people have this nervous trick of a crooked smile , and in many it is even attractive . But in all [Syme]85-syme ’s circumstances , with the dark dawn and the deadly errand and the loneliness on the great drip­ping stones , there was something unnerving in it . There was [the silent river]556-the silent river and [the silent man]557-the silent man , [a man of even classic face]558-a man of even classic face . And there was the last nightmare touch that [his]294-the man smile suddenly went wrong . The spasm of smile was instantaneous , and [the man]294-the man ’s face dropped at once into its harmonious melancholy . [He]294-the man spoke without further explanation or inquiry , like a man speaking to [an old colleague]560-an old colleague . “ If [we]2318-we walk up towards [Leicester Square]31-leicester square , ”[294-the man] [he]294-the man said , “ [we]2318-we shall just be in time for breakfast . [Sunday]107-sunday always insists on an early breakfast . Have [you]85-syme had any sleep ? ”[294-the man] “ No , ”[85-syme] said [Syme]85-syme . “ Nor have [I]294-the man , ”[294-the man] answered [the man]294-the man in an ordinary tone . “ [I]294-the man shall try to get to bed after breakfast . ”[294-the man] [He]294-the man spoke with casual civility , but in an utterly dead voice that contradicted the fanaticism of [his]294-the man face . It seemed almost as if all friendly words were to [him]294-the man lifeless conveniences , and that [his]294-the man only life was hate . After a pause [the man]294-the man spoke again . “ Of course , [the Secretary of the branch]2319-the secretary of the branch told [you]85-syme everything that can be told . But the one thing that can never be told is the last notion of [the President]2320-the president , for [his]2320-the president notions grow like [a tropical forest]2321-a tropical forest . So in case [you]85-syme do n’t know , [I]294-the man ’d better tell [you]85-syme that [he]2320-the president is carrying out [his]2320-the president notion of concealing [ourselves]2322-we by not concealing [ourselves]2322-we to the most extraordinary lengths just now . Originally , of course , [we]2322-we met in [a cell underground]2323-a cell underground , just as [[your]85-syme branch]2324-your branch does . Then [Sunday]107-sunday made [us]2322-we take [a private room at [an ordinary restaurant]2326-an ordinary restaurant]2325-a private room at an ordinary restaurant . [He]2320-the president said that if [you]85-syme did n’t seem to be hiding [nobody]2082-nobody hunted [you]85-syme out . Well , [he]2320-the president is [the only man on [earth]2021-earth]2328-the only man on earth , [I]294-the man know ; but sometimes [I]294-the man really think that [his]2320-the president huge brain is going a little mad in its old age . For now [we]2322-we flaunt [ourselves]2322-we before [the public]2330-the public . [We]2322-we have [our]2322-we breakfast on [a balcony]2331-a balcony — on [a balcony]2331-a balcony , if [you]85-syme please — overlooking [Leicester Square]31-leicester square . ”[294-the man] “ And what do [the people]191-the people say ? ”[85-syme] asked [Syme]85-syme . “ It ’s quite simple what [they]191-the people say , ”[563-his guide] answered [[his]85-syme guide]563-his guide . “ [They]191-the people say [we]2322-we are a lot of [jolly gentlemen who pretend [they]191-the people are [anarchists]2124-anarchists]2334-jolly gentlemen who pretend they are anarchists . ”[563-his guide] “ It seems to [me]85-syme a very clever idea , ”[85-syme] said [Syme]85-syme . “ Clever ! [God]95-god blast [your]85-syme impudence ! Clever ! ”[279-the other] cried out [the other]279-the other in a sudden , shrill voice which was as startling and discordant as [his]279-the other crooked smile . “ When [you]85-syme ’ve seen [Sunday]107-sunday for a split second [you]85-syme ’ll leave off calling [him]279-the other clever . ”[279-the other] With this [they]565-they emerged out of [a narrow street]566-a narrow street , and saw the early sunlight filling [Leicester Square]31-leicester square . It will never be known , [I]0-i suppose , why [this square]567-this square [itself]567-this square should look so alien and in some ways so continental . It will never be known whether it was the foreign look that attracted [the foreigners]568-the foreigners or [the foreigners who gave it the foreign look]569-the foreigners who gave it the foreign look . But on this particular morning the effect seemed singularly bright and clear . Between [the open square]570-the open square and the sunlit leaves and the statue and the Saracenic outlines of [the Alhambra]32-the alhambra , [it]567-this square looked the replica of some French or even [Spanish public place]571-spanish public place . And this effect increased in [Syme]85-syme the sensation , which in many shapes [he]85-syme had had through the whole adventure , the eerie sensation of having strayed into a new world . As a fact , [he]85-syme had bought bad cigars round [Leicester Square]31-leicester square ever since [he]85-syme was [a boy]572-a boy . But as [he]85-syme turned that corner , and saw the trees and the Moorish cupolas , [he]85-syme could have sworn that [he]85-syme was turning into [an unknown Place de something]573-an unknown place de something or other in [some foreign town]574-some foreign town . At one corner of [the square]575-the square there projected a kind of angle of [a prosperous but quiet hotel]576-a prosperous but quiet hotel , the bulk of which belonged to [a street]577-a street behind . In the wall there was one large French window , probably the window of [a large coffee‑room]578-a large coffee‑room ; and outside this window , almost literally overhanging [the square]575-the square , was a formidably buttressed balcony , big enough to contain a dining‑table . In fact , [it]580-it did contain [a dining‑table]581-a dining‑table , or more strictly a breakfast‑table ; and round [the breakfast‑table]582-the breakfast‑table , glowing in the sunlight and evident to [the street]277-the street , were [a group of noisy and talkative men , all dressed in the insolence of fashion]584-a group of noisy and talkative men , all dressed in the insolence of fashion , with white waistcoats and expensive button‑holes . Some of [their]584-a group of noisy and talkative men , all dressed in the insolence of fashion jokes could almost be heard across [the square]575-the square . Then [the grave Secretary]586-the grave secretary gave [his]586-the grave secretary unnatural smile , and [Syme]85-syme knew that this boisterous breakfast party was the secret conclave of [the European Dynamiters]587-the european dynamiters . Then , as [Syme]85-syme continued to stare at [them]584-a group of noisy and talkative men , all dressed in the insolence of fashion , [he]85-syme saw something that [he]85-syme had not seen before . [He]85-syme had not seen it literally because it was too large to see . At the nearest end of [the balcony]588-the balcony , blocking up a great part of the perspective , was the back of [a great mountain of [a man]221-a man]589-a great mountain of a man . When [Syme]85-syme had seen [him]221-a man , [his]85-syme first thought was that the weight of [him]221-a man must break down [the balcony of stone]591-the balcony of stone . [His]221-a man vastness did not lie only in the fact that [he]221-a man was abnormally tall and quite incredibly fat . [This man]360-this man was planned enormously in [his]221-a man original proportions , like a statue carved deliberately as colossal . [His]360-this man head , crowned with white hair , as seen from behind looked bigger than a head ought to be . The ears that stood out from it looked larger than human ears . [He]360-this man was enlarged terribly to scale ; and this sense of size was so staggering , that when [Syme]85-syme saw [him]360-this man all [the other figures]593-the other figures seemed quite suddenly to dwindle and become dwarfish . [They]593-the other figures were still sitting there as before with [their]593-the other figures flowers and frock‑coats , but now it looked as if [the big man]594-the big man was entertaining [five children]595-five children to tea . As [Syme]85-syme and [the guide]596-the guide approached the side door of [the hotel]597-the hotel , [a waiter]598-a waiter came out smiling with every tooth in [his]598-a waiter head . “ [The gentlemen]2336-the gentlemen are up there , [sare]2337-sare , ”[598-a waiter] [he]598-a waiter said . “ [They]2336-the gentlemen do talk and [they]2336-the gentlemen do laugh at what [they]2336-the gentlemen talk . [They]2336-the gentlemen do say [they]2336-the gentlemen will throw bombs at [ze king]2338-ze king . ”[598-a waiter] And [the waiter]599-the waiter hurried away with a napkin over [his]598-a waiter arm , much pleased with the singular frivolity of [the gentlemen]2336-the gentlemen [upstairs]601-upstairs . [The two men]602-the two men mounted the stairs in silence . [Syme]85-syme had never thought of asking whether [the monstrous man who almost filled and broke the balcony]603-the monstrous man who almost filled and broke the balcony was the great President of whom [the others]604-the others stood in awe . [He]85-syme knew it was so , with an unaccountable but instantaneous certainty . [Syme]85-syme , indeed , was one of [those men who are open to all the more nameless psychological influences in a degree a little dangerous to mental health]605-those men who are open to all the more nameless psychological influences in a degree a little dangerous to mental health . Utterly devoid of fear in physical dangers , [he]85-syme was a great deal too sensitive to the smell of spiritual evil . Twice already that night little unmeaning things had peeped out at [him]85-syme almost pruriently , and given [him]85-syme a sense of drawing nearer and nearer to the head‑quarters of hell . And this sense became overpowering as [he]85-syme drew nearer to [the great President]606-the great president . The form it took was a childish and yet hateful fancy . As [he]85-syme walked across [the inner room]607-the inner room towards [the balcony]588-the balcony , the large face of [Sunday]107-sunday grew larger and larger ; and [Syme]85-syme was gripped with a fear that when [he]85-syme was quite close the face would be too big to be possible , and that [he]85-syme would scream aloud . [He]85-syme remembered that as [a child]523-a child [he]85-syme would not look at the mask of [Memnon]123-memnon in [the British Museum]610-the british museum , because it was a face , and so large . By an effort , braver than that of leaping over [a cliff]611-a cliff , [he]85-syme went to an empty seat at the breakfast‑table and sat down . [The men]612-the men greeted [him]85-syme with good - humoured raillery as if [they]612-the men had always known [him]85-syme . [He]85-syme sobered [himself]85-syme a little by looking at [their]612-the men conventional coats and solid , shining coffee‑pot ; then [he]85-syme looked again at [Sunday]107-sunday . [His]107-sunday face was very large , but it was still possible to humanity . In the presence of [the President]2320-the president [the whole company]614-the whole company looked sufficiently commonplace ; nothing about [them]612-the men caught the eye at first , except that by [the President]2320-the president ’s caprice [they]612-the men had been dressed up with a festive respectability , which gave the meal the look of a wedding breakfast . [One man]616-one man indeed stood out at even a superficial glance . [He]616-one man at least was [the common or garden Dynamiter]617-the common or garden dynamiter . [He]616-one man wore , indeed , the high white collar and satin tie that were the uniform of the occasion ; but out of this collar there sprang a head quite unmanageable and quite unmistakable , a bewildering bush of brown hair and beard that almost obscured the eyes like those of a Skye terrier . But the eyes did look out of the tangle , and they were the sad eyes of [some Russian serf]618-some russian serf . The effect of [this figure]619-this figure was not terrible like that of [the President]2320-the president , but it had [every diablerie that can come from the utterly grotesque]621-every diablerie that can come from the utterly grotesque . If out of that stiff tie and collar there had come abruptly the head of a cat or a dog , it could not have been a more idiotic contrast . [The man]294-the man ’s name , it seemed , was [Gogol]124-gogol ; [he]616-one man was [a Pole]623-a pole , and in this circle of days [he]616-one man was called [Tuesday]125-tuesday . [His]616-one man soul and speech were incurably tragic ; [he]616-one man could not force [himself]616-one man to play the prosperous and frivolous part demanded of [him]616-one man by [President Sunday]107-sunday . And , indeed , when [Syme]85-syme came in [the President]2320-the president , with that daring disregard of public suspicion which was [his]616-one man policy , was actually chaffing [Gogol]124-gogol upon [his]124-gogol inability to assume conventional graces . “ [[Our]2339-our friend]2340-our friend [Tuesday]125-tuesday , ”[2320-the president] said [the President]2320-the president in a deep voice at once of quietude and volume , “ [[our]2339-our friend]2340-our friend [Tuesday]125-tuesday does n’t seem to grasp the idea . [He]2340-our friend dresses up like [a gentleman]2023-a gentleman , but [he]2340-our friend seems to be too great a soul to behave like [one]225-one . [He]2340-our friend insists on the ways of [the stage conspirator]2344-the stage conspirator . Now if [a gentleman]2023-a gentleman goes about [London]2-london in a top hat and a frock‑coat , [no one]2078-no one need know that [he]2023-a gentleman is [an anarchist]1937-an anarchist . But if [a gentleman puts on a top hat and a frock‑coat]2348-a gentleman puts on a top hat and a frock‑coat , and then goes about on [his]2023-a gentleman hands and knees — well , [he]2023-a gentleman may attract attention . That ’s what [Brother Gogol]124-gogol does . [He]2023-a gentleman goes about on [his]2023-a gentleman hands and knees with such inexhaustible diplomacy , that by this time [he]2023-a gentleman finds it quite difficult to walk upright . ”[2320-the president] “ [I]124-gogol am not good at goncealment , ”[124-gogol] said [Gogol]124-gogol sulkily , with a thick foreign accent ; “ [I]124-gogol am not ashamed of the cause . ”[124-gogol] “ Yes [you]124-gogol are , [[my]2320-the president boy]2349-my boy , and so is the cause of [you]124-gogol , ”[2320-the president] said [the President]2320-the president good - naturedly . “ [You]124-gogol hide as much as [anybody]2277-anybody ; but [you]124-gogol ca n’t do it , [you]124-gogol see , [you]124-gogol ’re such [an ass]334-an ass ! [You]124-gogol try to combine two inconsistent methods . When [a householder]2352-a householder finds [a man]221-a man under [his]2352-a householder bed , [he]2352-a householder will probably pause to note the circumstance . But if [he]2352-a householder finds [a man]221-a man under [his]2352-a householder bed in a top hat , [you]124-gogol will agree with [me]2320-the president , [[my]2320-the president dear]1984-my dear [Tuesday]125-tuesday , that [he]2352-a householder is not likely even to forget it . Now when [you]124-gogol were found under [Admiral Biffin]126-admiral biffin ’s bed — ”[2320-the president] “ [I]125-tuesday am not good at deception , ”[125-tuesday] said [Tuesday]125-tuesday gloomily , flushing . “ Right , [[my]2320-the president boy]2349-my boy , right , ”[2320-the president] said [the President]2320-the president with a ponderous heartiness , “ [you]124-gogol are n’t good at anything . ”[2320-the president] While this stream of conversation continued , [Syme]85-syme was looking more steadily at [the men around [him]85-syme]628-the men around him . As [he]85-syme did so , [he]85-syme gradually felt all [his]85-syme sense of something spiritually queer return . [He]85-syme had thought at first that [they]628-the men around him were all of common stature and costume , with the evident exception of [the hairy Gogol]124-gogol . But as [he]85-syme looked at [the others]604-the others , [he]85-syme began to see in each of [them]628-the men around him exactly what [he]85-syme had seen in [the man by [the river]285-the river]630-the man by the river , a demoniac detail somewhere . That lop‑sided laugh , which would suddenly disfigure the fine face of [[his]85-syme original guide]632-his original guide , was typical of all these types . [Each man]633-each man had something about [him]633-each man , perceived perhaps at the tenth or twentieth glance , which was not normal , and which seemed hardly human . The only metaphor [he]85-syme could think of was this , that [they]628-the men around him all looked as [men of fashion and presence would look , with the additional twist given in a false and curved mirror]634-men of fashion and presence would look , with the additional twist given in a false and curved mirror . Only the individual examples will express this half - concealed eccentricity . [[Syme]85-syme ’s original cicerone]635-syme ’s original cicerone bore the title of [Monday]127-monday ; [he]85-syme was [the Secretary of [the Council]322-the council]636-the secretary of the council , and [his]85-syme twisted smile was regarded with more terror than anything , except [the President]2320-the president ’s horrible , happy laughter . But now that [Syme]85-syme had more space and light to observe [him]85-syme , there were other touches . [His]85-syme fine face was so emaciated , that [Syme]85-syme thought it must be wasted with some disease ; yet somehow the very distress of [his]85-syme dark eyes denied this . It was no physical ill that troubled [him]85-syme . [His]85-syme eyes were alive with intellectual torture , as if pure thought was pain . [He]85-syme was typical of [each of [the tribe]640-the tribe]639-each of the tribe ; [each man]633-each man was subtly and differently wrong . Next to [him]85-syme sat [Tuesday]125-tuesday , [the tousle‑headed Gogol]642-the tousle‑headed gogol , [a man more obviously mad]643-a man more obviously mad . Next was [Wednesday]128-wednesday , a certain [Marquis de St. Eustache]129-marquis de st. eustache , [a sufficiently characteristic figure]644-a sufficiently characteristic figure . The first few glances found nothing unusual about [him]85-syme , except that [he]85-syme was [the only man at table]645-the only man at table who wore the fashionable clothes as if they were really [his]85-syme own . [He]85-syme had a black French beard cut square and a black English frock‑coat cut even squarer . But [Syme]85-syme , sensitive to such things , felt somehow that [the man]294-the man carried a rich atmosphere with [him]85-syme , a rich atmosphere that suffocated . It reminded one irrationally of drowsy odours and of dying lamps in the darker poems of [Byron]130-byron and [Poe]131-poe . With this went a sense of [his]85-syme being clad , not in lighter colours , but in softer materials ; [his]85-syme black seemed richer and warmer than the black shades about [him]85-syme , as if it were compounded of profound colour . [His]85-syme black coat looked as if it were only black by being too dense a purple . [His]85-syme black beard looked as if it were only black by being too deep a blue . And in the gloom and thickness of the beard [his]85-syme dark red mouth showed sensual and scornful . Whatever [he]85-syme was [he]85-syme was not [a Frenchman]647-a frenchman ; [he]85-syme might be [a Jew]648-a jew ; [he]85-syme might be something deeper yet in [the dark heart of [the East]33-the east]649-the dark heart of the east . In the bright coloured Persian tiles and pictures showing [tyrants]650-tyrants hunting , [you]651-you may see just those almond eyes , those blue‑black beards , those cruel , crimson lips . Then came [Syme]85-syme , and next [a very old man]652-a very old man , [Professor de Worms]132-professor de worms , who still kept the chair of Friday , though every day it was expected that [his]652-a very old man death would leave [it]653-it empty . Save for [his]652-a very old man intellect , [he]652-a very old man was in the last dissolution of senile decay . [His]85-syme face was as grey as [his]85-syme long grey beard , [his]85-syme forehead was lifted and fixed finally in a furrow of mild despair . In no other case , not even that of [Gogol]124-gogol , did [the bridegroom brilliancy of the morning dress]654-the bridegroom brilliancy of the morning dress express a more painful contrast . For the red flower in [his]85-syme button‑hole showed up against a face that was literally discoloured like lead ; the whole hideous effect was as if [some drunken dandies]655-some drunken dandies had put [their]655-some drunken dandies clothes upon a corpse . When [he]85-syme rose or sat down , which was with long labour and peril , something worse was expressed than mere weakness , something indefinably connected with the horror of the whole scene . It did not express decrepitude merely , but corruption . Another hateful fancy crossed [Syme]85-syme ’s quivering mind . [He]85-syme could not help thinking that whenever [the man]294-the man moved a leg or arm might fall off . Right at the end sat [the man called [Saturday]133-saturday]657-the man called saturday , [the simplest and the most baffling of all]658-the simplest and the most baffling of all . [He]657-the man called saturday was [a short , square man with a dark , square face clean - shaven]659-a short , square man with a dark , square face clean - shaven , [a medical practitioner going by the name of Bull]660-a medical practitioner going by the name of bull . [He]657-the man called saturday had that combination of savoir‑faire with a sort of well - groomed coarseness which is not uncommon in [young doctors]661-young doctors . [He]657-the man called saturday carried [his]657-the man called saturday fine clothes with confidence rather than ease , and [he]657-the man called saturday mostly wore a set smile . There was nothing whatever odd about [him]657-the man called saturday , except that [he]657-the man called saturday wore a pair of dark , almost opaque spectacles . It may have been merely a crescendo of nervous fancy that had gone before , but those black discs were dreadful to [Syme]85-syme ; they reminded [him]85-syme of half‑remembered ugly tales , of some story about pennies being put on the eyes of the dead . [Syme]85-syme ’s eye always caught the black glasses and the blind grin . Had [the dying Professor]662-the dying professor worn them , or even [the pale Secretary]663-the pale secretary , they would have been appropriate . But on [the younger and grosser man]664-the younger and grosser man [they]665-they seemed only an enigma . [They]665-they took away the key of the face . [You]666-you could not tell what [his]657-the man called saturday smile or [his]657-the man called saturday gravity meant . Partly from this , and partly because [he]657-the man called saturday had a vulgar virility wanting in most of the others it seemed to [Syme]85-syme that [he]657-the man called saturday might be [the wickedest of all [those wicked men]668-those wicked men]667-the wickedest of all those wicked men . [Syme]85-syme even had the thought that [his]85-syme eyes might be covered up because they were too frightful to see . SUCH were [the six men who had sworn to destroy [the world]231-the world]669-the six men who had sworn to destroy the world . Again and again [Syme]85-syme strove to pull together [his]85-syme common sense in [their]669-the six men who had sworn to destroy the world presence . Sometimes [he]85-syme saw for an instant that these notions were subjective , that [he]85-syme was only looking at [ordinary men]671-ordinary men , [one of whom]672-one of whom was old , [another nervous , another short‑sighted]673-another nervous , another short‑sighted . The sense of an unnatural symbolism always settled back on [him]85-syme again . [Each figure]674-each figure seemed to be , somehow , on [the borderland of things]675-the borderland of things , just as [their]669-the six men who had sworn to destroy the world theory was on [the borderland of thought]676-the borderland of thought . [He]85-syme knew that [each one of [these men]439-these men]677-each one of these men stood at the extreme end , so to speak , of some wild road of reasoning . [He]85-syme could only fancy , as in some old‑world fable , that if [a man]221-a man went westward to [the end of [the world]231-the world]680-the end of the world [he]221-a man would find something — say a tree — that was more or less than a tree , a tree possessed by [a spirit]682-a spirit ; and that if [he]221-a man went [east]683-east to [the end of [the world]231-the world]680-the end of the world [he]221-a man would find something else that was not wholly itself — [a tower]686-a tower , perhaps , of which the very shape was wicked . So [these figures]687-these figures seemed to stand up , violent and unaccountable , against an ultimate horizon , visions from the verge . The ends of [the earth]234-the earth were closing in . Talk had been going on steadily as [he]85-syme took in the scene ; and not the least of the contrasts of that bewildering breakfast‑table was the contrast between the easy and unobtrusive tone of talk and its terrible purport . [They]669-the six men who had sworn to destroy the world were deep in the discussion of an actual and immediate plot . [The waiter downstairs]689-the waiter downstairs had spoken quite correctly when [he]689-the waiter downstairs said that [they]669-the six men who had sworn to destroy the world were talking about bombs and [kings]690-kings . Only three days afterwards [the Czar]691-the czar was to meet [the President of [the French Republic]693-the french republic in [Paris]34-paris]692-the president of the french republic in paris , and over [their]669-the six men who had sworn to destroy the world bacon and eggs upon [their]669-the six men who had sworn to destroy the world sunny balcony [these beaming gentlemen]694-these beaming gentlemen had decided how [both]695-both should die . Even the instrument was chosen ; [the black‑bearded Marquis]696-the black‑bearded marquis , it appeared , was to carry the bomb . Ordinarily speaking , the proximity of this positive and objective crime would have sobered [Syme]85-syme , and cured [him]85-syme of all [his]85-syme merely mystical tremors . [He]85-syme would have thought of nothing but the need of saving at least [two human bodies]697-two human bodies from being ripped in pieces with iron and roaring gas . But the truth was that by this time [he]85-syme had begun to feel a third kind of fear , more piercing and practical than either [his]85-syme moral revulsion or [his]85-syme social responsibility . Very simply , [he]85-syme had no fear to spare for [the French President]107-sunday or [the Czar]691-the czar ; [he]85-syme had begun to fear for [himself]85-syme . [Most of [the talkers]700-the talkers]699-most of the talkers took little heed of [him]85-syme , debating now with [their]699-most of the talkers faces closer together , and almost uniformly grave , save when for an instant the smile of [the Secretary]701-the secretary ran aslant across [his]85-syme face as the jagged lightning runs aslant across the sky . But there was one persistent thing which first troubled [Syme]85-syme and at last terrified [him]85-syme . [The President]2320-the president was always looking at [him]85-syme , steadily , and with a great and baffling interest . [The enormous man]703-the enormous man was quite quiet , but [his]703-the enormous man blue eyes stood out of [his]703-the enormous man head . And they were always fixed on [Syme]85-syme . [Syme]85-syme felt moved to spring up and leap over [the balcony]588-the balcony . When [the President]2320-the president ’s eyes were on [him]85-syme [he]85-syme felt as if [he]85-syme were made of glass . [He]85-syme had hardly the shred of a doubt that in some silent and extraordinary way [Sunday]107-sunday had found out that [he]85-syme was [a spy]706-a spy . [He]85-syme looked over the edge of [the balcony]588-the balcony , and saw [a policeman]353-a policeman , standing abstractedly just beneath , staring at the bright railings and the sunlit trees . Then there fell upon [him]85-syme the great temptation that was to torment [him]85-syme for many days . In the presence of [these powerful and repulsive men]709-these powerful and repulsive men , who were [the princes of anarchy]710-the princes of anarchy , [he]85-syme had almost forgotten the frail and fanciful figure of [the poet [Gregory]106-gregory]274-the poet gregory , [the mere aesthete of anarchism]712-the mere aesthete of anarchism . [He]85-syme even thought of [him]274-the poet gregory now with an old kindness , as if [they]713-they had played together when [children]2073-children . But [he]85-syme remembered that [he]85-syme was still tied to [Gregory]106-gregory by a great promise . [He]85-syme had promised never to do the very thing that [he]85-syme now felt [himself]85-syme almost in the act of doing . [He]85-syme had promised not to jump over [that balcony]715-that balcony and speak to [that policeman]716-that policeman . [He]85-syme took [his]85-syme cold hand off the cold stone balustrade . [His]85-syme soul swayed in a vertigo of moral indecision . [He]85-syme had only to snap the thread of a rash vow made to [a villainous society]717-a villainous society , and all [his]85-syme life could be as open and sunny as [the square beneath [him]85-syme]718-the square beneath him . [He]85-syme had , on the other hand , only to keep [his]85-syme antiquated honour , and be delivered inch by inch into the power of [this great enemy of [mankind , whose very intellect was a torture - chamber]720-mankind , whose very intellect was a torture - chamber]719-this great enemy of mankind , whose very intellect was a torture - chamber . Whenever [he]85-syme looked down into [the square]575-the square [he]85-syme saw [the comfortable policeman]722-the comfortable policeman , [a pillar of common sense and common order]723-a pillar of common sense and common order . Whenever [he]85-syme looked back at [the breakfast‑table]582-the breakfast‑table [he]85-syme saw [the President]2320-the president still quietly studying [him]85-syme with big , unbearable eyes . In all the torrent of [his]85-syme thought there were two thoughts that never crossed [his]85-syme mind . First , it never occurred to [him]85-syme to doubt that [the President]2320-the president and [[his]2320-the president Council]727-his council could crush [him]85-syme if [he]85-syme continued to stand alone . [The place]193-the place might be public , the project might seem impossible . But [Sunday]107-sunday was not [the man who would carry [himself]107-sunday thus easily without having , somehow or somewhere , set open [his]107-sunday iron trap]729-the man who would carry himself thus easily without having , somehow or somewhere , set open his iron trap . Either by anonymous poison or sudden street accident , by hypnotism or by fire from hell , [Sunday]107-sunday could certainly strike [him]107-sunday . If [he]85-syme defied [the man]294-the man [he]85-syme was probably dead , either struck stiff there in [his]85-syme chair or long afterwards as by an innocent ailment . If [he]85-syme called in [the police]2007-the police promptly , arrested [everyone]271-everyone , told all , and set against [them]2007-the police the whole energy of [England]13-england , [he]85-syme would probably escape ; certainly not otherwise . [They]2007-the police were a balconyful of [gentlemen]733-gentlemen overlooking [a bright and busy square]734-a bright and busy square ; but [he]85-syme felt no more safe with [them]2007-the police than if [they]2007-the police had been [a boatful of [armed pirates]736-armed pirates overlooking [an empty sea]737-an empty sea]735-a boatful of armed pirates overlooking an empty sea . There was a second thought that never came to [him]85-syme . It never occurred to [him]85-syme to be spiritually won over to [the enemy]513-the enemy . [Many moderns , inured to a weak worship of intellect and force]739-many moderns , inured to a weak worship of intellect and force , might have wavered in [their]739-many moderns , inured to a weak worship of intellect and force allegiance under this oppression of a great personality . [They]739-many moderns , inured to a weak worship of intellect and force might have called [Sunday]107-sunday [the super‑man]740-the super‑man . If any such creature be conceivable , [he]107-sunday looked , indeed , somewhat like [it]741-it , with [his]107-sunday earth‑shaking abstraction , as of a stone statue walking . [He]107-sunday might have been called [something above man]742-something above man , with [his]107-sunday large plans , which were too obvious to be detected , with [his]107-sunday large face , which was too frank to be understood . But this was a kind of modern meanness to which [Syme]85-syme could not sink even in [his]85-syme extreme morbidity . Like [any man]743-any man , [he]85-syme was coward enough to fear great force ; but [he]85-syme was not quite coward enough to admire it . [The men]612-the men were eating as [they]612-the men talked , and even in this [they]612-the men were typical . [Dr. Bull]134-dr. bull and [the Marquis]745-the marquis ate casually and conventionally of the best things on the table — cold pheasant or Strasbourg pie . But [the Secretary]701-the secretary was a vegetarian , and [he]701-the secretary spoke earnestly of the projected murder over half a raw tomato and three quarters of a glass of tepid water . [The old Professor]747-the old professor had such slops as suggested a sickening second childhood . And even in this President Sunday preserved [his]107-sunday curious predominance of mere mass . For [he]107-sunday ate like [twenty men]748-twenty men ; [he]107-sunday ate incredibly , with a frightful freshness of appetite , so that it was like watching [a sausage factory]749-a sausage factory . Yet continually , when [he]107-sunday had swallowed a dozen crumpets or drunk a quart of coffee , [he]107-sunday would be found with [his]107-sunday great head on one side staring at [Syme]85-syme . “ [I]745-the marquis have often wondered , ”[745-the marquis] said [the Marquis]745-the marquis , taking a great bite out of a slice of bread and jam , “ whether it would n’t be better for [me]745-the marquis to do it with a knife . Most of the best things have been brought off with a knife . And it would be a new emotion to get a knife into [a French President]2357-a french president and wriggle it round . ”[745-the marquis] “ [You]701-the secretary are wrong , ”[701-the secretary] said [the Secretary]701-the secretary , drawing [his]701-the secretary black brows together . “ The knife was merely the expression of the old personal quarrel with [a personal tyrant]2358-a personal tyrant . Dynamite is not only [our]2359-our best tool , but [our]2359-our best symbol . It is as perfect a symbol of [us]2359-our as is incense of the prayers of [the Christians]109-the christians . It expands ; it only destroys because it broadens ; even so , thought only destroys because it broadens . [A man]221-a man ’s brain is a bomb , ”[701-the secretary] [he]701-the secretary cried out , loosening suddenly [his]701-the secretary strange passion and striking [his]701-the secretary own skull with violence . “ [My]701-the secretary brain feels like a bomb , night and day . It must expand ! It must expand ! [A man]221-a man ’s brain must expand , if it breaks up [the universe]2261-the universe . ”[701-the secretary] “ [I]745-the marquis do n’t want [the universe]2261-the universe broken up just yet , ”[745-the marquis] drawled [the Marquis]745-the marquis . “ [I]745-the marquis want to do a lot of beastly things before [I]745-the marquis die . [I]745-the marquis thought of one yesterday in bed . ”[745-the marquis] “ No , if the only end of the thing is nothing , ”[134-dr. bull] said [Dr. Bull]134-dr. bull with [his]134-dr. bull sphinx - like smile , “ it hardly seems worth doing . ”[134-dr. bull] [The old Professor]747-the old professor was staring at the ceiling with dull eyes . “ [Every man]2132-every man knows in [his]2132-every man heart , ”[747-the old professor] [he]747-the old professor said , “ that nothing is worth doing . ”[747-the old professor] There was a singular silence , and then [the Secretary]701-the secretary said — “ [We]755-we are wandering , however , from the point . The only question is how Wednesday is to strike the blow . [I]701-the secretary take it [we]755-we should all agree with the original notion of a bomb . As to the actual arrangements , [I]701-the secretary should suggest that to­morrow morning [he]85-syme should go first of all to — ”[701-the secretary] The speech was broken off short under a vast shadow . [President Sunday]107-sunday had risen to [his]107-sunday feet , seeming to fill the sky above [them]755-we . “ Before [we]755-we discuss that , ”[107-sunday] [he]107-sunday said in a small , quiet voice , “ let [us]755-we go into [a private room]2365-a private room . [I]107-sunday have something vent particular to say . ”[107-sunday] [Syme]85-syme stood up before [any of [the others]604-the others]756-any of the others . The instant of choice had come at last , the pistol was at [his]85-syme head . On [the pavement]758-the pavement before [he]85-syme could hear [the policeman]2202-the policeman idly stir and stamp , for the morning , though bright , was cold . A barrel‑organ in [the street]277-the street suddenly sprang with a jerk into a jovial tune . [Syme]85-syme stood up taut , as if it had been a bugle before the battle . [He]85-syme found [himself]85-syme filled with a supernatural courage that came from nowhere . That jingling music seemed full of the vivacity , the vulgarity , and the irrational valour of [the poor , who in all [those unclean streets]762-those unclean streets were all clinging to the decencies and the charities of [Christendom]35-christendom]761-the poor , who in all those unclean streets were all clinging to the decencies and the charities of christendom .
