[His]85-syme youthful prank of being [a policeman]353-a policeman had faded from [his]85-syme mind ; [he]85-syme did not think of [himself]85-syme as [the representative of [the corps of [gentlemen]733-gentlemen]765-the corps of gentlemen turned into [fancy constables]767-fancy constables , or of [the old eccentric who lived in the dark room]768-the old eccentric who lived in the dark room]764-the representative of the corps of gentlemen turned into fancy constables , or of the old eccentric who lived in the dark room . But [he]85-syme did feel [himself]85-syme as [the ambassador of [all these common and kindly people in [the street]277-the street]770-all these common and kindly people in the street , [who every day marched into battle to the music of the barrel - organ]772-who every day marched into battle to the music of the barrel - organ . And this high pride in being human had lifted [him]85-syme unaccountably to an infinite height above [the monstrous men around [him]85-syme]773-the monstrous men around him]769-the ambassador of all these common and kindly people in the street , who every day marched into battle to the music of the barrel - organ . and this high pride in being human had lifted him unaccountably to an infinite height above the monstrous men around him . For an instant , at least , [he]85-syme looked down upon all [their]770-all these common and kindly people in the street sprawling eccentricities from [the starry pinnacle of the commonplace]774-the starry pinnacle of the commonplace . [He]85-syme felt towards [them]770-all these common and kindly people in the street all that unconscious and elementary superiority that [a brave man]775-a brave man feels over powerful beasts or [a wise man]776-a wise man over powerful errors . [He]85-syme knew that [he]85-syme had neither the intellectual nor the physical strength of [President Sunday]107-sunday ; but in that moment [he]85-syme minded it no more than the fact that [he]85-syme had not the muscles of a tiger or a horn on [his]85-syme nose like a rhinoceros . All was swallowed up in an ultimate certainty that [the President]2320-the president was wrong and that [the barrel‑organ]778-the barrel‑organ was right . There clanged in [his]85-syme mind that unanswerable and terrible truism in the song of [Roland]135-roland — “ Païens ont tort et Chrétiens ont droit . ”[135-roland] which in the old nasal French has the clang and groan of great iron . This liberation of [his]85-syme spirit from the load of [his]85-syme weakness went with a quite clear decision to embrace death . If [the people of the barrel‑organ]779-the people of the barrel‑organ could keep [their]779-the people of the barrel‑organ old‑world obligations , so could [he]85-syme . This very pride in keeping [his]85-syme word was that [he]85-syme was keeping it to [miscreants]780-miscreants . It was [his]85-syme last triumph over [these lunatics]781-these lunatics to go down into [[their]781-these lunatics dark room]782-their dark room and die for something that [they]781-these lunatics could not even understand . [The barrel‑organ]778-the barrel‑organ seemed to give the marching tune with the energy and the mingled noises of a whole orchestra ; and [he]85-syme could hear deep and rolling , under all the trumpets of the pride of life , the drums of the pride of death . [The conspirators]2090-the conspirators were already filing through the open window and into [the rooms behind]785-the rooms behind . [Syme]85-syme went last , outwardly calm , but with all [his]85-syme brain and body throbbing with romantic rhythm . [The President]2320-the president led [them]2090-the conspirators down an irregular side stair , such as might be used by [servants]787-servants , and into [a dim , cold , empty room]788-a dim , cold , empty room , with a table and benches , like [an abandoned boardroom]789-an abandoned boardroom . When [they]2090-the conspirators were all in , [he]2320-the president closed and locked the door . The first to speak was [Gogol]124-gogol , the irreconcilable , who seemed bursting with inarticulate grievance . “ [Zso]136-zso ! [I]2320-the president suggest [Comrade Saturday]133-saturday , [Dr. Bull]134-dr. bull . ”[2320-the president] [They]797-they all stared at [him]85-syme ; then [they]797-they all started in [their]797-they seats , for the next words , though not loud , had a living and sensational emphasis . [Sunday]107-sunday struck the table . “ Not one word more about the plans and places must be said at this meeting . Not one tiny detail more about what [we]2385-we mean to do must be mentioned in [this company]2386-this company . ”[107-sunday] [Sunday]107-sunday had spent [his]107-sunday life in astonishing [[his]107-sunday followers]798-his followers ; but it seemed as if [he]107-sunday had never really astonished [them]798-his followers until now . When the attack on [him]85-syme came [he]85-syme would sell [his]85-syme life dear . [He]85-syme would find out at least if [the President]2320-the president was mortal . [Sunday]107-sunday went on smoothly — “ [You]2387-you will probably understand that there is only one possible motive for forbidding free speech at this festival of freedom . [Strangers]2388-strangers overhearing [us]2389-us matters nothing . [They]2388-strangers assume that [we]2389-us are joking . But what would matter , even unto death , is this , that there should be [one actually among [us]2389-us who is not of [us]2389-us]2390-one actually among us who is not of us , who knows [our]2389-us grave purpose , but does not share it , who — ”[107-sunday] [The Secretary]701-the secretary screamed out suddenly like [a woman]226-a woman . “ It ca n’t be ! ”[701-the secretary] [he]701-the secretary cried , leaping . “ There ca n’t — ”[2320-the president] [The President]2320-the president flapped [his]2320-the president large flat hand on the table like the fin of some huge fish . “ Yes , ”[2320-the president] [he]2320-the president said slowly , “ there is [a spy]706-a spy in [this room]320-this room . [His]2393-a traitor name — ”[2320-the president] [Syme]85-syme half rose from [his]85-syme seat , [his]85-syme finger firm on the trigger . “ [His]2393-a traitor name is [Gogol]124-gogol , ”[2320-the president] said [the President]2320-the president . “ [He]2393-a traitor is that hairy humbug over there who pretends to be a Pole . ”[2320-the president] [Gogol]124-gogol sprang to [his]124-gogol feet , a pistol in each hand . But [Syme]85-syme saw little of the scene , for [he]85-syme was blinded with a beneficent darkness ; [he]85-syme had sunk down into [his]85-syme seat shuddering , in a palsy of passionate relief . “ SIT down ! ”[107-sunday] said [Sunday]107-sunday in a voice that [he]107-sunday used once or twice in [his]107-sunday life , a voice that made [men drop drawn swords]806-men drop drawn swords . [The three who had risen]807-the three who had risen fell away from [Gogol]124-gogol , and [that equivocal person]808-that equivocal person [himself]808-that equivocal person resumed [his]808-that equivocal person seat . “ Well , [[my]2320-the president man]2394-my man , ”[2320-the president] said [the President]2320-the president briskly , addressing [him]808-that equivocal person as one addresses [a total stranger]810-a total stranger , “ will [you]808-that equivocal person oblige [me]2320-the president by putting [your]808-that equivocal person hand in [your]808-that equivocal person upper waistcoat pocket and showing [me]2320-the president what [you]808-that equivocal person have there ? ”[2320-the president] [The alleged Pole]811-the alleged pole was a little pale under [his]811-the alleged pole tangle of dark hair , but [he]811-the alleged pole put two fingers into the pocket with apparent coolness and pulled out a blue strip of card . When [Syme]85-syme saw it lying on the table , [he]85-syme woke up again to [the world outside [him]85-syme]812-the world outside him . For although the card lay at the other extreme of the table , and [he]85-syme could read nothing of the inscription on it , it bore a startling resemblance to the blue card in [his]85-syme own pocket , the card which had been given to [him]85-syme when [he]85-syme joined [the anti‑anarchist constabulary]813-the anti‑anarchist constabulary . “ [Pathetic Slav]137-pathetic slav , ”[2320-the president] said [the President]2320-the president , “ [tragic child of [Poland]138-poland]2395-tragic child of poland , are [you]137-pathetic slav prepared in the presence of that card to deny that [you]137-pathetic slav are in [this company]2386-this company — shall [we]2397-we say de trop ? ”[2320-the president] “ Right oh ! ”[124-gogol] said [the late Gogol]124-gogol . It was irrational , as if [a Chinaman]816-a chinaman had suddenly spoken with a Scotch accent . “ [I]107-sunday gather that [you]137-pathetic slav fully understand [your]137-pathetic slav position , ”[107-sunday] said [Sunday]107-sunday . “ [You]137-pathetic slav bet , ”[792-the pole] answered [the Pole]792-the pole . “ [I]792-the pole see it ’s [a fair cop]2398-a fair cop . Do [you]137-pathetic slav mind leaving [your]137-pathetic slav beard with [your]137-pathetic slav card ? ”[107-sunday] “ Not a bit , ”[124-gogol] answered [Gogol]124-gogol ; and with one finger [he]124-gogol ripped off the whole of [his]124-gogol shaggy head‑covering , emerging with thin red hair and a pale , pert face . “ It was hot , ”[124-gogol] [he]124-gogol added . “ [I]107-sunday will do [you]137-pathetic slav the justice to say , ”[107-sunday] said [Sunday]107-sunday , not without a sort of brutal admiration , “ that [you]137-pathetic slav seem to have kept pretty cool under it . Now listen to [me]107-sunday . [I]107-sunday like [you]137-pathetic slav . The consequence is that it would annoy [me]107-sunday for just about two and a half minutes if [I]107-sunday heard that [you]137-pathetic slav had died in torments . Well , if [you]137-pathetic slav ever tell [the police]2007-the police or [any human soul]2401-any human soul about [us]2402-us , [I]107-sunday shall have that two and a half minutes of discomfort . On [your]137-pathetic slav discomfort [I]107-sunday will not dwell . Good day . Mind the step . ”[107-sunday] [The red‑haired detective who had masqueraded as [Gogol]124-gogol]818-the red‑haired detective who had masqueraded as gogol rose to [his]818-the red‑haired detective who had masqueraded as gogol feet without a word , and walked out of [the room]292-the room with an air of perfect nonchalance . Yet [the astonished Syme]85-syme was able to realise that this ease was suddenly assumed ; for there was a slight stumble outside the door , which showed that [the departing detective]820-the departing detective had not minded the step . “ Time is flying , ”[2320-the president] said [the President]2320-the president in [his]2320-the president gayest manner , after glancing at [his]2320-the president watch , which like everything about [him]2320-the president seemed bigger than it ought to be . “ [I]701-the secretary must go off at once ; [I]701-the secretary have to take the chair at a Humanitarian meeting . ”[701-the secretary] [The Secretary]701-the secretary turned to [him]2320-the president with working eyebrows . “ Would it not be better , ”[701-the secretary] [he]701-the secretary said a little sharply , “ to discuss further the details of [our]2403-our project , now that [the spy]2404-the spy has left [us]2403-our ? ”[701-the secretary] “ No , [I]2320-the president think not , ”[2320-the president] said [the President]2320-the president with a yawn like an unobtrusive earthquake . “ Leave it as it is . Let Saturday settle it . [I]2320-the president must be off . Breakfast here next Sunday . ”[2320-the president] But the late loud scenes had whipped up the almost naked nerves of [the Secretary]701-the secretary . [He]2320-the president was one of [those men who are conscientious even in crime]825-those men who are conscientious even in crime . “ [I]2320-the president must protest , [President]2405-president , that the thing is irregular , ”[2320-the president] [he]2320-the president said . “ It is a fundamental rule of [[our]2403-our society]2406-our society that all plans shall be debated in full council . Of course , [I]2320-the president fully appreciate [your]2405-president forethought when in the actual presence of [a traitor]2393-a traitor — ”[2320-the president] “ [Secretary]2408-secretary , ”[2320-the president] said [the President]2320-the president seriously , “ if [you]2408-secretary ’d take [your]2408-secretary head [home]2409-home and boil it for a turnip it might be useful . [I]2320-the president ca n’t say . But it might . [The Secretary]701-the secretary reared back in a kind of equine anger . “[2320-the president] [I]0-i really fail to understand — ” [he]0-i began in high offense . “[0-i] That ’s it , that ’s it , ” said [the President]2320-the president , nodding a great many times . “[0-i] That ’s where [you]827-you fail right enough . [You]827-you fail to understand . Why , [you]827-you dancing donkey , ” [he]2320-the president roared , rising , “[827-you] [you]827-you did n’t want to be overheard by [a spy]706-a spy , did n’t [you]827-you ? How do [you]827-you know [you]827-you are n’t overheard now ? ” And with these words [he]2320-the president shouldered [his]2320-the president way out of [the room]292-the room , shaking with incomprehensible scorn . [Four of [the men left behind]2414-the men left behind]2413-four of the men left behind gaped after [him]2320-the president without any apparent glimmering of [his]2320-the president meaning . [Syme]85-syme alone had even a glimmering , and such as it was it froze [him]85-syme to the bone . If the last words of [the President]2320-the president meant anything , [they]2413-four of the men left behind meant that [he]2320-the president had not after all passed unsuspected . [They]2413-four of the men left behind meant that while [Sunday]107-sunday could not denounce [him]2320-the president like [Gogol]124-gogol , [he]2320-the president still could not trust [him]2320-the president like [the others]604-the others . [The other four]2417-the other four got to [their]2417-the other four feet grumbling more or less , and betook [themselves]2417-the other four elsewhere to find lunch , for it was already well past midday . [The Professor]805-the professor went last , very slowly and painfully . [Syme]85-syme sat long after the rest had gone , revolving [his]85-syme strange position . [He]85-syme had escaped a thunderbolt , but [he]85-syme was still under a cloud . At last [he]85-syme rose and made [his]85-syme way out of [the hotel]597-the hotel into [Leicester Square]31-leicester square . The bright , cold day had grown increasingly colder , and when [he]85-syme came out into [the street]277-the street [he]85-syme was surprised by a few flakes of snow . While [he]85-syme still carried the sword‑stick and the rest of [Gregory]106-gregory ’s portable luggage , [he]85-syme had thrown the cloak down and left it somewhere , perhaps on the steam‑tug , perhaps on [the balcony]588-the balcony . Hoping , therefore , that the snow‑shower might be slight , [he]85-syme stepped back out of [the street]277-the street for a moment and stood up under the doorway of [a small and greasy [hair‑dresser]2424-hair‑dresser ’s shop]2423-a small and greasy hair‑dresser ’s shop , the front window of which was empty , except for [a sickly wax lady in evening dress]2425-a sickly wax lady in evening dress . Snow , however , began to thicken and fall fast ; and [Syme]85-syme , having found one glance at [the wax lady]2426-the wax lady quite sufficient to depress [his]85-syme spirits , stared out instead into [the white and empty street]2427-the white and empty street . [He]85-syme was considerably astonished to see , standing quite still outside [the shop]2428-the shop and staring into the window , [a man]221-a man . [His]85-syme top hat was loaded with snow like the hat of [Father Christmas]139-father christmas , the white drift was rising round [his]85-syme boots and ankles ; but it seemed as if nothing could tear [him]85-syme away from the contemplation of [the colourless wax doll in dirty evening dress]2430-the colourless wax doll in dirty evening dress . That [any human being]2431-any human being should stand in such weather looking into [such a shop]2432-such a shop was a matter of sufficient wonder to [Syme]85-syme ; but [his]85-syme idle wonder turned suddenly into a personal shock ; for [he]85-syme realised that [the man standing there]2433-the man standing there was the paralytic old [Professor de Worms]132-professor de worms . It scarcely seemed the place for [a person of [his]85-syme years and infirmities]2434-a person of his years and infirmities . [Syme]85-syme was ready to believe anything about the perversions of [this dehumanized brotherhood]2435-this dehumanized brotherhood ; but even [he]85-syme could not believe that [the Professor]805-the professor had fallen in love with [that particular wax lady]2437-that particular wax lady . [He]85-syme could only suppose that [the man]294-the man ’s malady ( whatever it was ) involved some momentary fits of rigidity or trance . [He]85-syme was not inclined , however , to feel in this case any very compassionate concern . On the contrary , [he]85-syme rather congratulated [himself]85-syme that [the Professor]805-the professor ’s stroke and [his]805-the professor elaborate and limping walk would make it easy to escape from [him]805-the professor and leave [him]805-the professor miles behind . For [Syme]85-syme thirsted first and last to get clear of the whole poisonous atmosphere , if only for an hour . Then [he]85-syme could collect [his]85-syme thoughts , formulate [his]85-syme policy , and decide finally whether [he]85-syme should or should not keep faith with [Gregory]106-gregory . [He]85-syme strolled away through the dancing snow , turned up [two or three streets]2440-two or three streets , down through two or three others , and entered [a small Soho restaurant]2441-a small soho restaurant for lunch . [He]85-syme partook reflectively of four small and quaint courses , drank half a bottle of red wine , and ended up over black coffee and a black cigar , still thinking . [He]85-syme had taken [his]85-syme seat in [the upper room of [the restaurant]2443-the restaurant , which was full of the chink of knives and the chatter of [foreigners]2444-foreigners]2442-the upper room of the restaurant , which was full of the chink of knives and the chatter of foreigners . [He]85-syme remembered that in old days [he]85-syme had imagined that [all these harmless and kindly aliens]2445-all these harmless and kindly aliens were [anarchists]2124-anarchists . [He]85-syme shuddered , remembering the real thing . But even the shudder had the delightful shame of escape . The wine , the common food , [the familiar place]2447-the familiar place , the faces of [natural and talkative men]2448-natural and talkative men , made [him]85-syme almost feel as if [the Council of the Seven Days]2449-the council of the seven days had been a bad dream ; and although [he]85-syme knew it was nevertheless an objective reality , it was at least a distant one . [Tall houses]2450-tall houses and [populous streets]2451-populous streets lay between [him]85-syme and [his]85-syme last sight of [the shameful seven]2452-the shameful seven ; [he]85-syme was free in free [London]2-london , and drinking wine among the free . With a somewhat easier action , [he]85-syme took [his]85-syme hat and stick and strolled down the stair into [the shop below]2453-the shop below . When [he]85-syme entered [that lower room]2454-that lower room [he]85-syme stood stricken and rooted to the spot . At a small table , close up to the blank window and [the white street of snow]2455-the white street of snow , sat [the old anarchist Professor]2456-the old anarchist professor over a glass of milk , with [his]2456-the old anarchist professor lifted livid face and pendent eyelids . For an instant [Syme]85-syme stood as rigid as the stick [he]0-i leant upon . Then with a gesture as of blind hurry , [he]0-i brushed past [the Professor]805-the professor , dashing open the door and slamming it behind [him]0-i , and stood outside in the snow . “[827-you] Can [that old corpse]829-that old corpse be following [me]0-i ? ” [he]0-i asked [himself]0-i , biting [his]0-i yellow moustache . “[829-that old corpse] [I]0-i stopped too long up in [that room]830-that room , so that even such leaden feet could catch [me]0-i up . One comfort is , with a little brisk walking [I]0-i can put [a man like that]831-a man like that as far away as [Timbuctoo]36-timbuctoo . Or am [I]0-i too fanciful ? Was [he]829-that old corpse really following [me]0-i ? Surely [Sunday]107-sunday would not be such [a fool]2060-a fool as to send [a lame man]833-a lame man ? ” [He]0-i set off at a smart pace , twisting and whirling [his]0-i stick , in the direction of [Covent Garden]37-covent garden . As [he]0-i crossed [the great market]2458-the great market the snow increased , growing blinding and bewildering as the afternoon began to darken . The snow‑flakes tormented [him]0-i like a swarm of silver bees . Getting into [his]0-i eyes and beard , they added [their]2459-their unremitting futility to [his]0-i already irritated nerves ; and by the time that [he]0-i had come at a swinging pace to [the beginning of [Fleet Street]38-fleet street]2460-the beginning of fleet street , [he]0-i lost patience , and finding [a Sunday teashop]2461-a sunday teashop , turned into [it]2461-a sunday teashop to take shelter . [He]0-i ordered another cup of black coffee as an excuse . Scarcely had [he]0-i done so , when [Professor de Worms]132-professor de worms hobbled heavily into [the shop]2428-the shop , sat down with difficulty and ordered a glass of milk . [Syme]85-syme ’s walking‑stick had fallen from [his]0-i hand with a great clang , which confessed the concealed steel . But [the Professor]805-the professor did not look round . [Syme]85-syme , who was commonly [a cool character]2464-a cool character , was literally gaping as [a rustic gapes at a conjuring trick]2465-a rustic gapes at a conjuring trick . [He]85-syme had seen [no cab following]2466-no cab following ; [he]85-syme had heard no wheels outside [the shop]2428-the shop ; to all mortal appearances [the man]294-the man had come on foot . But [the old man]2469-the old man could only walk like a snail , and [Syme]85-syme had walked like the wind . [He]85-syme started up and snatched [his]85-syme stick , half crazy with the contradiction in mere arithmetic , and swung out of the swinging doors , leaving [his]85-syme coffee untasted . [An omnibus going to [the Bank]2471-the bank]2470-an omnibus going to the bank went rattling by with an unusual rapidity . [He]85-syme had a violent run of a hundred yards to reach [it]2470-an omnibus going to the bank ; but [he]85-syme managed to spring , swaying upon the splash‑board and , pausing for an instant to pant , [he]85-syme climbed on to the top . When [he]85-syme had been seated for about half a minute , [he]85-syme heard behind [him]85-syme a sort of heavy and asthmatic breathing . Turning sharply , [he]85-syme saw rising gradually higher and higher up [the omnibus steps]2472-the omnibus steps a top hat soiled and dripping with snow , and under the shadow of its brim the short‑sighted face and shaky shoulders of [Professor de Worms]132-professor de worms . [He]85-syme let [himself]85-syme into a seat with characteristic care , and wrapped [himself]85-syme up to the chin in the mackintosh rug . Every movement of [the old man]2469-the old man ’s tottering figure and vague hands , every uncertain gesture and panic‑stricken pause , seemed to put it beyond question that [he]85-syme was helpless , that [he]85-syme was in the last imbecility of the body . [He]85-syme moved by inches , [he]85-syme let [himself]85-syme down with little gasps of caution . And yet , unless the philosophical entities called time and space have no vestige even of a practical existence , it appeared quite unquestionable that [he]85-syme had run after [the omnibus]2474-the omnibus . [Syme]85-syme sprang erect upon [the rocking car]2475-the rocking car , and after staring wildly at the wintry sky , that grew gloomier every moment , [he]85-syme ran down the steps . [He]85-syme had repressed an elemental impulse to leap over the side . Too bewildered to look back or to reason , [he]85-syme rushed into [one of [the little courts]2477-the little courts at the side of [Fleet Street]38-fleet street]2476-one of the little courts at the side of fleet street as a rabbit rushes into a hole . [He]85-syme had a vague idea , if [this incomprehensible old Jack‑in‑the‑box]2478-this incomprehensible old jack‑in‑the‑box was really pursuing [him]85-syme , that in [that labyrinth of little streets]2479-that labyrinth of little streets [he]85-syme could soon throw [him]85-syme off the scent . [He]85-syme dived in and out of [those crooked lanes]2480-those crooked lanes , which were more like cracks than [thoroughfares]2481-thoroughfares ; and by the time that [he]85-syme had completed about twenty alternate angles and described an unthinkable polygon , [he]85-syme paused to listen for any sound of pursuit . There was none ; there could not in any case have been much , for [the little streets]2482-the little streets were thick with the soundless snow . Somewhere behind [Red Lion Court]39-red lion court , however , [he]85-syme noticed [a place where [some energetic citizen]2484-some energetic citizen had cleared away the snow for a space of about twenty yards , leaving the wet , glistening cobble‑stones]2483-a place where some energetic citizen had cleared away the snow for a space of about twenty yards , leaving the wet , glistening cobble‑stones . [He]85-syme thought little of this as [he]85-syme passed [it]2483-a place where some energetic citizen had cleared away the snow for a space of about twenty yards , leaving the wet , glistening cobble‑stones , only plunging into yet another arm of [the maze]2485-the maze . But when a few hundred yards farther on [he]85-syme stood still again to listen , [his]85-syme heart stood still also , for [he]85-syme heard from that space of rugged stones the clinking crutch and labouring feet of [the infernal cripple]2486-the infernal cripple . The sky above was loaded with the clouds of snow , leaving [London]2-london in a darkness and oppression premature for that hour of the evening . On each side of [Syme]85-syme the walls of [the alley]2487-the alley were blind and featureless ; there was no little window or any kind of eve . [He]85-syme felt a new impulse to break out of this hive of [houses]2488-houses , and to get once more into [the open and lamp - lit street]2489-the open and lamp - lit street . Yet [he]85-syme rambled and dodged for a long time before [he]85-syme struck [the main thoroughfare]2490-the main thoroughfare . When [he]85-syme did so , [he]85-syme struck it much farther up than [he]85-syme had fancied . [He]85-syme came out into what seemed the vast and void of [Ludgate Circus]40-ludgate circus , and saw [St. Paul ’s Cathedral]41-st. paul ’s cathedral sitting in the sky . At first [he]85-syme was startled to find [these great roads]2491-these great roads so empty , as if a pestilence had swept through [the city]2492-the city . Then [he]85-syme told [himself]85-syme that some degree of emptiness was natural ; first because the snow‑storm was even dangerously deep , and secondly because it was Sunday . And at the very word [Sunday]107-sunday [he]85-syme bit [his]85-syme lip ; the word was henceforth for hire like some indecent pun . Under the white fog of snow high up in the heaven the whole atmosphere of [the city]2492-the city was turned to a very queer kind of green twilight , as of [men]214-men under [the sea]2145-the sea . The sealed and sullen sunset behind [the dark dome of St. Paul ’s]2496-the dark dome of st. paul ’s had in it smoky and sinister colours — colours of sickly green , dead red or decaying bronze , that were just bright enough to emphasise the solid whiteness of the snow . But right up against these dreary colours rose the black bulk of [the cathedral]2497-the cathedral ; and upon the top of [the cathedral]2497-the cathedral was a random splash and great stain of snow , still clinging as to [an Alpine peak]2499-an alpine peak . It had fallen accidentally , but just so fallen as to half drape the dome from its very topmost point , and to pick out in perfect silver the great orb and the cross . When [Syme]85-syme saw it [he]85-syme suddenly straightened [himself]85-syme , and made with [his]85-syme sword‑stick an involuntary salute . [He]85-syme knew that that evil figure , [his]85-syme shadow , was creeping quickly or slowly behind [him]85-syme , and [he]85-syme did not care . It seemed a symbol of human faith and valour that while the skies were darkening [that high place of [the earth]234-the earth]2500-that high place of the earth was bright . The devils might have captured [heaven]2502-heaven , but [they]2503-they had not yet captured the cross . [He]85-syme had a new impulse to tear out the secret of [this dancing , jumping and pursuing paralytic]2504-this dancing , jumping and pursuing paralytic ; and at the entrance of [the court]2505-the court as it opened upon [the Circus]2506-the circus [he]85-syme turned , stick in hand , to face [[his]85-syme pursuer]2507-his pursuer . [Professor de Worms]132-professor de worms came slowly round the corner of [the irregular alley]2508-the irregular alley behind [him]85-syme , [his]85-syme unnatural form outlined against a lonely gas‑lamp , irresistibly recalling that very imaginative figure in the nursery rhymes , “[107-sunday] [the crooked man who went a crooked mile]834-the crooked man who went a crooked mile . ” [He]85-syme really looked as if [he]85-syme had been twisted out of shape by the tortuous streets [he]85-syme had been threading . [He]85-syme came nearer and nearer , the lamplight shining on [his]85-syme lifted spectacles , [his]85-syme lifted , patient face . [Syme]85-syme waited for [him]85-syme as [St. George]121-george waited for the dragon , as [a man]221-a man waits for a final explanation or for death . And [the old Professor]747-the old professor came right up to [him]85-syme and passed [him]85-syme like [a total stranger]810-a total stranger , without even a blink of [his]85-syme mournful eyelids . There was something in this silent and unexpected innocence that left [Syme]85-syme in a final fury . [The man]294-the man ’s colourless face and manner seemed to assert that the whole following had been an accident . [Syme]85-syme was galvanised with an energy that was something between bitterness and a burst of boyish derision . [He]85-syme made a wild gesture as if to knock [the old man]2469-the old man ’s hat off , called out something like “[107-sunday] Catch [me]0-i if [you]835-you can , ” and went racing away across [the white , open Circus]2514-the white , open circus . Concealment was impossible now ; and looking back over [his]85-syme shoulder , [he]85-syme could see the black figure of [the old gentleman]2515-the old gentleman coming after [him]85-syme with long , swinging strides like [a man winning a mile race]2516-a man winning a mile race . [But the head upon that bounding body]2517-but the head upon that bounding body was still pale , grave and professional , like the head of [a lecturer upon the body of [a harlequin]2519-a harlequin]2518-a lecturer upon the body of a harlequin . This outrageous chase sped across [Ludgate Circus]40-ludgate circus , up [Ludgate Hill]42-ludgate hill , round [St. Paul ’s Cathedral]41-st. paul ’s cathedral , along [Cheapside]43-cheapside , [Syme]85-syme remembering all the nightmares [he]85-syme had ever known . Then [Syme]85-syme broke away towards [the river]285-the river , and ended almost down by [the docks]2521-the docks . [He]85-syme saw the yellow panes of [a low , lighted public‑house]2522-a low , lighted public‑house , flung [himself]85-syme into [it]2522-a low , lighted public‑house and ordered beer . It was [a foul tavern]2523-a foul tavern , sprinkled with [foreign sailors]2524-foreign sailors , a place where opium might be smoked or knives drawn . A moment later [Professor de Worms]132-professor de worms entered [the place]193-the place , sat down carefully , and asked for a glass of milk . WHEN [Gabriel Syme]85-syme found [himself]85-syme finally established in a chair , and opposite to [him]85-syme , fixed and final also , the lifted eyebrows and leaden eyelids of [the Professor]805-the professor , [his]85-syme fears fully returned . [This incomprehensible man from the fierce council]2527-this incomprehensible man from the fierce council , after all , had certainly pursued [him]85-syme . If [the man]294-the man had [one character]2529-one character as [a paralytic and another character]2530-a paralytic and another character as [a pursuer]2531-a pursuer , the antithesis might make [him]294-the man more interesting , but scarcely more soothing . It would be a very small comfort that [he]85-syme could not find [the Professor]805-the professor out , if by some serious accident [the Professor]805-the professor should find [him]805-the professor out . [He]85-syme emptied a whole pewter pot of ale before [the professor]805-the professor had touched [his]85-syme milk . One possibility , however , kept [him]85-syme hopeful and yet helpless . It was just possible that this escapade signified something other than even a slight suspicion of [him]85-syme . Perhaps it was some regular form or sign . Perhaps [the foolish scamper]2535-the foolish scamper was some sort of friendly signal that [he]85-syme ought to have understood . Perhaps it was a ritual . Perhaps [the new Thursday]2536-the new thursday was always chased along [Cheapside]43-cheapside , as [the new Lord Mayor]2537-the new lord mayor is always escorted along [it]43-cheapside . [He]85-syme was just selecting a tentative inquiry , when [the old Professor]747-the old professor opposite suddenly and simply cut [him]85-syme short . Before [Syme]85-syme could ask the first diplomatic question , [the old anarchist]2539-the old anarchist had asked suddenly , without any sort of preparation — “[107-sunday] Are [you]836-you [a policeman]353-a policeman ? ” Whatever else [Syme]85-syme had expected , [he]85-syme had never expected anything so brutal and actual as this . Even [his]85-syme great presence of mind could only manage a reply with an air of rather blundering jocularity . “[353-a policeman] [A policeman]353-a policeman ? ” [he]85-syme said , laughing vaguely . “[353-a policeman] Whatever made [you]836-you think of [a policeman]353-a policeman in connection with [me]0-i ? ” “[836-you] The process was simple enough , ” answered [the Professor]805-the professor patiently . “[836-you] [I]0-i thought [you]836-you looked like [a policeman]353-a policeman . [I]0-i think so now . ” “[0-i] Did [I]0-i take [a policeman]353-a policeman ’s hat by mistake out of [the restaurant]2443-the restaurant ? ” asked [Syme]85-syme , smiling wildly . “[0-i] Have [I]0-i by any chance got a number stuck on to [me]0-i somewhere ? Have [my]0-i boots got that watchful look ? Why must [I]0-i be [a policeman]353-a policeman ? Do , do let [me]0-i be [a postman]844-a postman . ” [The old Professor]747-the old professor shook [his]747-the old professor head with a gravity that gave no hope , but [Syme]85-syme ran on with a feverish irony . “[844-a postman] But perhaps [I]0-i misunderstood the delicacies of [your]0-i German philosophy . Perhaps [policeman]845-policeman is a relative term . In an evolutionary sense , [sir]2017-sir , the ape fades so gradually into [the policeman]2202-the policeman , that [I]0-i [myself]0-i can never detect the shade . [The monkey]848-the monkey is only [the policeman that may be]849-the policeman that may be . Perhaps [a maiden lady on [Clapham Common]45-clapham common]850-a maiden lady on clapham common is only [the policeman that might have been]851-the policeman that might have been . [I]0-i do n’t mind being [the policeman that might have been]851-the policeman that might have been . [I]0-i do n’t mind being anything in German thought . ” “[0-i] Are [you]0-i in [the police service]853-the police service ? ” said [the old man]2469-the old man , ignoring all [Syme]85-syme ’s improvised and desperate raillery . “[0-i] Are [you]0-i [a detective]2166-a detective ? ” [Syme]85-syme ’s heart turned to stone , but [his]85-syme face never changed . “[0-i] [Your]2017-sir suggestion is ridiculous , ” [he]85-syme began . “[2017-sir] Why on [earth]2021-earth — ” [The old man]2469-the old man struck [his]2469-the old man palsied hand passionately on the rickety table , nearly breaking it . “[0-i] Did [you]0-i hear [me]0-i ask a plain question , [[you]0-i [pattering spy]857-pattering spy]856-you pattering spy ? ” [he]2469-the old man shrieked in a high , crazy voice . “[0-i] Are [you]0-i , or are [you]0-i not , [a police detective]344-a police detective ? ” “[0-i] No ! ” answered [Syme]85-syme , like [a man standing on the hangman]2544-a man standing on the hangman ’s drop . “[0-i] [You]0-i swear it , ” said [the old man]2469-the old man , leaning across to [him]0-i , [his]2469-the old man dead face becoming as it were loathsomely alive . “[0-i] [You]0-i swear it ! [You]0-i swear it ! If [you]0-i swear falsely , will [you]0-i be damned ? Will [you]0-i be sure that [the devil]859-the devil dances at [your]0-i funeral ? Will [you]0-i see that the nightmare sits on [your]0-i grave ? Will there really be no mistake ? [You]0-i are [an anarchist]1937-an anarchist , [you]0-i are [a dynamiter]861-a dynamiter ! Above all , [you]0-i are not in any sense [a detective]2166-a detective ? [You]0-i are not in [the British police]863-the british police ? ” [He]0-i leant [his]0-i angular elbow far across the table , and put up [his]0-i large loose hand like a flap to [his]0-i ear . “[0-i] [I]0-i am not in [the British police]863-the british police , ” said [Syme]85-syme with insane calm . [Professor de Worms]132-professor de worms fell back in [his]0-i chair with a curious air of kindly collapse . “[0-i] That ’s a pity , ” [he]0-i said , “[0-i] because [I]0-i am . ” [Syme]85-syme sprang up straight , sending back the bench behind [him]85-syme with a crash . “[0-i] Because [you]0-i are what ? ” [he]85-syme said thickly . “[0-i] [You]0-i are what ? ” “[0-i] [I]0-i am [a policeman]353-a policeman , ” said [the Professor]805-the professor with [his]805-the professor first broad smile . and beaming through [his]805-the professor spectacles . “[353-a policeman] But as [you]0-i think [policeman]845-policeman only a relative term , of course [I]0-i have nothing to do with [you]0-i . [I]0-i am in [the British police force]867-the british police force ; but as [you]0-i tell [me]0-i [you]0-i are not in [the British police force]867-the british police force , [I]0-i can only say that [I]0-i met [you]0-i in a [dynamiters ’ club]869-dynamiters ’ club . [I]0-i suppose [I]0-i ought to arrest [you]0-i . ” And with these words [he]0-i laid on the table before [Syme]85-syme an exact facsimile of the blue card which [Syme]85-syme had in [his]85-syme own waistcoat pocket , the symbol of [his]85-syme power from [the police]2007-the police . [Syme]85-syme had for a flash the sensation that [the cosmos]2548-the cosmos had turned exactly upside down , that all trees were growing downwards and that all stars were under [his]85-syme feet . Then came slowly the opposite conviction . For the last twenty‑four hours [the cosmos]2548-the cosmos had really been upside down , but now [the capsized universe]2550-the capsized universe had come right side up again . [This devil from whom [he]85-syme had been fleeing all day]2551-this devil from whom he had been fleeing all day was only [an elder brother of [[his]85-syme own house]2553-his own house , who on the other side of the table lay back and laughed at [him]85-syme]2552-an elder brother of his own house , who on the other side of the table lay back and laughed at him . [He]85-syme did not for the moment ask any questions of detail ; [he]85-syme only knew the happy and silly fact that this shadow , which had pursued [him]85-syme with an intolerable oppression of peril , was only the shadow of [a friend]368-a friend trying to catch [him]85-syme up . [He]85-syme knew simultane­ously that [he]85-syme was [a fool]2060-a fool and [a free man]2556-a free man . For with any recovery from morbidity there must go a certain healthy humiliation . There comes a certain point in such conditions when only three things are possible : first a perpetuation of Satanic pride , secondly tears , and third laughter . [Syme]85-syme ’s egotism held hard to the first course for a few seconds , and then suddenly adopted the third . Taking [his]85-syme own blue police ticket from [his]85-syme own waist coat pocket , [he]85-syme tossed it on to the table ; then [he]85-syme flung [his]85-syme head back until [his]85-syme spike of yellow beard almost pointed at the ceiling , and shouted with a barbaric laughter . Even in [that close den]2557-that close den , perpetually filled with the din of knives , plates , cans , clamorous voices , sudden struggles and stampedes , there was something Homeric in [Syme]85-syme ’s mirth which made [many half - drunken men]2558-many half - drunken men look round . “[0-i] What [yer]870-you laughing at , [guv’nor]140-guv’nor ? ” asked [one wondering labourer from [the docks]2521-the docks]2559-one wondering labourer from the docks . “[0-i] At [myself]0-i , ” answered [Syme]85-syme , and went off again into the agony of [his]0-i ecstatic reaction . “[0-i] Pull [yourself]870-you together , ” said [the Professor]805-the professor , “[870-you] or [you]870-you ’ll get hysterical . Have some more beer . [I]0-i ’ll join [you]870-you . ” “[0-i] [You]870-you have n’t drunk [your]870-you milk , ” said [Syme]85-syme . “[870-you] [My]0-i milk ! ” said [the other]279-the other , in tones of withering and unfathomable contempt , “[870-you] [my]0-i milk ! Do [you]870-you think [I]0-i ’d look at the beastly stuff when [I]0-i ’m out of sight of [the bloody anarchists]871-the bloody anarchists ? [We]872-we ’re [all Christians in [this room]320-this room]873-all christians in this room , though perhaps , ” [he]0-i added , glancing around at [the reeling crowd]2563-the reeling crowd , “[870-you] not [strict ones]875-strict ones . Finish [my]0-i milk ? Great blazes ! yes , [I]0-i ’ll finish it right enough ! ” and [he]0-i knocked the tumbler off the table , making a crash of glass and a splash of silver fluid . [Syme]85-syme was staring at [him]0-i with a happy curiosity . “[0-i] [I]0-i understand now , ” [he]85-syme cried ; “[0-i] of course , [you]870-you ’re not [an old man]876-an old man at all . ” “[0-i] [I]0-i ca n’t take [my]0-i face off here , ” replied [Professor de Worms]132-professor de worms . “[0-i] It ’s rather an elaborate make‑up . As to whether [I]0-i ’m [an old man]876-an old man , that ’s not for [me]0-i to say . [I]0-i was thirty‑eight last birthday . ” “[0-i] Yes , but [I]0-i mean , ” said [Syme]85-syme impatiently , “[0-i] there ’s nothing the matter with [you]870-you . ” “[0-i] Yes , ” answered [the other]279-the other dispassionately . “[0-i] [I]0-i am subject to colds . ” [Syme]85-syme ’s laughter at all this had about it a wild weakness of relief . [He]85-syme laughed at the idea of [the paralytic Professor]2565-the paralytic professor being really [a young actor]2566-a young actor dressed up as if for the foot‑lights . But [he]85-syme felt that [he]85-syme would have laughed as loudly if a pepper­pot had fallen over . [The false Professor]2567-the false professor drank and wiped [his]2567-the false professor false beard . “[870-you] Did [you]870-you know , ” [he]85-syme asked , “[870-you] that [that man [Gogol]124-gogol]878-that man gogol was [one of [us]880-us]879-one of us ? ” “[0-i] [I]0-i ? If [we]883-we had only known that [we]883-we were three ! ” The face of [Professor de Worms]132-professor de worms darkened , and [he]132-professor de worms did not look up . “[883-we] [We]883-we were three , ” [he]132-professor de worms said . “[883-we] If [we]883-we had been three hundred [we]883-we could still have done nothing . ” “[883-we] Not if [we]883-we were three hundred against four ? ” asked [Syme]85-syme , jeering rather boisterously . “[883-we] No , ” said [the Professor]805-the professor with sobriety , “[107-sunday] not if [we]883-we were three hundred against [Sunday]107-sunday . ” And the mere name struck [Syme]85-syme cold and serious ; [his]85-syme laughter had died in [his]85-syme heart before it could die on [his]85-syme lips . The face of [the unforgettable President]2571-the unforgettable president sprang into [his]85-syme mind as startling as a coloured photograph , and [he]85-syme remarked this difference between [Sunday]107-sunday and [all [his]85-syme satellites]2572-all his satellites , that [their]2572-all his satellites faces , however fierce or sinister , became gradually blurred by memory like other human faces , whereas [Sunday]107-sunday ’s seemed almost to grow more actual during absence , as if [a man]221-a man ’s painted portrait should slowly come alive . [They]2572-all his satellites were both silent for a measure of moments , and then [Syme]85-syme ’s speech came with a rush , like the sudden foaming of champagne . “[884-professor] [Professor]884-professor , ” [he]85-syme cried , “[884-professor] it is intolerable . Are [you]884-professor afraid of [this man]360-this man ? ” [The Professor]805-the professor lifted [his]805-the professor heavy lids , and gazed at [Syme]85-syme with large , wide‑open , blue eyes of an almost ethereal honesty . “[884-professor] Yes , [I]0-i am , ” [he]805-the professor said mildly . “[0-i] So are [you]884-professor . ” [Syme]85-syme was dumb for an instant . Then [he]85-syme rose to [his]85-syme feet erect , like [an insulted man]2575-an insulted man , and thrust the chair away from [him]85-syme . “[884-professor] Yes , ” [he]85-syme said in a voice indescribable , “[884-professor] [you]884-professor are right . [I]0-i am afraid of [him]360-this man . [He]141-de worms made an effort to speak , but [Syme]85-syme went on in a low voice , but with an undercurrent of inhuman exaltation — “[0-i] Who would condescend to strike down the mere things that [he]360-this man does not fear ? Who would debase [himself]360-this man to be merely brave , like [any common prizefighter]891-any common prizefighter ? Who would stoop to be fearless — like a tree ? [You]892-you remember the old tale of [the English clergyman who gave the last rites to [the brigand of [Sicily]46-sicily]894-the brigand of sicily]893-the english clergyman who gave the last rites to the brigand of sicily , and how on [his]893-the english clergyman who gave the last rites to the brigand of sicily death‑bed [the great robber]895-the great robber said , ‘ [I]0-i can give [you]892-you no money , but [I]0-i can give [you]892-you advice for a lifetime : [your]892-you thumb on the blade , and strike upwards . ’ So [I]0-i say to [you]892-you , strike upwards , if [you]892-you strike at the stars . ” [The other]279-the other looked at the ceiling , one of the tricks of [his]0-i pose . “[0-i] [Sunday]107-sunday is a fixed star , ” [he]0-i said . “[107-sunday] [You]892-you shall see [him]895-the great robber a falling star , ” said [Syme]85-syme , and put on [his]85-syme hat . The decision of [his]85-syme gesture drew [the Professor]805-the professor vaguely to [his]805-the professor feet . “[107-sunday] Have [you]892-you any idea , ” [he]0-i asked , with a sort of benevolent bewilderment , “[107-sunday] exactly where [you]892-you are going ? ” “[107-sunday] Yes , ” replied [Syme]85-syme shortly , “[107-sunday] [I]0-i am going to prevent this bomb being thrown in [Paris]34-paris . ” “[0-i] Have [you]892-you any conception how ? ” inquired [the other]279-the other . “[0-i] No , ” said [Syme]85-syme with equal decision . “[0-i] [You]892-you remember , of course , ” resumed [the soi‑disant de Worms]141-de worms , pulling [his]141-de worms beard and looking out of the window , “[0-i] that when [we]896-we broke up rather hurriedly the whole arrangements for the atrocity were left in the private hands of [the Marquis]745-the marquis and [Dr. Bull]134-dr. bull . [You]2581-young man think that it is possible to pull down [the President]2320-the president . [I]805-the professor know that it is impossible , and [I]805-the professor am going to try it , ”[805-the professor] and opening [the tavern]905-the tavern door , which let in a blast of bitter air , [they]906-they went out together into [the dark streets]907-the dark streets by [the docks]2521-the docks . Most of the snow was melted or trampled to mud , but here and there a clot of it still showed grey rather than white in the gloom . [The small streets]909-the small streets were sloppy and full of pools , which reflected the flaming lamps irregularly , and by accident , like fragments of some other and fallen world . [Syme]85-syme felt almost dazed as [he]85-syme stepped through this growing confusion of lights and shadows ; but [[his]85-syme companion]291-his companion walked on with a certain briskness , towards where , at the end of [the street]277-the street , an inch or two of [the lamplit river]912-the lamplit river looked like a bar of flame . “ Where are [you]805-the professor going ? ”[85-syme] [Syme]85-syme inquired . “ Just now , ”[805-the professor] answered [the Professor]805-the professor , “ [I]805-the professor am going just round the corner to see whether [Dr. Bull]134-dr. bull has gone to bed . [He]134-dr. bull is hygienic , and retires early . ”[805-the professor] “ [Dr. Bull]134-dr. bull ! ”[85-syme] exclaimed [Syme]85-syme . “ Does [he]134-dr. bull live round [the corner]2584-the corner ? ”[85-syme] “ No , ”[507-his friend] answered [[his]85-syme friend]507-his friend . “ As a matter of fact [he]134-dr. bull lives some way off , on [the other side of [the river]285-the river]2585-the other side of the river , but [we]2587-we can tell from here whether [he]134-dr. bull has gone to bed . ”[805-the professor] Turning the corner as [he]805-the professor spoke , and facing [the dim river]915-the dim river , flecked with flame , [he]805-the professor pointed with [his]805-the professor stick to the other bank . On [the Surrey]47-the surrey side at this point there ran out into [the Thames]26-the thames , seeming almost to overhang [it]26-the thames , a bulk and cluster of [those tall tenements]916-those tall tenements , dotted with lighted windows , and rising like [factory chimneys]917-factory chimneys to an almost insane height . [Their]916-those tall tenements special poise and position made [one block of buildings]918-one block of buildings especially look like [a Tower of Babel with a hundred eyes]919-a tower of babel with a hundred eyes . [Syme]85-syme had never seen any of [the sky‑scraping buildings in [America]48-america]920-the sky‑scraping buildings in america , so [he]85-syme could only think of [the buildings]921-the buildings in a dream . Come along and get some dinner . [The Professor]805-the professor , who seemed to know [his]805-the professor way about [the neighbourhood]928-the neighbourhood , proceeded to a place where [the line of lighted shops]929-the line of lighted shops fell back into a sort of abrupt twilight and quiet , in which [an old white inn]930-an old white inn , all out of repair , stood back some twenty feet from [the road]278-the road . “ [You]85-syme can find [good English inns]2591-good english inns left by accident everywhere , like fossils , ”[805-the professor] explained [the Professor]805-the professor . “ [I]805-the professor once found a decent place in [the West End]49-the west end . ”[805-the professor] “ [I]85-syme suppose , ”[85-syme] said [Syme]85-syme , smiling , “ that this is [the corresponding decent place in [the East End]50-the east end]2592-the corresponding decent place in the east end ? ”[85-syme] “ It is , ”[805-the professor] said [the Professor]805-the professor reverently , and went in . In [that place]230-that place [they]925-they dined and slept , both very thoroughly . The beans and bacon , which [these unaccountable people]935-these unaccountable people cooked well , the astonishing emergence of [Burgundy]142-burgundy from [[their]935-these unaccountable people cellars]936-their cellars , crowned [Syme]85-syme ’s sense of a new comradeship and comfort . Through all this ordeal [his]85-syme root horror had been isolation , and there are no words to express the abyss between isolation and having one ally . It may be conceded to [the mathematicians]937-the mathematicians that four is twice two . But two is not twice one ; two is two thousand times one . That is why , in spite of a hundred disadvantages , [the world]231-the world will always return to monogamy . [Syme]85-syme was able to pour out for the first time the whole of [his]85-syme outrageous tale , from the time when [Gregory]106-gregory had taken [him]85-syme to [the little tavern by [the river]285-the river]939-the little tavern by the river . [He]85-syme did it idly and amply , in a luxuriant monologue , as [a man]221-a man speaks with [very old friends]942-very old friends . On [his]85-syme side , also , [the man who had impersonated [Professor de Worms]132-professor de worms]943-the man who had impersonated professor de worms was not less communicative . [His]943-the man who had impersonated professor de worms own story was almost as silly as [Syme]85-syme ’s . “ That ’s a good get‑up of [yours]85-syme , ”[85-syme] said [Syme]85-syme , draining a glass of Mâcon ; “ a lot better than old [Gogol]124-gogol ’s . Even at the start [I]85-syme thought [he]124-gogol was a bit too hairy . ”[85-syme] “ A difference of artistic theory , ”[805-the professor] replied [the Professor]805-the professor pensively . “ [Gogol]124-gogol was [an idealist]2593-an idealist . [He]124-gogol made up as the abstract or platonic ideal of [an anarchist]1937-an anarchist . But [I]805-the professor am [a realist]2595-a realist . [I]805-the professor am [a portrait painter]2596-a portrait painter . But , indeed , to say that [I]805-the professor am [a portrait painter]2596-a portrait painter is an inadequate expression . [I]805-the professor am a portrait . ”[805-the professor] “ [I]85-syme do n’t understand [you]805-the professor , ”[85-syme] said [Syme]85-syme . “ [I]805-the professor am a portrait , ”[805-the professor] repeated [the Professor]805-the professor . “ [I]805-the professor am a portrait of the celebrated [Professor de Worms]132-professor de worms , who is , [I]805-the professor believe , in [Naples]51-naples . ”[805-the professor] “ [You]805-the professor mean [you]805-the professor are made up like [him]132-professor de worms , ”[85-syme] said [Syme]85-syme . “ But does n’t [he]132-professor de worms know that [you]805-the professor are taking [his]132-professor de worms nose in vain ? ”[85-syme] “ [He]132-professor de worms knows it right enough , ”[507-his friend] replied [[his]805-the professor friend]507-his friend cheerfully . “ Then why does n’t [he]132-professor de worms denounce [you]805-the professor ? ”[507-his friend] “ [I]805-the professor have denounced [him]132-professor de worms , ”[805-the professor] answered [the Professor]805-the professor . “ Do explain [yourself]805-the professor , ”[85-syme] said [Syme]85-syme . “ With pleasure , if [you]805-the professor do n’t mind hearing [my]948-the eminent foreign philosopher story , ”[948-the eminent foreign philosopher] replied [the eminent foreign philosopher]948-the eminent foreign philosopher . “ [I]948-the eminent foreign philosopher am by profession [an actor]2598-an actor , and [my]948-the eminent foreign philosopher name is [Wilks]117-wilks . When [I]948-the eminent foreign philosopher was on the stage [I]948-the eminent foreign philosopher mixed with all sorts of [Bohemian and blackguard company]2599-bohemian and blackguard company . Sometimes [I]948-the eminent foreign philosopher touched the edge of the turf , sometimes [the riff‑raff of the arts]2600-the riff‑raff of the arts , and occasionally [the political refugee]2601-the political refugee . In [some den of [exiled dreamers]2603-exiled dreamers]2602-some den of exiled dreamers [I]948-the eminent foreign philosopher was introduced to [the great German Nihilist philosopher]2604-the great german nihilist philosopher , [Professor de Worms]132-professor de worms . [I]948-the eminent foreign philosopher did not gather much about [him]132-professor de worms beyond [his]132-professor de worms appearance , which was very disgusting , and which [I]948-the eminent foreign philosopher studied carefully . [I]948-the eminent foreign philosopher understood that [he]132-professor de worms had proved that the destructive principle in [the universe]2261-the universe was [God]95-god ; hence [he]132-professor de worms insisted on the need for a furious and incessant energy , rending all things in pieces . Energy , [he]132-professor de worms said , was the All . [He]132-professor de worms was lame , shortsighted , and partially paralytic . When [I]948-the eminent foreign philosopher met [him]132-professor de worms [I]948-the eminent foreign philosopher was in a frivolous mood , and [I]948-the eminent foreign philosopher disliked [him]132-professor de worms so much that [I]948-the eminent foreign philosopher resolved to imitate [him]132-professor de worms . If [I]948-the eminent foreign philosopher had been [a draughtsman]2606-a draughtsman [I]948-the eminent foreign philosopher would have drawn a caricature . [I]948-the eminent foreign philosopher was only [an actor]2598-an actor , [I]948-the eminent foreign philosopher could only act a caricature . [I]948-the eminent foreign philosopher made [myself]948-the eminent foreign philosopher up into what was meant for a wild exaggeration of [the old Professor]747-the old professor ’s dirty old self . When [I]948-the eminent foreign philosopher went into [the room full of [[his]747-the old professor supporters]2610-his supporters]2609-the room full of his supporters [I]948-the eminent foreign philosopher expected to be received with a roar of laughter , or ( if [they]2610-his supporters were too far gone ) with a roar of indignation at the insult . [I]948-the eminent foreign philosopher can not describe the surprise [I]948-the eminent foreign philosopher felt when [my]948-the eminent foreign philosopher entrance was received with a respectful silence , followed ( when [I]948-the eminent foreign philosopher had first opened [my]948-the eminent foreign philosopher lips ) with a murmur of admiration . The curse of [the perfect artist]2611-the perfect artist had fallen upon [me]948-the eminent foreign philosopher . [I]948-the eminent foreign philosopher had been too subtle , [I]948-the eminent foreign philosopher had been too true . [They]2610-his supporters thought [I]948-the eminent foreign philosopher really was [the great Nihilist Professor]2612-the great nihilist professor . [I]948-the eminent foreign philosopher was [a healthy - minded young man]2613-a healthy - minded young man at the time , and [I]948-the eminent foreign philosopher confess that it was a blow . Before [I]948-the eminent foreign philosopher could fully recover , however , [two or three of [these admirers]2615-these admirers]2614-two or three of these admirers ran up to [me]948-the eminent foreign philosopher radiating indignation , and told [me]948-the eminent foreign philosopher that a public insult had been put upon [me]948-the eminent foreign philosopher in [the next room]2616-the next room . [I]948-the eminent foreign philosopher inquired its nature . It seemed that [an impertinent fellow]2617-an impertinent fellow had dressed [himself]2617-an impertinent fellow up as a preposterous parody of [myself]948-the eminent foreign philosopher . [I]948-the eminent foreign philosopher had drunk more champagne than was good for [me]948-the eminent foreign philosopher , and in a flash of folly [I]948-the eminent foreign philosopher decided to see the situation through . Consequently it was to meet the glare of [the company]2618-the company and [my]948-the eminent foreign philosopher own lifted eyebrows and freezing eyes that [the real Professor]2619-the real professor came into [the room]292-the room . “[948-the eminent foreign philosopher] [I]0-i need hardly say there was a collision . [[The pessimists]949-the pessimists all round [me]0-i]950-the pessimists all round me looked anxiously from [one Professor]951-one professor to [the other Professor]952-the other professor to see which was really the more feeble . But [I]0-i won . [An old man in poor health , like [[my]0-i rival]954-my rival]953-an old man in poor health , like my rival , could not be expected to be so impressively feeble as [a young actor in the prime of life]955-a young actor in the prime of life . [You]956-you see , [he]953-an old man in poor health , like my rival really had paralysis , and working within this definite limitation , [he]953-an old man in poor health , like my rival could n’t be so jolly paralytic as [I]0-i was . Then [he]953-an old man in poor health , like my rival tried to blast [my]0-i claims intellectually . [I]0-i countered that by a very simple dodge . Whenever [he]953-an old man in poor health , like my rival said something that [nobody]2082-nobody but [he]953-an old man in poor health , like my rival could understand , [I]0-i replied with something which [I]0-i could not even understand [myself]0-i . ‘ [I]0-i do n’t fancy , ’ [he]953-an old man in poor health , like my rival said , ‘ that [you]0-i could have worked out the principle that evolution is only negation , since there inheres in it the introduction of lacuna , which are an essential of differentiation . ’ [I]0-i replied quite scornfully , ‘ [You]953-an old man in poor health , like my rival read all that up in Pinckwerts ; the notion that involution functioned eugenically was exposed long ago by [Glumpe]143-glumpe . ’ It is unnecessary for [me]0-i to say that there never were [such people]958-such people as [Pinckwerts]144-pinckwerts and [Glumpe]143-glumpe . But [the people all round]959-the people all round ( rather to [my]0-i surprise ) seemed to remember [them]958-such people quite well , and [the Professor]805-the professor , finding that the learned and mysterious method left [him]805-the professor rather at the mercy of an enemy slightly deficient in scruples , fell back upon a more popular form of wit . ‘ [I]0-i see , ’ [he]953-an old man in poor health , like my rival sneered , ‘ [you]0-i prevail like the false pig in [Æsop]145-æsop . ’ ‘ And [you]805-the professor fail , ’ [I]0-i answered , smiling , ‘ like the hedgehog in [Montaigne]52-montaigne . ’ Need [I]0-i say that there is no hedgehog in [Montaigne]52-montaigne ? ‘ [Your]0-i clap­trap comes off , ’ [he]953-an old man in poor health , like my rival said ; ‘ so would [your]0-i beard . ’ [I]0-i had no intelligent answer to this , which was quite true and rather witty . But [I]0-i laughed heartily , answered , ‘ Like [the Pantheist]961-the pantheist ’s boots , ’ at random , and turned on [my]0-i heel with all the honours of victory . [The real Professor]2619-the real professor was thrown out , but not with violence , though [one man]616-one man tried very patiently to pull off [his]616-one man nose . [He]616-one man is now , [I]0-i believe , received everywhere in [Europe]12-europe as [a delightful impostor]964-a delightful impostor . Inside [I]0-i am really bursting with boyish merriment ; but [I]0-i acted [the paralytic Professor]2565-the paralytic professor so well , that now [I]0-i ca n’t leave off . So that when [I]0-i am among [friends]984-friends , and have no need at all to disguise [myself]0-i , [I]0-i still ca n’t help speaking slow and wrinkling [my]0-i forehead — just as if it were [my]0-i forehead . [I]0-i can be quite happy , [you]985-you understand , but only in a paralytic sort of way . Then [he]805-the professor said in a low voice — “[985-you] Can [you]985-you play the piano ? ” “[985-you] Yes , ” said [Syme]85-syme in simple wonder , “[985-you] [I]0-i ’m supposed to have a good touch . ” Then , as [the other]279-the other did not speak , [he]805-the professor added — “[0-i] [I]0-i trust the great cloud is lifted . ” After a long silence , [the Professor]805-the professor said out of the cavernous shadow of [his]805-the professor hands — “[0-i] It would have done just as well if [you]985-you could work a typewriter . ” “[0-i] Thank [you]985-you , ” said [Syme]85-syme , “[985-you] [you]985-you flatter [me]0-i . ” “[985-you] Listen to [me]0-i , ” said [the other]279-the other , “[0-i] and remember whom [we]988-we have to see to­morrow . [You]985-you and [I]0-i are going to‑morrow to attempt something which is very much more dangerous than trying to steal the Crown Jewels out of [the Tower]989-the tower . [We]988-we are trying to steal a secret from [a very sharp , very strong , and very wicked man]990-a very sharp , very strong , and very wicked man . [I]0-i believe there is [no man]889-no man , except [the President]2320-the president , of course , who is so seriously startling and formidable as [that little grinning fellow in goggles]993-that little grinning fellow in goggles . [He]990-a very sharp , very strong , and very wicked man has not perhaps the white‑hot enthusiasm unto death , the mad martyrdom for anarchy , which marks [the Secretary]701-the secretary . But then that very fanaticism in [the Secretary]146-the secretary has a human pathos , and is almost a redeeming trait . But [the little Doctor]995-the little doctor has a brutal sanity that is more shocking than [the Secretary]146-the secretary ’s disease . Do n’t [you]996-you notice [his]995-the little doctor detestable virility and vitality . [He]995-the little doctor bounces like an india‑rubber ball .
