[Syme]85-syme , if [we]1000-we are to go through this interview and come out sane or alive , [we]1000-we must have some code of signals between [us]1000-we that [this brute]1001-this brute will not see . [I]0-i have made a rough alphabetical cypher corresponding to the five fingers — like this , see , ” and [he]995-the little doctor rippled with [his]995-the little doctor fingers on the wooden table—“B[0-i] A D , bad , a word [we]1000-we may frequently require . ” [Syme]85-syme poured [himself]85-syme out another glass of wine , and began to study the scheme . [He]85-syme was abnormally quick with [his]85-syme brains at puzzles , and with [his]85-syme hands at conjuring , and it did not take [him]85-syme long to learn how [he]85-syme might convey simple messages by what would seem to be idle taps upon a table or knee . But wine and companionship had always the effect of inspiring [him]85-syme to a farcical ingenuity , and [the Professor]805-the professor soon found [himself]805-the professor struggling with the too vast energy of the new language , as it passed through the heated brain of [Syme]85-syme . “[1000-we] [We]1000-we must have several word‑signs , ” said [Syme]85-syme seriously—“words[1000-we] that [we]1000-we are likely to want , fine shades of meaning . [My]0-i favourite word is ’ coeval . ’ What ’s [yours]1002-you ? ” “[1002-you] Do stop playing the goat , ” said [the Professor]805-the professor plaintively . “[1002-you] [You]1002-you do n’t know how serious this is . ” “[1002-you] ’ Lush , ’ too , ” said [Syme]85-syme , shaking [his]85-syme head sagaciously , “[1002-you] [we]1000-we must have ’ lush’—word applied to grass , do n’t [you]1002-you know ? ” “[1002-you] Do [you]1002-you imagine , ” asked [the Professor]805-the professor furiously , “[1002-you] that [we]1000-we are going to talk to [Dr. Bull]134-dr. bull about grass ? ” “[134-dr. bull] There are several ways in which the subject could be approached , ” said [Syme]85-syme reflectively , “[134-dr. bull] and the word introduced without appearing forced . [We]1000-we might say , ’ [Dr. Bull]134-dr. bull , as [a revolutionist]1003-a revolutionist , [you]1002-you remember that [a tyrant]459-a tyrant once advised [us]1000-we to eat grass ; and indeed many of [us]1000-we , looking on the fresh lush grass of summer ” ’ “[1002-you] Do [you]1002-you understand , ” said [the other]279-the other , “[1002-you] that this is a tragedy ? ” “[1002-you] Perfectly , ” replied [Syme]85-syme ; “[1002-you] always be comic in a tragedy . What the deuce else can [you]1002-you do ? [I]0-i wish this language of yours had a wider scope . [I]0-i suppose [we]1000-we could not extend it from the fingers to the toes ? That would involve pulling off [our]1000-we boots and socks during the conversation , which however unobtrusively performed — ” “[85-syme] [Syme]85-syme , ” said [[his]85-syme friend]507-his friend with a stern simplicity , “[85-syme] go to bed ! ” [Syme]85-syme , however , sat up in bed for a considerable time mastering the new code . [He]85-syme was awakened next morning while [the east]2634-the east was still sealed with darkness , and found [[his]85-syme grey‑bearded ally]2635-his grey‑bearded ally standing like a ghost beside [his]85-syme bed . [Syme]85-syme sat up in bed blinking ; then slowly collected [his]85-syme thoughts , threw off the bed‑clothes , and stood up . It seemed to [him]85-syme in some curious way that all the safety and sociability of the night before fell with the bedclothes off [him]85-syme , and [he]85-syme stood up in an air of cold danger . [He]85-syme still felt an entire trust and loyalty towards [[his]85-syme companion]291-his companion ; but it was the trust between [two men going to the scaffold]2637-two men going to the scaffold . “[85-syme] Well , ” said [Syme]85-syme with a forced cheerfulness as [he]85-syme pulled on [his]85-syme trousers , “[85-syme] [I]0-i dreamt of that alphabet of [yours]1005-you . Did it take [you]1005-you long to make it up ? ” [The Professor]805-the professor made no answer , but gazed in front of [him]85-syme with eyes the colour of [a wintry sea]2639-a wintry sea ; so [Syme]85-syme repeated [his]85-syme question . “[0-i] [I]0-i say , did it take [you]1005-you long to invent all this ? [I]0-i ’m considered good at these things , and it was a good hour ’s grind . Did [you]1005-you learn it all on the spot ? ” [The Professor]805-the professor was silent ; [his]805-the professor eyes were wide open , and [he]805-the professor wore a fixed but very small smile . “[1005-you] How long did it take [you]1005-you ? ” [The Professor]805-the professor did not move . “[1005-you] Confound [you]1005-you , ca n’t [you]1005-you answer ? ” called out [Syme]85-syme , in a sudden anger that had something like fear underneath . Whether or no [the Professor]805-the professor could answer , [he]805-the professor did not . [Syme]85-syme stood staring back at the stiff face like parchment and the blank , blue eyes . [His]85-syme first thought was that [the Professor]805-the professor had gone mad , but [his]85-syme second thought was more frightful . After all , what did [he]85-syme know about [this queer creature whom [he]85-syme had heedlessly accepted as [a friend]368-a friend]2644-this queer creature whom he had heedlessly accepted as a friend ? What did [he]85-syme know , except that [the man]294-the man had been at the anarchist breakfast and had told [him]85-syme a ridiculous tale ? How improbable it was that there should be [another friend]2647-another friend [there]1968-there beside [Gogol]124-gogol ! Was [this man]360-this man ’s silence a sensational way of declaring war ? Was this adamantine stare after all only the awful sneer of [some threefold traitor , who had turned for the last time]2650-some threefold traitor , who had turned for the last time ? [He]85-syme stood and strained [his]85-syme ears in this heartless silence . [He]85-syme almost fancied [he]85-syme could hear [dynamiters]2651-dynamiters come to capture [him]85-syme shifting softly in [the corridor outside]2652-the corridor outside . Then [his]85-syme eye strayed downwards , and [he]85-syme burst out laughing . Though [the Professor]805-the professor [himself]805-the professor stood there as voiceless as a statue , [his]805-the professor five dumb fingers were dancing alive upon the dead table . [Syme]85-syme watched the twinkling movements of the talking hand , and read clearly the message — “[1005-you] [I]0-i will only talk like this . [We]1006-they must get used to it . ” [He]85-syme rapped out the answer with the impatience of relief — “[1006-they] All right . Let ’s get out to breakfast . ” [They]1006-they took [their]1006-they hats and sticks in silence ; but as [Syme]85-syme took [his]85-syme sword‑stick , [he]85-syme held it hard . [They]1006-they paused for a few minutes only to stuff down coffee and coarse thick sandwiches at a coffee stall , and then made [their]1006-they way across [the river]285-the river , which under the grey and growing light looked as desolate as [Acheron]53-acheron . [They]1006-they reached the bottom of [the huge block of buildings which [they]1006-they had seen from across [the river]285-the river]2655-the huge block of buildings which they had seen from across the river , and began in silence to mount the naked and numberless stone steps , only pausing now and then to make short remarks on the rail of the banisters . At about every other flight [they]1006-they passed a window ; each window showed [them]1006-they a pale and tragic dawn lifting itself laboriously over [London]2-london . From [each the innumerable roofs of slate]2657-each the innumerable roofs of slate looked like the leaden surges of a grey , troubled sea after rain . [Syme]85-syme was increasingly conscious that [his]85-syme new adventure had somehow a quality of cold sanity worse than the wild adventures of the past . Last night , for instance , [the tall tenements]2658-the tall tenements had seemed to [him]85-syme like [a tower]686-a tower in a dream . As [he]85-syme now went up [the weary and perpetual steps]2660-the weary and perpetual steps , [he]85-syme was daunted and bewildered by [their]1006-they almost infinite series . But it was not the hot horror of a dream or of anything that might be exaggeration or delusion . [Their]1006-they infinity was more like the empty infinity of arithmetic , something unthinkable , yet necessary to thought . Or it was like the stunning statements of astronomy about the distance of the fixed stars . [He]85-syme was ascending [the house of reason]2661-the house of reason , a thing more hideous than unreason itself . By the time [they]1006-they reached [[Dr. Bull]134-dr. bull ’s landing]2662-dr. bull ’s landing , a last window showed [them]1006-they a harsh , white dawn edged with banks of a kind of coarse red , more like red clay than red cloud . And when [they]1006-they entered [[Dr. Bull]134-dr. bull ’s bare garret]2663-dr. bull ’s bare garret it was full of light . [Syme]85-syme had been haunted by a half historic memory in connection with [these empty rooms]2664-these empty rooms and that austere daybreak . The moment [he]85-syme saw the garret and [Dr. Bull]134-dr. bull sitting writing at a table , [he]85-syme remembered what the memory was — the French Revolution . There should have been the black outline of a guillotine against that heavy red and white of the morning . [Dr. Bull]134-dr. bull was in [his]134-dr. bull white shirt and black breeches only ; [his]134-dr. bull cropped , dark head might well have just come out of its wig ; [he]134-dr. bull might have been [Marat]147-marat or [a more slipshod Robespierre]2665-a more slipshod robespierre . Yet when [he]134-dr. bull was seen properly , the French fancy fell away . [The Jacobins]148-the jacobins were [idealists]2666-idealists ; there was about [this man]360-this man a murderous materialism . [His]134-dr. bull Dosition gave [him]134-dr. bull a somewhat new appearance . The strong , white light of morning coming from one side creating sharp shadows , made [him]134-dr. bull seem both more pale and more angular than [he]134-dr. bull had looked at the breakfast on [the balcony]588-the balcony . Thus the two black glasses that encased [his]134-dr. bull eyes might really have been black cavities in [his]134-dr. bull skull , making [him]134-dr. bull look like a death’s‑head . And , indeed , if ever [Death]149-death [himself]149-death sat writing at a wooden table , it might have been [he]149-death . [He]134-dr. bull looked up and smiled brightly enough as [the men]612-the men came in , and rose with the resilient rapidity of which [the Professor]805-the professor had spoken . [He]134-dr. bull set chairs for both of [them]612-the men , and going to a peg behind the door , proceeded to put on a coat and waistcoat of rough , dark tweed ; [he]134-dr. bull buttoned it up neatly , and came back to sit down at [his]134-dr. bull table . The quiet good humour of [his]134-dr. bull manner left [[his]134-dr. bull two opponents]2671-his two opponents helpless . It was with some momentary difficulty that [the Professor]805-the professor broke silence and began , “[0-i] [I]0-i ’m sorry to disturb [you]1007-you so early , [comrade]366-comrade , ” said [he]805-the professor , with a careful resumption of the slow de Worms manner . “[1007-you] [You]1007-you have no doubt made all the arrangements for the [Paris]34-paris affair ? ” Then [he]805-the professor added with infinite slowness , “[1007-you] [We]1009-we have information which renders intolerable anything in the nature of a moment ’s delay . ” [Dr. Bull]134-dr. bull smiled again , but continued to gaze on [them]2671-his two opponents without speaking . [The Professor]805-the professor resumed , a pause before each weary word — “[0-i] Please do not think [me]0-i excessively abrupt ; but [I]0-i advise [you]1007-you to alter those plans , or if it is too late for that , to follow [[your]1007-you agent]1010-your agent with all the support [you]1007-you can get for [him]1010-your agent . [Comrade Syme]113-syme and [I]0-i have had an experience which it would take more time to recount than [we]1009-we can afford , if [we]1009-we are to act on it . [I]0-i will , however , relate the occurrence in detail , even at the risk of losing time , if [you]1007-you really feel that it is essential to the understanding of the problem [we]1009-we have to discuss . ” [He]805-the professor was spinning out [his]805-the professor sentences , making them intolerably long and lingering , in the hope of maddening [the practical little Doctor]2674-the practical little doctor into an explosion of impatience which might show [his]805-the professor hand . But [the little Doctor]995-the little doctor continued only to stare and smile , and the monologue was uphill work . [Syme]113-syme began to feel a new sickness and despair . [The Doctor]150-the doctor ’s smile and silence were not at all like the cataleptic stare and horrible silence which [he]150-the doctor had confronted in [the Professor]805-the professor half an hour before . About [the Professor]805-the professor ’s make­up and all [his]805-the professor antics there was always something merely grotesque , like a gollywog . [Syme]113-syme remembered those wild woes of yesterday as [one]225-one remembers being afraid of [Bogy]151-bogy in childhood . But here was daylight ; here was [a healthy , square‑shouldered man in tweeds]2679-a healthy , square‑shouldered man in tweeds , not odd save for the accident of [his]805-the professor ugly spectacles , not glaring or grinning at all , but smiling steadily and not saying a word . [The whole]2680-the whole had a sense of unbearable reality . Under the increasing sunlight the colours of [the Doctor]2681-the doctor ’s complexion , the pattern of [his]805-the professor tweeds , grew and expanded outrageously , as such things grow too important in a realistic novel . But [his]805-the professor smile was quite slight , the pose of [his]805-the professor head polite ; the only uncanny thing was [his]805-the professor silence . “[0-i] As [I]0-i say , ” resumed [the Professor]805-the professor , like [a man toiling through heavy sand]2683-a man toiling through heavy sand , “[0-i] the incident that has occurred to [us]1011-us and has led [us]1011-us to ask for information about [the Marquis]745-the marquis , is one which [you]1013-you may think it better to have narrated ; but as it came in the way of [Comrade Syme]113-syme rather than [me]0-i — ” [His]0-i words [he]0-i seemed to be dragging out like words in an anthem ; but [Syme]113-syme , who was watching , saw [his]0-i long fingers rattle quickly on the edge of the crazy table . [He]113-syme read the message , “[1013-you] [You]1013-you must go on . [This devil]1014-this devil has sucked [me]0-i dry ! ” [Syme]113-syme plunged into the breach with that bravado of improvisation which always came to [him]113-syme when [he]113-syme was alarmed . “[1014-this devil] Yes , the thing really happened to [me]0-i , ” [he]0-i said hastily . “[1014-this devil] [I]0-i had the good fortune to fall into conversation with [a detective who took [me]0-i , thanks to [my]0-i hat , for [a respectable person]1016-a respectable person]1015-a detective who took me , thanks to my hat , for a respectable person . So unless [you]1020-you or [I]0-i can get on [his]1015-a detective who took me , thanks to my hat , for a respectable person track — ” [The Doctor]2681-the doctor was still smiling in the most friendly way , and [his]2681-the doctor protected eyes were still impenetrable . [The Professor]805-the professor signalled to [Syme]113-syme that [he]805-the professor would resume [his]805-the professor explanation , and [he]805-the professor began again with the same elaborate calm . “[113-syme] [Syme]113-syme immediately brought this information to [me]0-i , and [we]1021-we came here together to see what use [you]1020-you would be inclined to make of it . It seems to [me]0-i unquestionably urgent that — ” All this time [Syme]113-syme had been staring at [the Doctor]2681-the doctor almost as steadily as [the Doctor]2681-the doctor stared at [the Professor]805-the professor , but quite without the smile . The nerves of [both comrades‑in‑arms]2689-both comrades‑in‑arms were near snapping under that strain of motionless amiability , when [Syme]113-syme suddenly leant forward and idly tapped the edge of the table . [His]0-i message to [[his]0-i ally]2690-his ally ran , “[0-i] [I]0-i have an intuition . ” [The Professor]805-the professor , with scarcely a pause in [his]805-the professor monologue , signalled back , “[0-i] Then sit on it . ” [Syme]113-syme telegraphed , “[0-i] It is quite extraordinary . ” [The other]279-the other answered , “[0-i] Extraordinary rot ! ” [Syme]113-syme said , “[0-i] [I]0-i am [a poet]197-a poet . ” [The other]279-the other retorted , “[197-a poet] [You]0-i are [a dead man]1023-a dead man . ” [Syme]113-syme had gone quite red up to [his]113-syme yellow hair , and [his]113-syme eyes were burning feverishly . As [he]113-syme said [he]113-syme had an intuition , and it had risen to a sort of light­headed certainty . It has that sudden quality [we]1025-we sometimes feel in the coming of spring . ” [He]0-i then studied the answer on [[his]0-i friend]507-his friend ’s fingers . The answer was , “[197-a poet] Go to hell ! ” [The Professor]805-the professor then resumed [his]805-the professor merely verbal monologue addressed to [the Doctor]2681-the doctor . “[197-a poet] Perhaps [I]0-i should rather say , ” said [Syme]113-syme on [his]0-i fingers , “[197-a poet] that it resembles that sudden smell of [the sea]2145-the sea which may be found in [the heart of [lush woods]1028-lush woods]1027-the heart of lush woods . ” [[His]0-i companion]291-his companion disdained to reply . “[197-a poet] Or yet again , ” tapped [Syme]113-syme , “[197-a poet] it is positive , as is the passionate red hair of [a beautiful woman]1029-a beautiful woman . ” [The Professor]805-the professor was continuing [his]805-the professor speech , but in the middle of it [Syme]113-syme decided to act . [He]805-the professor leant across the table , and said in a voice that could not be neglected — “[1029-a beautiful woman] [Dr. Bull]134-dr. bull ! ” [The Doctor]2681-the doctor ’s sleek and smiling head did not move , but [they]2701-they could have sworn that under [his]805-the professor dark glasses [his]805-the professor eyes darted towards [Syme]113-syme . “[134-dr. bull] [Dr. Bull]134-dr. bull , ” said [Syme]113-syme , in a voice peculiarly precise and courteous , “[134-dr. bull] would [you]134-dr. bull do [me]0-i a small favour ? Would [you]134-dr. bull be so kind as to take off [your]134-dr. bull spectacles ? ” [The Professor]805-the professor swung round on [his]805-the professor seat , and stared at [Syme]113-syme with a sort of frozen fury of astonishment . [Syme]113-syme , like [a man who has thrown [his]2703-a man who has thrown his life and fortune on the table life and fortune on the table]2703-a man who has thrown his life and fortune on the table , leaned forward with a fiery face . Then [Dr. Bull]134-dr. bull rose slowly , still smiling , and took off [his]134-dr. bull spectacles . [His]113-syme eyes were like stars , and for an instant [he]113-syme could only point without speaking . [The Professor]805-the professor had also started to [his]805-the professor feet , forgetful of [his]805-the professor supposed paralysis . [He]805-the professor leant on the back of the chair and stared doubtfully at [Dr. Bull]134-dr. bull , as if [the Doctor]2681-the doctor had been turned into a toad before [his]805-the professor eyes . And indeed it was almost as great a transformation scene . [The two detectives]2710-the two detectives saw sitting in the chair before [them]2710-the two detectives [a very boyish‑looking young man , with very frank and happy hazel eyes]2711-a very boyish‑looking young man , with very frank and happy hazel eyes , an open expression , cockney clothes like those of [a city clerk]2712-a city clerk , and an unquestionable breath about [him]1032-his of being very good and rather commonplace . Then [he]134-dr. bull strolled back again , kicking [his]134-dr. bull heels carelessly , and a companionable silence fell between [the three men]2745-the three men . “[0-i] Well , ” said [Syme]113-syme , “[0-i] it seems that [we]1099-we have all the same kind of morality or immorality , so [we]1099-we had better face the fact that comes of it . ” “[0-i] Yes , ” assented [the Professor]805-the professor , “[0-i] [you]0-i ’re quite right ; and [we]1099-we must hurry up , for [I]0-i can see the Grey Nose standing out from [France]55-france . ” “[0-i] The fact that comes of it , ” said [Syme]113-syme seriously , “[0-i] is this , that [we]1099-we three are alone on [this planet]1100-this planet . But [we]1099-we are worse off than that , first because [they]804-three men can appeal to [their]804-three men organization and [we]1099-we can not appeal to [ours]1099-we , and second because — ” “[1105-one of those other three men] Because [one of [those other three men]1106-those other three men]1105-one of those other three men , ” said [the Professor]805-the professor , “[1105-one of those other three men] is not [a man]221-a man . ” [Syme]113-syme nodded and was silent for a second or two , then [he]0-i said — “[0-i] [My]0-i idea is this . [We]1099-we must do something to keep [the Marquis]745-the marquis in [Calais]57-calais till to­morrow midday . [I]0-i have turned over twenty schemes in [my]0-i head . [We]1099-we can not denounce [him]745-the marquis as [a dynamiter]861-a dynamiter ; that is agreed . [We]1099-we can not get [him]745-the marquis detained on some trivial charge , for [we]1099-we should have to appear ; [he]745-the marquis knows [us]1099-we , and [he]745-the marquis would smell a rat . [We]1099-we can not pretend to keep [him]745-the marquis on anarchist business ; [he]745-the marquis might swallow much in that way , but not the notion of stopping in [Calais]57-calais while [the Czar]691-the czar went safely through [Paris]34-paris . [We]1099-we might try to kidnap [him]745-the marquis , and lock [him]745-the marquis up [ourselves]1099-we ; but [he]745-the marquis is [a well‑known man]1111-a well‑known man [here]2025-here . [He]745-the marquis has [a whole bodyguard of friends]1113-a whole bodyguard of friends ; [he]745-the marquis is very strong and brave , and the event is doubtful . The only thing [I]0-i can see to do is actually to take advantage of the very things that are in [the Marquis]129-marquis de st. eustache ’s favour . [I]0-i am going to profit by the fact that [he]745-the marquis is [a highly respected nobleman]1114-a highly respected nobleman . [I]0-i am going to profit by the fact that [he]745-the marquis has [many friends]1115-many friends and moves in the best society . ” “[0-i] What the devil are [you]0-i talking about ? ” asked [the Professor]805-the professor . “[0-i] [The Symes]153-the symes are first mentioned in the fourteenth century , ” said [Syme]113-syme ; “[153-the symes] but there is a tradition that [one of [them]153-the symes]1116-one of them rode behind [Bruce]154-bruce at [Bannockburn]58-bannockburn . Since 1350 the tree is quite clear . ” “[745-the marquis] [He]745-the marquis ’s gone off [his]745-the marquis head , ” said [the little Doctor]995-the little doctor , staring . “[745-the marquis] [Our]1117-them bearings , ” continued [Syme]113-syme calmly , “[745-the marquis] are ‘ argent a chevron gules charged with three cross crosslets of the field . ’ The motto varies . ” [The Professor]805-the professor seized [Syme]113-syme roughly by the waistcoat . “[1117-them] [We]1117-them are just inshore , ” [he]805-the professor said . “[1117-them] Are [you]0-i seasick or joking in [the wrong place]1118-the wrong place ? ” “[0-i] [My]0-i remarks are almost painfully practical , ” answered [Syme]113-syme , in an unhurried manner . “[0-i] [The house of [St. Eustache]129-marquis de st. eustache]1119-the house of st. eustache also is very ancient . [The Marquis]745-the marquis can not deny that [he]745-the marquis is [a gentleman]2023-a gentleman . [He]745-the marquis can not deny that [I]0-i am [a gentleman]2023-a gentleman . And in order to put the matter of [my]0-i social position quite beyond a doubt , [I]0-i propose at the earliest opportunity to knock [his]745-the marquis hat off . But here [we]1117-them are in [the harbour]1123-the harbour . ” [They]1117-them went on [shore]2751-shore under the strong sun in a sort of daze . [Syme]113-syme , who had now taken the lead as [Bull]134-dr. bull had taken it in [London]2-london , led [them]1117-them along a kind of marine parade until [he]113-syme came to some cafés , embowered in a bulk of greenery and overlooking [the sea]2145-the sea . As [he]113-syme went before [them]1117-them [his]113-syme step was slightly swaggering , and [he]113-syme swung [his]113-syme stick like a sword . [He]113-syme was making apparently for the extreme end of the line of cafés , but [he]113-syme stopped abruptly . With a sharp gesture [he]113-syme motioned [them]1117-them to silence , but [he]113-syme pointed with one gloved finger to a café table under a bank of flowering foliage at which sat [the Marquis de St. Eustache]129-marquis de st. eustache , [his]129-marquis de st. eustache teeth shining in [his]129-marquis de st. eustache thick , black beard , and [his]129-marquis de st. eustache bold , brown face shadowed by a light yellow straw hat and outlined against [the violet sea]2753-the violet sea . [SYME]113-syme sat down at a café table with [[his]113-syme companions]2754-his companions , [his]113-syme blue eyes sparkling like the bright sea below , and ordered a bottle of Saumur with a pleased impatience . [He]113-syme was for some reason in a condition of curious hilarity . [His]113-syme spirits were already unnaturally high ; they rose as [the Saumur]155-the saumur sank , and in half an hour [his]113-syme talk was a torrent of nonsense . [He]113-syme professed to be making out a plan of the conversation which was going to ensue between [himself]113-syme and [the deadly Marquis]2755-the deadly marquis . [He]113-syme jotted it down wildly with a pencil . It was arranged like a printed catechism , with questions and answers , and was delivered with an extraordinary rapidity of utterance . “[0-i] [I]0-i shall approach . Before taking off [his]1124-he hat , [I]0-i shall take off [my]0-i own . [I]0-i shall say , ‘ [The Marquis de Saint Eustache]156-the marquis de saint eustache , [I]0-i believe . ’ [He]1124-he will say , ’ [The celebrated Mr. Syme]85-syme , [I]0-i presume . ’ [He]1124-he will say in the most exquisite French , ‘ How are [you]0-i ? ’ [I]0-i shall reply in the most exquisite Cockney , ‘ Oh , just [the Syme]85-syme — ’ ” “[85-syme] Oh , shut it , ” said [the man in spectacles]2731-the man in spectacles . “[0-i] Pull [yourself]0-i together , and chuck away that bit of paper . What are [you]0-i really going to do ? ” “[0-i] But it was a lovely catechism , ” said [Syme]85-syme pathetically . “[0-i] Do let [me]0-i read it [you]0-i . [It]1125-it has only forty‑three questions and answers , and some of [the Marquis]745-the marquis ’s answers are wonderfully witty . [I]0-i like to be just to [[my]0-i enemy]1127-my enemy . ” “[0-i] But what ’s the good of it all ? ” asked [Dr. Bull]134-dr. bull in exasperation . “[0-i] It leads up to [my]0-i challenge , do n’t [you]0-i see , ” said [Syme]85-syme , beaming . “[0-i] When [the Marquis]745-the marquis has given the thirty‑ninth reply , which runs — ” “[745-the marquis] Has it by any chance occurred to [you]0-i , ” asked [the Professor]805-the professor , with a ponderous simplicity , “[745-the marquis] that [the Marquis]745-the marquis may not say all the forty‑three things [you]0-i have put down for [him]745-the marquis ? In that case , [I]0-i understand , [your]0-i own epigrams may appear somewhat more forced . ” [Syme]85-syme struck the table with a radiant face . “[0-i] Why , how true that is , ” [he]0-i said , “[0-i] and [I]0-i never thought of it . [Sir]2017-sir , [you]0-i have an intellect beyond the common . [You]0-i will make a name . ” “[0-i] Oh , [you]0-i ’re as drunk as an owl ! ” said [the Doctor]2681-the doctor . “[0-i] It only remains , ” continued [Syme]85-syme quite unperturbed , “[0-i] to adopt some other method of breaking the ice ( if [I]0-i may so express it ) between [myself]0-i and [the man]294-the man [I]0-i wish to kill . And since the course of a dialogue can not be predicted by one of [[its]1132-its parties]1133-its parties alone ( as [you]2017-sir have pointed out with such recondite acumen ) , the only thing to be done , [I]0-i suppose , is for the one party , as far as possible , to do all the dialogue by [himself]294-the man . And so [I]0-i will , by [George]121-george ! ” And [he]85-syme stood up suddenly , [his]85-syme yellow hair blowing in the slight sea breeze . [A band]2759-a band was playing in a café chantant hidden somewhere among the trees , and [a woman]226-a woman had just stopped singing . On [Syme]85-syme ’s heated head the bray of the brass band seemed like the jar and jingle of that barrel‑organ in [Leicester Square]31-leicester square , to the tune of which [he]85-syme had once stood up to die . [He]85-syme looked across to the little table where [the Marquis]745-the marquis sat . [The man]294-the man had [two companions]2763-two companions now , [solemn Frenchmen in frock‑coats and silk hats , one of [them]2763-two companions with the red rosette of [the Legion of Honour]2765-the legion of honour]2764-solemn frenchmen in frock‑coats and silk hats , one of them with the red rosette of the legion of honour , evidently [people of a solid social position]2766-people of a solid social position . Besides these black , cylindrical costumes , [the Marquis]745-the marquis , in [his]745-the marquis loose straw hat and light spring clothes , looked Bohemian and even barbaric ; but [he]745-the marquis looked [the Marquis]745-the marquis . Indeed , [one]225-one might say that [he]745-the marquis looked [the king]2307-the king , with [his]745-the marquis animal elegance , [his]745-the marquis scornful eyes , and [his]745-the marquis proud head lifted against the purple sea . But [he]745-the marquis was [no Christian king]2771-no christian king , at any rate ; [he]745-the marquis was , rather , [some swarthy despot]2772-some swarthy despot , [half Greek]2773-half greek , [half Asiatic]2774-half asiatic , who in the days when slavery seemed natural looked down on [the Mediterranean]59-the mediterranean , on [[his]745-the marquis galley]2775-his galley and [[his]745-the marquis groaning slaves]2776-his groaning slaves . Just so , [Syme]85-syme thought , would the brown‑gold face of [such a tyrant]2777-such a tyrant have shown against the dark green olives and the burning blue . “[121-george] Are [you]1134-you going to address the meeting ? ” asked [the Professor]805-the professor peevishly , seeing that [Syme]85-syme still stood up without moving . [Syme]85-syme drained [his]85-syme last glass of sparkling wine . “[0-i] [I]0-i am , ” [he]0-i said , pointing across to [the Marquis]745-the marquis and [[his]745-the marquis companions]2754-his companions , “[0-i] that meeting . That meeting displeases [me]0-i . [I]0-i am going to pull that meeting ’s great ugly , mahogany‑coloured nose . ” [He]0-i stepped across swiftly , if not quite steadily . [The Marquis]745-the marquis , seeing [him]0-i , arched [his]745-the marquis black Assyrian eyebrows in surprise , but smiled politely . “[0-i] [You]1134-you are [Mr. Syme]85-syme , [I]0-i think , ” [he]745-the marquis said . [Syme]85-syme bowed . “[85-syme] And [you]1134-you are [the Marquis de Saint Eustache]156-the marquis de saint eustache , ” [he]0-i said gracefully . “[1134-you] Permit [me]0-i to pull [your]1134-you nose . ” [He]0-i leant over to do so , but [the Marquis]745-the marquis started backwards , upsetting [his]745-the marquis chair , and [the two men in top hats]2783-the two men in top hats held [Syme]85-syme back by the shoulders . “[0-i] [This man]360-this man has insulted [me]0-i ! ” said [Syme]85-syme , with gestures of explanation . “[360-this man] Insulted [you]0-i ? ” cried [the gentleman with the red rosette]2784-the gentleman with the red rosette , “[0-i] when ? ” “[360-this man] Oh , just now , ” said [Syme]85-syme recklessly . “[360-this man] [He]360-this man insulted [[my]0-i mother]325-my mother . ” “[360-this man] Insulted [[your]0-i mother]1137-your mother ! ” exclaimed [the gentleman]2785-the gentleman incredulously . “[1137-your mother] Well , anyhow , ” said [Syme]85-syme , conceding a point , “[1137-your mother] [[my]0-i aunt]1138-my aunt . ” “[1137-your mother] But how can [the Marquis]745-the marquis have insulted [[your]0-i aunt]1140-your aunt just now ? ” said [the second gentleman]2786-the second gentleman with some legitimate wonder . “[745-the marquis] [He]745-the marquis has been sitting [here]2025-here all the time . ” “[745-the marquis] Ah , it was what [he]745-the marquis said ! ” said [Syme]85-syme darkly . “[745-the marquis] [I]0-i said nothing at all , ” said [the Marquis]745-the marquis , “[0-i] except something about the band . [I]0-i only said that [I]0-i liked [Wagner]157-wagner played well . ” “[0-i] It was an allusion to [[my]0-i family]1142-my family , ” said [Syme]85-syme firmly . “[0-i] [[My]0-i aunt]1138-my aunt played [Wagner]157-wagner badly . It was a painful subject . [We]1144-we are always being insulted about it . ” “[1144-we] This seems most extraordinary , ” said [the gentleman who was decoré]2788-the gentleman who was decoré , looking doubtfully at [the Marquis]745-the marquis . “[1144-we] Oh , [I]0-i assure [you]0-i , ” said [Syme]85-syme earnestly , “[0-i] the whole of [your]0-i conversation was simply packed with sinister allusions to [[my]0-i aunt]1138-my aunt ’s weaknesses . ” “[0-i] This is nonsense ! ” said [the second gentleman]2786-the second gentleman . “[0-i] [I]0-i for one have said nothing for half an hour except that [I]0-i liked the singing of [that girl with black hair]1146-that girl with black hair . ” “[1146-that girl with black hair] Well , there [you]0-i are again ! ” said [Syme]85-syme indignantly . “[1138-my aunt] [[My]0-i aunt]1138-my aunt ’s was red . ” “[1138-my aunt] It seems to [me]0-i , ” said [the other]279-the other , “[1138-my aunt] that [you]0-i are simply seeking a pretext to insult [the Marquis]745-the marquis . ” “[0-i] By [George]121-george ! ” said [Syme]85-syme , facing round and looking at [him]121-george , “[121-george] what [a clever chap]1149-a clever chap [you]121-george are ! ” [The Marquis]745-the marquis started up with eyes flaming like a tiger ’s . “[1149-a clever chap] Seeking a quarrel with [me]0-i ! ” [he]745-the marquis cried . “[1149-a clever chap] Seeking a fight with [me]0-i ! By [God]95-god ! there was never [a man who had to seek long]1150-a man who had to seek long . [These gentlemen]1151-these gentlemen will perhaps act for [me]0-i . There are still four hours of daylight . Let [us]1152-us fight this evening . ” [Syme]85-syme bowed with a quite beautiful graciousness . “[156-the marquis de saint eustache] [Marquis]156-the marquis de saint eustache , ” [he]0-i said , “[156-the marquis de saint eustache] [your]156-the marquis de saint eustache action is worthy of [your]156-the marquis de saint eustache fame and blood . Permit [me]0-i to consult for a moment with [the gentlemen in whose hands [I]0-i shall place [myself]0-i]1153-the gentlemen in whose hands i shall place myself . ” In three long strides [he]0-i rejoined [[his]0-i companions]2754-his companions , and [they]2754-his companions , who had seen [his]0-i champagne‑inspired attack and listened to [his]0-i idiotic explanations , were quite startled at the look of [him]0-i . For now that [he]0-i came back to [them]2754-his companions [he]0-i was quite sober , a little pale , and [he]0-i spoke in a low voice of passionate practicality . “[0-i] [I]0-i have done it , ” [he]0-i said hoarsely . “[0-i] [I]0-i have fixed a fight on the beast . But look here , and listen carefully . There is no time for talk . [You]1154-you are [my]0-i seconds , and everything must come from [you]1154-you . Now [you]1154-you must insist , and insist absolutely , on the duel coming off after seven to‑morrow , so as to give [me]0-i the chance of preventing [him]0-i from catching the 7.45 for [Paris]34-paris . If [he]0-i misses that [he]0-i misses [his]0-i crime . [He]0-i ca n’t refuse to meet [you]1154-you on such a small point of time and place . But this is what [he]0-i will do . [He]0-i will choose a field somewhere near [a wayside station]1155-a wayside station , where [he]0-i can pick up [the train]1949-the train . [He]0-i is [a very good swordsman]1157-a very good swordsman , and [he]0-i will trust to killing [me]0-i in time to catch it . But [I]0-i can fence well too , and [I]0-i think [I]0-i can keep [him]0-i in play , at any rate , until [the train]1949-the train is lost . Then perhaps [he]0-i may kill [me]0-i to console [his]0-i feelings . [You]1154-you understand ? Very well then , let [me]0-i introduce [you]1154-you to [some charming friends of mine]1159-some charming friends of mine , ” and leading [them]1154-you quickly across [the parade]2794-the parade , [he]0-i presented [them]1154-you to [the Marquis]745-the marquis ’s seconds by two very aristocratic names of which [they]1154-you had not previously heard . [Syme]85-syme was subject to spasms of singular common sense , not otherwise a part of [his]85-syme character . [They]1154-you were ( as [he]85-syme said of [his]85-syme impulse about the spectacles ) poetic intuitions , and they sometimes rose to the exaltation of prophecy . [He]85-syme had correctly calculated in this case the policy of [[his]85-syme opponent]2796-his opponent . When [the Marquis]745-the marquis was informed by [his]745-the marquis seconds that [Syme]85-syme could only fight in the morning , [he]745-the marquis must fully have realised that an obstacle had suddenly arisen between [him]745-the marquis and [his]745-the marquis bomb‑throwing business in [the capital]2798-the capital . Naturally [he]745-the marquis could not explain this objection to [[his]745-the marquis friends]2799-his friends , so [he]745-the marquis chose the course which [Syme]85-syme had predicted . [He]745-the marquis induced [his]745-the marquis seconds to settle on [a small meadow not far from the railway]2800-a small meadow not far from the railway , and [he]745-the marquis trusted to the fatality of the first engagement . When [he]745-the marquis came down very coolly to [the field of honour]2801-the field of honour , [no one]2078-no one could have guessed that [he]745-the marquis had any anxiety about a journey ; [his]745-the marquis hands were in [his]745-the marquis pockets , [his]745-the marquis straw hat on the back of [his]745-the marquis head , [his]745-the marquis handsome face brazen in the sun . But it might have struck [a stranger]551-a stranger as odd that there appeared in [[his]745-the marquis train]2804-his train , not only [his]745-the marquis seconds carrying the sword‑case , but [two of [[his]745-the marquis servants]2806-his servants]2805-two of his servants carrying a portmanteau and a luncheon basket . Early as was the hour , the sun soaked everything in warmth , and [Syme]85-syme was vaguely surprised to see so many spring flowers burning gold and silver in the tall grass in which [the whole company]614-the whole company stood almost knee - deep . With the exception of [the Marquis]745-the marquis , [all the men]2809-all the men were in sombre and solemn morning‑dress , with hats like black chimney‑pots ; [the little Doctor]995-the little doctor especially , with the addition of [his]995-the little doctor black spectacles , looked like [an undertaker in a farce]2811-an undertaker in a farce . [Syme]85-syme could not help feeling a comic contrast between this funereal church parade of apparel and [the rich and glistening meadow]2812-the rich and glistening meadow , growing wild flowers everywhere . But , indeed , this comic contrast between the yellow blossoms and the black hats was but a symbol of the tragic contrast between the yellow blossoms and the black business . On [his]85-syme right was a little wood ; far away to [his]85-syme left lay the long curve of [the railway line , which [he]85-syme was , so to speak , guarding from [the Marquis , whose goal and escape it]2814-the marquis , whose goal and escape it was]2813-the railway line , which he was , so to speak , guarding from the marquis , whose goal and escape it was . In front of [him]85-syme , behind [the black group of [[his]85-syme opponents]2816-his opponents]2815-the black group of his opponents , [he]85-syme could see , like a tinted cloud , a small almond bush in flower against the faint line of [the sea]2145-the sea . [The member of the Legion of Honour]2818-the member of the legion of honour , whose name it seemed was [Colonel Ducroix]158-colonel ducroix , approached [the Professor]805-the professor and [Dr. Bull]134-dr. bull with great politeness , and suggested that the play should terminate with the first considerable hurt . [Dr. Bull]134-dr. bull , however , having been carefully coached by [Syme]85-syme upon this point of policy , insisted , with great dignity and in very bad French , that it should continue until one of [the combatants]2820-the combatants was disabled . [Syme]85-syme had made up [his]85-syme mind that [he]85-syme could avoid disabling [the Marquis]745-the marquis and prevent [the Marquis]745-the marquis from disabling [him]85-syme for at least twenty minutes . In twenty minutes [the Paris train]2823-the paris train would have gone by . “[0-i] To [a man of the well‑known skill and valour]1160-a man of the well‑known skill and valour of [Monsieur de St. Eustache]159-monsieur de st. eustache , ” said [the Professor]805-the professor solemnly , “[1160-a man of the well‑known skill and valour] it must be a matter of indifference which method is adopted , and [[our]1161-our principal]1162-our principal has strong reasons for demanding the longer encounter , reasons the delicacy of which prevent [me]0-i from being explicit , but for the just and honourable nature of which [I]0-i can — ” “[0-i] Peste ! “ broke from [the Marquis]745-the marquis behind , whose face had suddenly darkened , “[0-i] let [us]1161-our stop talking and begin , ” and [he]745-the marquis slashed off the head of a tall flower with [his]745-the marquis stick . [Syme]85-syme understood [his]745-the marquis rude impatience and instinctively looked over [his]85-syme shoulder to see whether [the train]1949-the train was coming in sight . But there was no smoke on the horizon . [Colonel Ducroix]158-colonel ducroix knelt down and unlocked the case , taking out a pair of twin swords , which took the sunlight and turned to two streaks of white fire . [He]158-colonel ducroix offered one to [the Marquis , who snatched it without ceremony]2827-the marquis , who snatched it without ceremony , and another to [Syme]85-syme , who took it , bent it , and poised it with as much delay as was consistent with dignity . Then [the Colonel]2828-the colonel took out another pair of blades , and taking one [himself]2828-the colonel and giving another to [Dr. Bull]134-dr. bull , proceeded to place [the men]612-the men . [Both combatants]2830-both combatants had thrown off [their]2830-both combatants coats and waistcoats , and stood sword in hand . [The seconds]2831-the seconds stood on each side of the line of fight with drawn swords also , but still sombre in [their]2831-the seconds dark frock‑coats and hats . [The principals]2832-the principals saluted . [The Colonel]2828-the colonel said quietly , “[0-i] Engage ! ” and the two blades touched and tingled . When the jar of the joined iron ran up [Syme]85-syme ’s arm , all the fantastic fears that have been the subject of this story fell from [him]85-syme like dreams from [a man]221-a man waking up in bed . [He]85-syme remembered them clearly and in order as mere delusions of the nerves — how the fear of [the Professor]805-the professor had been the fear of the tyrannic accidents of nightmare , and how the fear of [the Doctor]2681-the doctor had been the fear of the airless vacuum of science . The first was the old fear that any miracle might happen , the second the more hopeless modern fear that no miracle can ever happen . But [he]85-syme saw that these fears were fancies , for [he]85-syme found [himself]85-syme in the presence of the great fact of the fear of death , with its coarse and pitiless common sense . [He]85-syme felt like [a man who had dreamed all night of falling over precipices]2837-a man who had dreamed all night of falling over precipices , and had woke up on the morning when [he]85-syme was to be hanged . For as soon as [he]85-syme had seen the sunlight run down the channel of [[his]85-syme foe]276-his foe ’s foreshortened blade , and as soon as [he]85-syme had felt the two tongues of steel touch , vibrating like two living things , [he]85-syme knew that [[his]85-syme enemy]2187-his enemy was [a terrible fighter]2840-a terrible fighter , and that probably [his]85-syme last hour had come . [He]85-syme felt a strange and vivid value in all the earth around [him]85-syme , in the grass under [his]85-syme feet ; [he]85-syme felt the love of life in all living things . [He]85-syme could almost fancy that [he]85-syme heard the grass growing ; [he]85-syme could almost fancy that even as [he]85-syme stood fresh flowers were springing up and breaking into blossom in [the meadow]2841-the meadow — flowers blood red and burning gold and blue , fulfilling the whole pageant of the spring . And whenever [his]85-syme eyes strayed for a flash from the calm , staring , hypnotic eyes of [the Marquis]745-the marquis , [they]2843-they saw the little tuft of almond tree against the sky‑line . [He]85-syme had the feeling that if by some miracle [he]85-syme escaped [he]85-syme would be ready to sit for ever before that almond tree , desiring nothing else in [the world]231-the world . But while [earth]2021-earth and sky and everything had the living beauty of a thing lost , the other half of [his]85-syme head was as clear as glass , and [he]85-syme was parrying [[his]85-syme enemy]2187-his enemy ’s point with a kind of clockwork skill of which [he]85-syme had hardly supposed [himself]85-syme capable . Once [[his]85-syme enemy]2187-his enemy ’s point ran along [his]85-syme wrist , leaving a slight streak of blood , but it either was not noticed or was tacitly ignored . Every now and then [he]85-syme riposted , and once or twice [he]85-syme could almost fancy that [he]85-syme felt [his]85-syme point go home , but as there was no blood on blade or shirt [he]85-syme supposed [he]85-syme was mistaken . Then came an interruption and a change . At the risk of losing all , [the Marquis]745-the marquis , interrupting [his]85-syme quiet stare , flashed one glance over [his]85-syme shoulder at [the line of railway on [his]85-syme right]2849-the line of railway on his right . Then [he]85-syme turned on [Syme]85-syme a face transfigured to that of [a fiend]2850-a fiend , and began to fight as if with twenty weapons . The attack came so fast and furious , that the one shining sword seemed a shower of shining arrows . [Syme]85-syme had no chance to look at [the railway]2851-the railway ; but also [he]85-syme had no need . [He]85-syme could guess the reason of [the Marquis]745-the marquis ’s sudden madness of battle — [the Paris train]2823-the paris train was in sight . But [the Marquis]745-the marquis ’s morbid energy over‑reached itself . Twice [Syme]85-syme , parrying , knocked [[his]85-syme opponent]2796-his opponent ’s point far out of the fighting circle ; and the third time [his]85-syme riposte was so rapid , that there was no doubt about the hit this time . [Syme]85-syme ’s sword actually bent under the weight of [the Marquis]156-the marquis de saint eustache ’s body , which it had pierced . [Syme]85-syme was as certain that [he]85-syme had stuck [his]85-syme blade into [[his]85-syme enemy]2187-his enemy as a gardener that [he]85-syme has stuck [his]85-syme spade into the ground . Yet [the Marquis]745-the marquis sprang back from the stroke without a stagger , and [Syme]85-syme stood staring at [his]85-syme own sword‑point like [an idiot]2858-an idiot . There was no blood on it at all . There was an instant of rigid silence , and then [Syme]85-syme in [his]85-syme turn fell furiously on the other , filled with a flaming curiosity . [The Marquis]156-the marquis de saint eustache was probably , in a general sense , a better fencer than [he]85-syme , as [he]85-syme had surmised at the beginning , but at the moment [the Marquis]745-the marquis seemed distraught and at a disadvantage . [He]745-the marquis fought wildly and even weakly , and [he]745-the marquis constantly looked away at [the railway line]2860-the railway line , almost as if [he]745-the marquis feared [the train]1949-the train more than the pointed steel . [Syme]85-syme , on the other hand , fought fiercely but still carefully , in an intellectual fury , eager to solve the riddle of [his]85-syme own bloodless sword . For this purpose , [he]85-syme aimed less at [the Marquis]745-the marquis ’s body , and more at [his]745-the marquis throat and head . A minute and a half afterwards [he]85-syme felt [his]85-syme point enter [the man]294-the man ’s neck below the jaw . It came out clean . Half mad , [he]85-syme thrust again , and made what should have been a bloody scar on the [Marquis]156-the marquis de saint eustache ’s cheek . But there was no scar . For one moment [the heaven of [Syme]85-syme]2864-the heaven of syme again grew black with supernatural terrors . Surely [the man]294-the man had a charmed life . But this new spiritual dread was a more awful thing than had been the mere spiritual topsy - turvydom symbolised by [the paralytic who pursued [him]294-the man]2866-the paralytic who pursued him . [The Professor]805-the professor was only [a goblin]2868-a goblin ; [this man]360-this man was [a devil]463-a devil — perhaps [he]360-this man was [the Devil]859-the devil ! Anyhow , this was certain , that three times had a human sword been driven into [him]360-this man and made no mark . When [Syme]85-syme had that thought [he]85-syme drew [himself]85-syme up , and all that was good in [him]85-syme sang high up in the air as a high wind sings in the trees . [He]85-syme thought of all the human things in [his]85-syme story — of the Chinese lanterns in [Saffron Park]1-saffron park , of [the girl]255-the girl ’s red hair in [the garden]262-the garden , of [the honest , beer‑swilling sailors]2874-the honest , beer‑swilling sailors down by [the dock]2875-the dock , of [[his]85-syme loyal companions]2876-his loyal companions standing by . Perhaps [he]85-syme had been chosen as [a champion of all these fresh and kindly things to cross swords]2877-a champion of all these fresh and kindly things to cross swords with [the enemy of all creation]2878-the enemy of all creation . “[0-i] After all , ” [he]0-i said to [himself]0-i , “[0-i] [I]0-i am more than [a devil]463-a devil ; [I]0-i am [a man]221-a man . [I]0-i can do the one thing which [Satan]160-satan [himself]160-satan can not do — [I]0-i can die , ” and as the word went through [his]0-i head , [he]0-i heard a faint and far‑off hoot , which would soon be the roar of [the Paris train]2823-the paris train . [He]0-i fell to fighting again with a supernatural levity , like [a Mohammedan panting for Paradise]2880-a mohammedan panting for paradise . As [the train]1949-the train came nearer and nearer [he]0-i fancied [he]0-i could see [people]2038-people putting up the floral arches in [Paris]34-paris ; [he]0-i joined in the growing noise and the glory of [the great Republic whose gate [he]0-i was guarding against [Hell]60-hell]2883-the great republic whose gate he was guarding against hell . [His]0-i thoughts rose higher and higher with the rising roar of [the train]1949-the train , which ended , as if proudly , in a long and piercing whistle . [The train]1949-the train stopped . Suddenly , to the astonishment of [everyone]271-everyone [the Marquis]745-the marquis sprang back quite out of sword reach and threw down [his]745-the marquis sword . The leap was wonderful , and not the less wonderful because [Syme]85-syme had plunged [his]85-syme sword a moment before into [the man]294-the man ’s thigh . “[0-i] Stop ! ” said [the Marquis]745-the marquis in a voice that compelled a momentary obedience . “[0-i] [I]0-i want to say something . ” “[0-i] What is the matter ? ” asked [Colonel Ducroix]158-colonel ducroix , staring . “[0-i] Has there been foul play ? ” “[0-i] There has been foul play somewhere , ” said [Dr. Bull]134-dr. bull , who was a little pale . “[0-i] [[Our]1165-our principal]1162-our principal has wounded [the Marquis]745-the marquis four times at least , and [he]745-the marquis is none the worse . ” [The Marquis]745-the marquis put up [his]745-the marquis hand with a curious air of ghastly patience . “[745-the marquis] Please let [me]0-i speak , ” [he]745-the marquis said . “[745-the marquis] It is rather important . [Mr. Syme]85-syme , ” [he]0-i continued , turning to [[his]0-i opponent]2796-his opponent , “[85-syme] [we]1165-our are fighting to‑day , if [I]0-i remember right , because [you]85-syme expressed a wish ( which [I]0-i thought irrational ) to pull [my]0-i nose . Would [you]85-syme oblige [me]0-i by pulling [my]0-i nose now as quickly as possible ? [I]0-i have to catch [a train]1963-a train . ” “[0-i] [I]0-i protest that this is most irregular , ” said [Dr. Bull]134-dr. bull indignantly . “[0-i] It is certainly somewhat opposed to precedent , ” said [Colonel Ducroix]158-colonel ducroix , looking wistfully at [[his]158-colonel ducroix principal]2892-his principal . “[0-i] There is , [I]0-i think , one case on record ( [Captain Bellegarde]161-captain bellegarde and [the Baron Zumpt]1169-the baron zumpt ) in which the weapons were changed in the middle of the encounter at the request of [one of [the combatants]2820-the combatants]1170-one of the combatants . But [one]225-one can hardly call [one]225-one ’s nose a weapon . ” “[225-one] Will [you]85-syme or will [you]85-syme not pull [my]0-i nose ? ” said [the Marquis]745-the marquis in exasperation . “[85-syme] Come , come , [Mr. Syme]85-syme ! [You]85-syme wanted to do it , do it ! [You]85-syme can have no conception of how important it is to [me]0-i . Do n’t be so selfish ! Pull [my]0-i nose at once , when [I]0-i ask [you]85-syme ! ” and [he]0-i bent slightly forward with a fascinating smile . [The Paris train]2823-the paris train , panting and groaning , had grated into [a little station]2895-a little station behind [the neighbouring hill]2896-the neighbouring hill . [Syme]85-syme had the feeling [he]85-syme had more than once had in these adventures — the sense that a horrible and sublime wave lifted to heaven was just toppling over . Walking in a world [he]85-syme half understood , [he]85-syme took two paces forward and seized the Roman nose of [this remarkable nobleman]2897-this remarkable nobleman . [He]85-syme pulled it hard , and it came off in [his]85-syme hand . [He]0-i stood for some seconds with a foolish solemnity , with the pasteboard proboscis still between [his]0-i fingers , looking at it , while the sun and the clouds and [the wooded hills]2898-the wooded hills looked down upon this imbecile scene . [The Marquis]745-the marquis broke the silence in a loud and cheerful voice . “[85-syme] If [anyone]363-anyone has any use for [my]0-i left eyebrow , ” [he]745-the marquis said , “[363-anyone] [he]363-anyone can have it . [Colonel Ducroix]158-colonel ducroix , do accept [my]0-i left eyebrow ! It ’s the kind of thing that might come in useful any day , ” and [he]745-the marquis gravely tore off one of [his]745-the marquis swarthy Assyrian brows , bringing about half [his]745-the marquis brown forehead with it , and politely offered it to [the Colonel]2828-the colonel , who stood crimson and speechless with rage . “[158-colonel ducroix] If [I]0-i had known , ” [he]0-i spluttered , “[0-i] that [I]0-i was acting for a poltroon who pads [himself]1175-himself to fight — ” “[0-i] Oh , [I]0-i know , [I]0-i know ! ” said [the Marquis]745-the marquis , recklessly throwing various parts of [himself]745-the marquis right and left about [the field]2902-the field . “[0-i] [You]158-colonel ducroix are making a mistake ; but it ca n’t be explained just now . [I]0-i tell [you]158-colonel ducroix [the train]1949-the train has come into [the station]1177-the station ! ” “[0-i] Yes , ” said [Dr. Bull]134-dr. bull fiercely , “[0-i] and [the train]1949-the train shall go out of [the station]1177-the station . [It]1949-the train shall go out without [you]158-colonel ducroix . [We]1180-we know well enough for what devil ’s work — ” [The mysterious Marquis]2903-the mysterious marquis lifted [his]2903-the mysterious marquis hands with a desperate gesture . [He]2903-the mysterious marquis was [a strange scarecrow standing there in the sun with half [his]2903-the mysterious marquis old face peeled off , and half another face glaring and grinning from underneath]2904-a strange scarecrow standing there in the sun with half his old face peeled off , and half another face glaring and grinning from underneath . “[158-colonel ducroix] Will [you]158-colonel ducroix drive [me]0-i mad ? ” [he]2903-the mysterious marquis cried . “[158-colonel ducroix] [The train]1949-the train — ” “[158-colonel ducroix] [You]158-colonel ducroix shall not go by [the train]1949-the train , ” said [Syme]85-syme firmly , and grasped [his]85-syme sword . [The wild figure]2905-the wild figure turned towards [Syme]85-syme , and seemed to be gathering itself for a sublime effort before speaking . “[158-colonel ducroix] [You]158-colonel ducroix [great fat , blasted , blear‑eyed , blundering , thundering , brainless , God­forsaken , doddering , damned fool]1183-great fat , blasted , blear‑eyed , blundering , thundering , brainless , god­forsaken , doddering , damned fool ! ” [he]85-syme said without taking breath . “[158-colonel ducroix] [You]158-colonel ducroix [great silly , pink‑faced , towheaded turnip]1184-great silly , pink‑faced , towheaded turnip ! [You]158-colonel ducroix — ” “[158-colonel ducroix] [You]158-colonel ducroix shall not go by [this train]1185-this train , ” repeated [Syme]85-syme . “[158-colonel ducroix] And why the infernal blazes , ” roared [the other]279-the other , “[0-i] should [I]0-i want to go by [the train]1949-the train ? ” “[0-i] [We]1187-we know all , ” said [the Professor]805-the professor sternly . “[0-i] [You]158-colonel ducroix are going to [Paris]34-paris to throw a bomb ! ” “[158-colonel ducroix] Going to [Jericho]162-jericho to throw a Jabberwock ! ” cried [the other]279-the other , tearing [his]279-the other hair , which came off easily . “[162-jericho] Have [you]1188-you all got softening of the brain , that [you]1188-you do n’t realise what [I]0-i am ? Did [you]1188-you really think [I]0-i wanted to catch [that train]1189-that train ? [Twenty Paris trains]1190-twenty paris trains might go by for [me]0-i . Damn [Paris]34-paris trains ! ” “[1188-you] Then what did [you]1188-you care about ? ” began [the Professor]805-the professor . “[1188-you] What did [I]0-i care about ? [I]0-i did n’t care about catching [the train]1949-the train ; [I]0-i cared about whether [the train]1949-the train caught [me]0-i , and now , by [God]95-god ! it has caught [me]0-i . ” “[0-i] [I]0-i regret to inform [you]1188-you , ” said [Syme]85-syme with restraint , “[0-i] that [your]1188-you remarks convey no impression to [my]0-i mind . Perhaps if [you]1188-you were to remove the remains of [your]1188-you original forehead and some portion of what was once [your]1188-you chin , [your]1188-you meaning would become clearer . Mental lucidity fulfils itself in many ways . What do [you]1188-you mean by saying that [the train]1949-the train has caught [you]1188-you ? It may be [my]0-i literary fancy , but somehow [I]0-i feel that it ought to mean something . ” “[0-i] It means everything , ” said [the other]279-the other , “[1188-you] and the end of everything . [Sunday]107-sunday has [us]1194-us now in the hollow of [his]107-sunday hand . ” “[107-sunday] [Us]1194-us ! ” repeated [the Professor]805-the professor , as if stupefied . “[107-sunday] What do [you]1188-you mean by ‘ [us]1194-us ’ ? ” “[1188-you] [The police]2007-the police , of course ! ” said [the Marquis]745-the marquis , and tore off [his]745-the marquis scalp and half [his]745-the marquis face . The head which emerged was the blonde , well brushed , smooth‑haired head which is common in [the English constabulary]2913-the english constabulary , but the face was terribly pale . “[1188-you] [I]0-i am [Inspector Ratcliffe]163-ratcliffe , ” [he]0-i said , with a sort of haste that verged on harshness . “[0-i] [My]0-i name is pretty well known to [the police]2007-the police , and [I]0-i can see well enough that [you]2007-the police belong to [them]2007-the police . But if there is any doubt about [my]0-i position , [I]0-i have a card ” and [he]0-i began to pull a blue card from [his]0-i pocket . [The Professor]805-the professor gave a tired gesture . “[0-i] Oh , do n’t show it [us]1194-us , ” [he]0-i said wearily ; “[1194-us] [we]1194-us ’ve got enough of [them]2007-the police to equip a paper‑chase . ” [The little man named [Bull]134-dr. bull]2915-the little man named bull , had , like [many men who seem to be of a mere vivacious vulgarity , sudden movements of good taste]2916-many men who seem to be of a mere vivacious vulgarity , sudden movements of good taste . Here [he]2915-the little man named bull certainly saved the situation . In the midst of this staggering transformation scene [he]2915-the little man named bull stepped forward with all the gravity and responsibility of a second , and addressed the two seconds of [the Marquis]745-the marquis . “[733-gentlemen] [Gentlemen]733-gentlemen , ” [he]0-i said , “[733-gentlemen] [we]1194-us all owe [you]733-gentlemen a serious apology ; but [I]0-i assure [you]733-gentlemen that [you]733-gentlemen have not been made [the victims of such a low joke]1198-the victims of such a low joke as [you]733-gentlemen imagine , or indeed of anything undignified in [a man of honour]469-a man of honour . [You]733-gentlemen have not wasted [your]733-gentlemen time ; [you]733-gentlemen have helped to save [the world]231-the world . [We]1194-us are not [buffoons]1201-buffoons , but [very desperate men at war with a vast conspiracy]1202-very desperate men at war with a vast conspiracy . [A secret society of anarchists]1203-a secret society of anarchists is hunting [us]1194-us like hares ; [not such unfortunate madmen]1204-not such unfortunate madmen as may here or there throw a bomb through starvation or German philosophy , but a rich and powerful and [fanatical church]1205-fanatical church , [a church of eastern pessimism , which holds it holy to destroy [mankind]2056-mankind like vermin]1206-a church of eastern pessimism , which holds it holy to destroy mankind like vermin . How hard [they]1208-they hunt [us]1194-us [you]733-gentlemen can gather from the fact that [we]1194-us are driven to such disguises as those for which [I]0-i apologise , and to such pranks as this one by which [you]733-gentlemen suffer . ” [The younger second of the Marquis]2918-the younger second of the marquis , [a short man with a black moustache]2919-a short man with a black moustache , bowed politely , and said — “[733-gentlemen] Of course , [I]0-i accept the apology ; but [you]733-gentlemen will in [your]733-gentlemen turn forgive [me]0-i if [I]0-i decline to follow [you]733-gentlemen further into [your]733-gentlemen difficulties , and permit [myself]0-i to say good morning ! The sight of [an acquaintance and distinguished fellow‑townsman]1209-an acquaintance and distinguished fellow‑townsman coming to pieces in the open air is unusual , and , upon the whole , sufficient for one day . [Colonel Ducroix]158-colonel ducroix , [I]0-i would in no way influence [your]733-gentlemen actions , but if [you]733-gentlemen feel with [me]0-i that [our]1194-us present society is a little abnormal , [I]0-i am now going to walk back to [the town]1210-the town . ” [Colonel Ducroix]158-colonel ducroix moved mechanically , but then tugged abruptly at [his]0-i white moustache and broke out — “[0-i] No , by [George]121-george ! [I]0-i have fought for [France]55-france , and it is hard if [I]0-i ca n’t fight for civilization . ” [Dr. Bull]134-dr. bull took off [his]134-dr. bull hat and waved it , cheering as at a public meeting . “[0-i] Do n’t make too much noise , ” said [Inspector Ratcliffe]163-ratcliffe , “[0-i] [Sunday]107-sunday may hear [you]733-gentlemen . ” “[107-sunday] Sunday ! ” cried [Bull]134-dr. bull , and dropped [his]134-dr. bull hat . “[107-sunday] Yes , ” retorted [Ratcliffe]163-ratcliffe , “[107-sunday] [he]107-sunday may be with [them]1151-these gentlemen . ” “[107-sunday] With whom ? ” asked [Syme]85-syme . “[107-sunday] With [the people]191-the people out of [that train]1189-that train , ” said [the other]279-the other . “[107-sunday] What [you]733-gentlemen say seems utterly wild , ” began [Syme]85-syme . “[733-gentlemen] Why , as a matter of fact — But , [[my]0-i God]1215-my god , ” [he]0-i cried out suddenly , like [a man who sees an explosion a long way off]2921-a man who sees an explosion a long way off , “[95-god] by [God]95-god ! if this is true [the whole bally lot of [us]1217-us on the Anarchist Council]1216-the whole bally lot of us on the anarchist council were against anarchy ! What can it mean ? ” “[733-gentlemen] Mean ! ” said [the new policeman with incredible violence]2922-the new policeman with incredible violence . “[733-gentlemen] It means that [we]1217-us are struck dead ! [I]0-i tell [you]733-gentlemen [he]107-sunday has bought every trust , [he]107-sunday has captured every cable , [he]107-sunday has control of [every railway line]1225-every railway line — especially of that railway line ! ” and [he]0-i pointed a shaking finger towards [the small wayside station]2923-the small wayside station . “[107-sunday] The whole movement was controlled by [him]107-sunday ; half [the world]231-the world was ready to rise for [him]107-sunday . [Idiots]1230-idiots that [we]1231-we are , [he]107-sunday planned the whole of [our]1231-we idiocies ! [Sunday]107-sunday knew that [the Professor]805-the professor would chase [Syme]85-syme through [London]2-london , and that [Syme]85-syme would fight [me]0-i in [France]55-france . And [he]107-sunday was combining great masses of capital , and seizing great lines of telegraphy , while [[we]1231-we five idiots]1233-we five idiots were running after each other like a lot of [confounded babies playing blind man]1234-confounded babies playing blind man ’s buff . ” “[107-sunday] Well ? ” asked [Syme]85-syme with a sort of steadiness . “[107-sunday] Well , ” replied [the other]279-the other with sudden serenity , “[107-sunday] [he]107-sunday has found [us]1231-we playing [blind man]1235-blind man ’s buff to‑day in [a field of great rustic beauty and extreme solitude]1236-a field of great rustic beauty and extreme solitude . [He]107-sunday has probably captured [the world]231-the world ; it only remains to [him]107-sunday to capture [this field]1238-this field and [all the fools]1239-all the fools in it . And since [you]1240-you really want to know what was [my]0-i objection to the arrival of [that train]1189-that train , [I]0-i will tell [you]1240-you . [My]0-i objection was that [Sunday]107-sunday or [[his]107-sunday Secretary]1242-his secretary has just this moment got out of it . ” [Syme]85-syme uttered an involuntary cry , and [they]2925-they all turned [their]2925-they eyes towards [the far‑off station]2926-the far‑off station . It was quite true that [a considerable bulk of [people]2038-people]2927-a considerable bulk of people seemed to be moving in [their]2925-they direction . But [they]2925-they were too distant to be dis­tinguished in any way . “[107-sunday] It was a habit of the late [Marquis de St. Eustache]129-marquis de st. eustache , ” said [the new policeman]2929-the new policeman , producing a leather case , “[129-marquis de st. eustache] always to carry a pair of opera glasses .
