[I]2320-the president dare say it will grow on [me]2320-the president some day . ”[2320-the president] “ [We]1578-the reunited six have no time for tomfoolery , ”[701-the secretary] said [the Secretary]701-the secretary , breaking in savagely . “ [We]1578-the reunited six have come to know what all this means . Who are [you]2017-sir ? What are [you]2017-sir ? Why did [you]2017-sir get [us]1578-the reunited six all [here]2025-here ? Do [you]2017-sir know who and what [we]1578-the reunited six are ? Are [you]2017-sir [a half‑witted man]3303-a half‑witted man playing [the conspirator]3304-the conspirator , or are [you]2017-sir [a clever man]3305-a clever man playing [the fool]2125-the fool ? Answer [me]701-the secretary , [I]701-the secretary tell [you]2017-sir . ”[701-the secretary] “ [Candidates]3307-candidates , ”[107-sunday] murmured [Sunday]107-sunday , “ are only required to answer eight out of the seventeen questions on the paper . As far as [I]107-sunday can make out , [you]2017-sir want [me]107-sunday to tell [you]2017-sir what [I]107-sunday am , and what [you]2017-sir are , and what this table is , and what [this Council]3308-this council is , and what [this world]3309-this world is for all [I]107-sunday know . Well , [I]107-sunday will go so far as to rend the veil of one mystery . If [you]2017-sir want to know what [you]2017-sir are , [you]2017-sir are a set of [highly well‑intentioned young jackasses]3310-highly well‑intentioned young jackasses . ”[107-sunday] “ And [you]2017-sir , ”[85-syme] said [Syme]85-syme , leaning forward , “ what are [you]2017-sir ? ”[85-syme] “ [I]2320-the president ? What am [I]2320-the president ? ”[2320-the president] roared [the President]2320-the president , and [he]2320-the president rose slowly to an incredible height , like some enormous wave about to arch above [them]1595-them and break . “ [You]2017-sir want to know what [I]2320-the president am , do [you]2017-sir ? [Bull]134-dr. bull , [you]134-dr. bull are [a man of science]3311-a man of science . Grub in the roots of those trees and find out the truth about them . [Syme]85-syme , [you]85-syme are [a poet]197-a poet . Stare at those morning clouds . But [I]2320-the president tell [you]85-syme this , that [you]85-syme will have found out the truth of the last tree and the top - most cloud before the truth about [me]2320-the president . [You]85-syme will understand [the sea]2145-the sea , and [I]2320-the president shall be still a riddle ; [you]85-syme shall know what the stars are , and not know what [I]2320-the president am . Since the beginning of [the world]231-the world [all men]1486-all men have hunted [me]2320-the president like a wolf — [kings]690-kings and [sages]3317-sages , and [poets]1972-poets and [lawgivers]3319-lawgivers , [all the churches]3320-all the churches , and all the philosophies . But [I]2320-the president have never been caught yet , and the skies will fall in the time [I]2320-the president turn to bay . [I]2320-the president have given [them]1596-them a good run for [their]1596-them money , and [I]2320-the president will now . ”[2320-the president] Before one of [them]1596-them could move , [the monstrous man]1597-the monstrous man had swung [himself]1597-the monstrous man like some huge ourang‑outang over the balustrade of [the balcony]588-the balcony . Yet before [he]1597-the monstrous man dropped [he]1597-the monstrous man pulled [himself]1597-the monstrous man up again as on a horizontal bar , and thrusting [his]1597-the monstrous man great chin over the edge of [the balcony]588-the balcony , said solemnly — “ There ’s one thing [I]1597-the monstrous man ’ll tell [you]1596-them though about who [I]1597-the monstrous man am . [I]1597-the monstrous man am [the man in [the dark room]3322-the dark room , who made [you]1596-them all [policemen]2221-policemen]3321-the man in the dark room , who made you all policemen . ”[1597-the monstrous man] With that [he]1597-the monstrous man fell from [the balcony]588-the balcony , bouncing on the stones below like a great ball of india‑rubber , and went bounding off towards [the corner of [the Alhambra]1602-the alhambra]1601-the corner of the alhambra , where [he]1597-the monstrous man hailed [a hansom‑cab]1603-a hansom‑cab and sprang inside [it]1603-a hansom‑cab . [The six detectives]1604-the six detectives had been standing thunderstruck and livid in the light of [his]1597-the monstrous man last assertion ; but when [he]1597-the monstrous man disappeared into [the cab]286-the cab , [Syme]85-syme ’s practical senses returned to [him]85-syme , and leaping over [the balcony]588-the balcony so recklessly as almost to break [his]85-syme legs , [he]85-syme called [another cab]1607-another cab . [He]85-syme and [Bull]134-dr. bull sprang into [the cab]286-the cab together , [the Professor]805-the professor and [the Inspector]1610-the inspector into another , while [the Secretary]701-the secretary and [the late Gogol]1612-the late gogol scrambled into a third just in time to pursue the flying [Syme]85-syme , who was pursuing [the flying President]1613-the flying president . [Sunday]107-sunday led [them]1604-the six detectives a wild chase towards [the north‑west]1614-the north‑west , [[his]85-syme cabman]1615-his cabman , evidently under the influence of more than common inducements , urging the horse at breakneck speed . But [Syme]85-syme was in no mood for delicacies , and [he]85-syme stood up in [[his]85-syme own cab]1616-his own cab shouting , “ Stop [thief]3324-thief ! ”[85-syme] until [crowds]1617-crowds ran along beside [[his]85-syme cab]1618-his cab , and [policemen]2221-policemen began to stop and ask questions . All this had its influence upon [[the President]2320-the president ’s cabman]1621-the president ’s cabman , who began to look dubious , and to slow down to a trot . [He]85-syme opened the trap to talk reasonably to [his]85-syme fare , and in so doing let the long whip droop over the front of [the cab]286-the cab . [Sunday]107-sunday leant forward , seized it , and jerked it violently out of [the man]294-the man ’s hand . Then standing up in front of [the cab]286-the cab [himself]107-sunday , [he]107-sunday lashed the horse and roared aloud , so that [they]1625-they went down [the streets]402-the streets like a flying storm . [Through street]1627-through street after [street]1628-street and [square after square]1629-square after square went whirling [this preposterous vehicle]1630-this preposterous vehicle , in which the fare was urging the horse and [the driver]1631-the driver trying desperately to stop [it]1630-this preposterous vehicle . The other three cabs came after [it]1630-this preposterous vehicle ( if the phrase be permissible of [a cab]2015-a cab ) like panting hounds . [Shops]1633-shops and [streets]1634-streets shot by like rattling arrows . At the highest ecstacy of speed , [Sunday]107-sunday turned round on the splashboard where [he]107-sunday stood , and sticking [his]107-sunday great grinning head out of [the cab]286-the cab , with white hair whistling in the wind , [he]107-sunday made a horrible face at [[his]107-sunday pursuers]1636-his pursuers , like [some colossal urchin]1637-some colossal urchin . Then raising [his]107-sunday right hand swiftly , [he]107-sunday flung a ball of paper in [Syme]85-syme ’s face and vanished . [Syme]85-syme caught the thing while instinctively warding it off , and discovered that it consisted of two crumpled papers . One was addressed to [himself]107-sunday , and the other to [Dr. Bull]134-dr. bull , with a very long , and it is to be feared partly ironical , string of letters after [his]134-dr. bull name . [Dr. Bull]134-dr. bull ’s address was , at any rate , considerably longer than [his]134-dr. bull communication , for the communication consisted entirely of the words : — “ What about [Martin Tupper]174-martin tupper now ? ”[134-dr. bull] “ What does [the old maniac]3325-the old maniac mean ? ”[134-dr. bull] asked [Bull]134-dr. bull , staring at the words . “ What does [yours]85-syme say , [Syme]85-syme ? ”[134-dr. bull] [Syme]85-syme ’s message was , at any rate , longer , and ran as follows : — “ [No one]2078-no one would regret anything in the nature of an interference by [the Archdeacon]3327-the archdeacon more than [I.]85-syme [I]2320-the president trust it will not come to that . But , for the last time , where are [your]85-syme goloshes ? The thing is too bad , especially after what [uncle]3328-uncle said . ”[2320-the president] [[The President]2320-the president ’s cabman]1621-the president ’s cabman seemed to be regaining some control over [his]1621-the president ’s cabman horse , and [the pursuers]1640-the pursuers gained a little as [they]1640-the pursuers swept round into [the Edgware Road]69-the edgware road . And here there occurred what seemed to [the allies]1641-the allies a providential stoppage . [Traffic of every kind]1642-traffic of every kind was swerving to right or left or stopping , for down [the long road]1643-the long road was coming the unmistakable roar announcing the fire‑engine , which in a few seconds went by like a brazen thunderbolt . But quick as it went by , [Sunday]107-sunday had bounded out of [[his]107-sunday cab]1618-his cab , sprung at the fire‑engine , caught it , slung [himself]107-sunday on to it , and was seen as [he]107-sunday disappeared in the noisy distance talking to [the astonished fireman]1645-the astonished fireman with explanatory gestures . “ After [him]107-sunday ! ”[85-syme] howled [Syme]85-syme . “ [He]107-sunday ca n’t go astray now . There ’s no mistaking a fire‑engine . ”[85-syme] [The three cabmen , who had been stunned for a moment]1646-the three cabmen , who had been stunned for a moment , whipped up [their]1646-the three cabmen , who had been stunned for a moment horses and slightly decreased the distance between [themselves]1646-the three cabmen , who had been stunned for a moment and [their]1646-the three cabmen , who had been stunned for a moment disappearing prey . [The President]2320-the president acknowledged this proximity by coming to the back of [the car]3155-the car , bowing repeatedly , kissing [his]2320-the president hand , and finally flinging a neatly‑folded note into the bosom of [Inspector Ratcliffe]163-ratcliffe . When [that gentleman]1649-that gentleman opened it , not without impatience , [he]1649-that gentleman found it contained the words : — “ Fly at once . The truth about [your]3329-your trouser - stretchers is known.—A [FRIEND]3330-friend . ”[1649-that gentleman] The fire‑engine had struck still farther to the north , into [a region that [they]1646-the three cabmen , who had been stunned for a moment did not recognise]1650-a region that they did not recognise ; and as it ran by a line of high railings shadowed with trees , [the six friends]1651-the six friends were startled , but somewhat relieved , to see [the President]2320-the president leap from the fire‑engine , though whether through another whim or the increasing protest of [[his]2320-the president entertainers]1653-his entertainers [they]1646-the three cabmen , who had been stunned for a moment could not see . Before [the three cabs]1654-the three cabs , however , could reach up to the spot , [he]2320-the president had gone up the high railings like a huge grey cat , tossed [himself]2320-the president over , and vanished in a darkness of leaves . [Syme]85-syme with a furious gesture stopped [his]85-syme cab , jumped out , and sprang also to the escalade . When [he]85-syme had one leg over the fence and [[his]85-syme friends]2799-his friends were following , [he]85-syme turned a face on [them]2799-his friends which shone quite pale in the shadow . “ What place can this be ? ”[85-syme] [he]85-syme asked . “ Can [it]3331-it be [the old devil ’s house]3332-the old devil ’s house ? [I]85-syme ’ve heard [he]2320-the president has [a house in [North London]70-north london]3333-a house in north london . ”[85-syme] “ All the better , ”[701-the secretary] said [the Secretary]701-the secretary grimly , planting a foot in a foothold , “ [we]3334-we shall find [him]2320-the president at [home]2409-home . ”[701-the secretary] “ No , but it is n’t that , ”[85-syme] said [Syme]85-syme , knitting [his]85-syme brows . “ [I]85-syme hear the most horrible noises , like devils laughing and sneezing and blowing [their]1658-their devilish noses ! ”[85-syme] “ [His]2320-the president dogs barking , of course , ”[701-the secretary] said [the Secretary]701-the secretary . “ Why not say [his]2320-the president black‑beetles barking ! ”[85-syme] said [Syme]85-syme furiously , “ snails barking ! geraniums barking ! Did [you]701-the secretary ever hear a dog bark like that ? ”[85-syme] [He]85-syme held up [his]85-syme hand , and there came out of the thicket a long growling roar that seemed to get under the skin and freeze the flesh — a low thrilling roar that made a throbbing in the air all about [them]1658-their . “ [The dogs of [Sunday]107-sunday]3336-the dogs of sunday would be no ordinary dogs , ”[124-gogol] said [Gogol]124-gogol , and shuddered . [Syme]85-syme had jumped down on the other side , but [he]85-syme still stood listening impatiently . “ Well , listen to that , ”[85-syme] [he]85-syme said , “ is that a dog — [anybody]2277-anybody ’s dog ? ”[85-syme] There broke upon [their]1658-their ear a hoarse screaming as of things protesting and clamouring in sudden pain ; and then , far off like an echo , what sounded like a long nasal trumpet . “ Well , [[his]85-syme house]3076-his house ought to be hell ! ”[701-the secretary] said [the Secretary]701-the secretary ; “ and if it is hell , [I]701-the secretary ’m going in ! ”[701-the secretary] and [he]85-syme sprang over the tall railings almost with one swing . [The others]604-the others followed . [They]1658-their broke through a tangle of plants and shrubs , and came out on [an open path]1661-an open path . Nothing was in sight , but [Dr. Bull]134-dr. bull suddenly struck [his]134-dr. bull hands together . “ Why , [[you]1658-their asses]3339-you asses , ”[134-dr. bull] [he]134-dr. bull cried , “ it ’s [the Zoo]72-the zoo ! ”[134-dr. bull] As [they]1658-their were looking round wildly for any trace of [[their]1658-their wild quarry]1662-their wild quarry , [a keeper in uniform]1663-a keeper in uniform came running along [the path]1664-the path with [a man in plain clothes]1665-a man in plain clothes . “ Has it come this way ? ”[1666-the keeper] gasped [the keeper]1666-the keeper . “ Has what ? ”[85-syme] asked [Syme]85-syme . “ [The elephant]3340-the elephant ! ”[1666-the keeper] cried [the keeper]1666-the keeper . “ [An elephant]3341-an elephant has gone mad and run away ! ”[1666-the keeper] “ [He]3341-an elephant has run away with [an old gentleman]3342-an old gentleman , ”[1668-the other stranger] said [the other stranger]1668-the other stranger breathlessly , “ [a poor old gentleman with white hair ! ”]3343-a poor old gentleman with white hair ! ”[1668-the other stranger] “ What sort of [old gentleman]3344-old gentleman ? ”[85-syme] asked [Syme]85-syme , with great curiosity . “ [A very large and fat old gentleman in light grey clothes]3345-a very large and fat old gentleman in light grey clothes , ”[1666-the keeper] said [the keeper]1666-the keeper eagerly . “ Well , ”[85-syme] said [Syme]85-syme , “ if [he]3345-a very large and fat old gentleman in light grey clothes ’s [that particular kind of old gentleman]3346-that particular kind of old gentleman , if [you]3347-you ’re quite sure that [he]3345-a very large and fat old gentleman in light grey clothes ’s [a large and fat old gentleman in grey clothes]3348-a large and fat old gentleman in grey clothes , [you]3347-you may take [my]85-syme word for it that the elephant has not run away with [him]3345-a very large and fat old gentleman in light grey clothes . [He]3345-a very large and fat old gentleman in light grey clothes has run away with [the elephant]3340-the elephant . [The elephant]3340-the elephant is not made by [God]95-god that could run away with [him]3345-a very large and fat old gentleman in light grey clothes if [he]3345-a very large and fat old gentleman in light grey clothes did not consent to the elopement . And , by thunder , there [he]3345-a very large and fat old gentleman in light grey clothes is ! ”[85-syme] There was no doubt about it this time . Clean across [the space of grass]1670-the space of grass , about two hundred yards away , with [a crowd]1264-a crowd screaming and scampering vainly at [his]1672-his heels , went a huge grey elephant at an awful stride , with [his]1672-his trunk thrown out as rigid as [a ship]1673-a ship ’s bowsprit , and trumpeting like the trumpet of doom . On the back of [the bellowing and plunging animal]1674-the bellowing and plunging animal sat [President Sunday]107-sunday with all the placidity of [a sultan]1675-a sultan , but goading the animal to a furious speed with some sharp object in [his]1672-his hand . “ Stop [him]3345-a very large and fat old gentleman in light grey clothes ! ”[1676-the populace] screamed [the populace]1676-the populace . “ [He]3345-a very large and fat old gentleman in light grey clothes ’ll be out of the gate ! ”[1676-the populace] “ Stop a landslide ! ”[1666-the keeper] said [the keeper]1666-the keeper . “ [He]3345-a very large and fat old gentleman in light grey clothes is out of the gate ! ”[1666-the keeper] And even as [he]1666-the keeper spoke , a final crash and roar of terror announced that the great grey elephant had broken out of the gates of [the Zoological Gardens]1678-the zoological gardens , and was careening down [Albany Street]73-albany street like a new and swift sort of omnibus . “ [Great Lord]175-great lord ! ”[134-dr. bull] cried [Bull]134-dr. bull , “ [I]134-dr. bull never knew an elephant could go so fast . Well , it must be hansom‑cabs again if [we]1679-they are to keep [him]3345-a very large and fat old gentleman in light grey clothes in sight . ”[134-dr. bull] As [they]1679-they raced along to the gate out of which the elephant had vanished , [Syme]85-syme felt a glaring panorama of the strange animals in the cages which [they]1679-they passed . Afterwards [he]85-syme thought it queer that [he]85-syme should have seen [them]1680-them so clearly . [He]85-syme remembered especially seeing pelicans , with [their]1681-their preposterous , pendant throats . [He]85-syme wondered why the pelican was the symbol of charity , except it was that it wanted a good deal of charity to admire [a pelican]1682-a pelican . [He]85-syme remembered a hornbill , which was simply a huge yellow beak with a small bird tied on behind it . The whole gave [him]85-syme a sensation , the vividness of which [he]85-syme could not explain , that Nature was always making quite mysterious jokes . [Sunday]107-sunday had told [them]1679-they that [they]1679-they would understand [him]85-syme when [they]1679-they had understood the stars . [He]85-syme wondered whether even [the archangels]1683-the archangels understood the hornbill . [The six unhappy detectives]1684-the six unhappy detectives flung [themselves]1684-the six unhappy detectives into [cabs]1685-cabs and followed the elephant sharing the terror which [he]85-syme spread through the long stretch of [the streets]402-the streets . This time [Sunday]107-sunday did not turn round , but offered [them]1679-they the solid stretch of [his]107-sunday unconscious back , which maddened [them]1679-they , if possible , more than [his]107-sunday previous mockeries . Just before [they]1679-they came to [Baker Street]6-baker street , however , [he]85-syme was seen to throw something far up into the air , as [a boy]572-a boy does a ball meaning to catch it again . But at [their]1679-they rate of racing it fell far behind , just by the cab containing [Gogol]124-gogol ; and in faint hope of a clue or for some impulse unexplainable , [he]85-syme stopped [[his]85-syme cab]1618-his cab so as to pick it up . It was addressed to [himself]85-syme , and was quite a bulky parcel . On examination , however , its bulk was found to consist of thirty‑three pieces of paper of no value wrapped one round the other . When the last covering was torn away it reduced itself to a small slip of paper , on which was written : — “ The word , [I]1689-the man once known as gogol fancy , should be ‘ pink ’ . ”[1689-the man once known as gogol] [The man once known as [Gogol]124-gogol]1689-the man once known as gogol said nothing , but the movements of [his]1689-the man once known as gogol hands and feet were like those of [a man urging a horse to renewed efforts]1690-a man urging a horse to renewed efforts . Through [street]1628-street after [street]1628-street , through [district]1693-district after [district]1693-district , went the prodigy of the flying elephant , calling [crowds]1617-crowds to every window , and driving the traffic left and right . And still through all this insane publicity the three cabs toiled after it , until [they]1679-they came to be regarded as part of a procession , and perhaps the advertisement of [a circus]1696-a circus . [They]1679-they went at such a rate that distances were shortened beyond belief , and [Syme]85-syme saw [the Albert Hall in [Kensington]74-kensington]1697-the albert hall in kensington when [he]85-syme thought that [he]85-syme was still in [Paddington]75-paddington . The wheel grew larger and larger , till it filled heaven like the wheel of stars . The beast outstripped [the cabs]1701-the cabs . [They]1679-they lost [him]1689-the man once known as gogol round several corners , and when [they]1679-they came to one of the gates of [the Earl ’s Court Exhibition]1702-the earl ’s court exhibition [they]1679-they found [themselves]1679-they finally blocked . In front of [them]1679-they was [an enormous crowd]1703-an enormous crowd ; in the midst of it was an enormous elephant , heaving and shuddering as such shapeless creatures do . But [the President]2320-the president had disappeared . “ Where has [he]2320-the president gone to ? ”[85-syme] asked [Syme]85-syme , slipping to the ground . “ [Gentleman]3351-gentleman rushed into [the Exhibition]3352-the exhibition , [sir]2017-sir ! ”[1705-an official] said [an official]1705-an official in a dazed manner . Do — ”[701-the secretary] “ Look ! ”[85-syme] shouted [Syme]85-syme suddenly . “ Look over there ! ’ “[85-syme] Look at what ? ” asked [the Secretary]701-the secretary savagely . “[701-the secretary] Look at the captive balloon ! ” said [Syme]85-syme , and pointed in a frenzy . “[701-the secretary] Why the blazes should [I]0-i look at a captive balloon ? ’ demanded [the Secretary]701-the secretary . “ What is there queer about a captive balloon ? ”[701-the secretary] “ Nothing , ”[85-syme] said [Syme]85-syme , “ except that it is n’t captive ! ’ [They]3363-they all turned [their]3363-they eyes to where the balloon swung and swelled above the Exhibition on a string , like [a child]523-a child ’s balloon . A second afterwards the string came in two just under [the car]3155-the car , and the balloon , broken loose , floated away with the freedom of a soap bubble . “[85-syme] Ten thousand devils ! ” shrieked [the Secretary]701-the secretary . “[85-syme] [He]1709-he ’s got into it ! ” and [he]701-the secretary shook [his]701-the secretary fists at the sky . The balloon , borne by some chance wind , came right above [them]3363-they , and [they]3363-they could see the great white head of [the President]2320-the president peering over the side and looking benevolently down on [them]3363-they . “[1709-he] God bless [my]0-i soul ! ” said [the Professor]805-the professor with the elderly manner that [he]0-i could never disconnect from [his]0-i bleached beard and parchment face . “[1709-he] God bless [my]0-i soul ! [I]0-i seemed to fancy that something fell on the top of [my]0-i hat ! ” [He]0-i put up a trembling hand and took from that shelf a piece of twisted paper , which [he]0-i opened absently only to find it inscribed with [a true lover]3369-a true lover ’s knot and , the words : — “[0-i] [Your]1710-your beauty has not left [me]0-i indifferent.—From LITTLE SNOWDROP . ” There was a short silence , and then [Syme]85-syme said , biting [his]85-syme beard — “[0-i] [I]0-i ’m not beaten yet . The blasted thing must come down somewhere . Let ’s follow it ! ” ACROSS [green fields]3370-green fields , and breaking through blooming hedges , toiled [six draggled detectives]3371-six draggled detectives , about five miles out of [London]2-london . [The optimist of [the party]3373-the party]1565-the optimist of the party had at first proposed that [they]3371-six draggled detectives should follow the balloon across [South England]77-south england in hansom‑cabs . But [he]1565-the optimist of the party was ultimately convinced of the persistent refusal of [the balloon]3374-the balloon to follow [the roads]3375-the roads , and the still more persistent refusal of [the cabmen]3376-the cabmen to follow the balloon . Consequently [the tireless though exasperated travellers]3377-the tireless though exasperated travellers broke through black thickets and ploughed through [ploughed fields]3378-ploughed fields till each was turned into a figure too outrageous to be mistaken for [a tramp]3379-a tramp . [Those green hills of [Surrey]47-the surrey]3380-those green hills of surrey saw the final collapse and tragedy of the admirable light grey suit in which [Syme]85-syme had set out from [Saffron Park]1-saffron park . [His]85-syme silk hat was broken over [his]85-syme nose by a swinging bough , [his]85-syme coat‑tails were torn to the shoulder by arresting thorns , the clay of [England]13-england was splashed up to [his]85-syme collar ; but [he]85-syme still carried [his]85-syme yellow beard forward with a silent and furious determination , and [his]85-syme eyes were still fixed on that floating ball of gas , which in the full flush of sunset seemed coloured like a sunset cloud . “[0-i] After all , ” [he]85-syme said , “[0-i] it is very beautiful ! ” “[0-i] It is singularly and strangely beautiful ! ” said [the Professor]805-the professor . “[0-i] [I]0-i wish the beastly gas‑bag would burst ! ” “[0-i] No , ” said [Dr. Bull]134-dr. bull , “[0-i] [I]0-i hope it wo n’t . It did n’t prevent [my]0-i fighting [him]1711-the old boy like hell ! Shall [I]0-i make it clear if [I]0-i say that [I]0-i liked [him]1711-the old boy because [he]1711-the old boy was so fat ? ” “[0-i] [You]0-i will not , ” said [the Secretary]701-the secretary . “[0-i] [I]0-i ’ve got it now , ” cried [Bull]134-dr. bull , “[0-i] it was because [he]1711-the old boy was so fat and so light . Just like a balloon . [We]1718-we always think of [fat people]1719-fat people as heavy , but [he]1711-the old boy could have danced against [a sylph]1720-a sylph . [I]0-i see now what [I]0-i mean . Moderate strength is shown in violence , supreme strength is shown in levity . It was like the old speculations — what would happen if an elephant could leap up in the sky like a grasshopper ? ” “[1718-we] [Our]1718-we elephant , ” said [Syme]85-syme , looking upwards , “[1718-we] has leapt into the sky like a grasshopper . ” “[1718-we] And somehow , ” concluded [Bull]134-dr. bull , “[1718-we] that ’s why [I]0-i ca n’t help liking old Sunday . No , it ’s not an admiration of force , or any silly thing like that . There is a kind of gaiety in the thing , as if [he]1711-the old boy were bursting with some good news . Have n’t [you]1721-you sometimes felt it on a spring day ? [You]1721-you know Nature plays tricks , but somehow that day proves they are good‑natured tricks . [I]0-i never read the Bible [myself]0-i , but that part [they]1722-they laugh at is literal truth , ‘ Why leap [ye]1721-you , [ye]1721-you high hills ? ’ [The hills]1723-the hills do leap — ‑at least , [they]1723-the hills try to .... Why do [I]0-i like [Sunday]107-sunday ? . . . how can [I]0-i tell [you]1721-you ? . . . because [he]107-sunday ’s such [a Bounder]1724-a bounder . ” There was a long silence , and then [the Secretary]701-the secretary said in a curious , strained voice — “[107-sunday] [You]1721-you do not know Sunday at all . Perhaps it is because [you]1721-you are better than [I]0-i , and do not know hell . [I]0-i was [a fierce fellow]1725-a fierce fellow , and a trifle morbid from the first . [The man who sits in darkness]1726-the man who sits in darkness , and who chose [us]1727-us all , chose [me]0-i because [I]0-i had all the crazy look of [a conspirator]1728-a conspirator — because [my]0-i smile went crooked , and [my]0-i eyes were gloomy , even when [I]0-i smiled . But there must have been something in [me]0-i that answered to the nerves in [all these anarchic men]1729-all these anarchic men . For when [I]0-i first saw [Sunday]107-sunday [he]107-sunday expressed to [me]0-i , not [your]1721-you airy vitality , but something both gross and sad in the Nature of Things . [I]0-i found [him]107-sunday smoking in [a twilight room]1730-a twilight room , [a room with brown blind down , infinitely more depressing than the genial darkness in which [[our]1727-us master]1732-our master lives]1731-a room with brown blind down , infinitely more depressing than the genial darkness in which our master lives . [He]107-sunday sat there on a bench , [a huge heap of a man , dark and out of shape]1733-a huge heap of a man , dark and out of shape . [He]107-sunday listened to all [my]0-i words without speaking or even stirring . [I]0-i poured out [my]0-i most passionate appeals , and asked [my]0-i most eloquent questions . Then , after a long silence , the Thing began to shake , and [I]0-i thought it was shaken by some secret malady . It shook like a loathsome and living jelly . It reminded [me]0-i of everything [I]0-i had ever read about the base bodies that are the origin of life — the deep sea lumps and protoplasm . It seemed like the final form of matter , the most shapeless and the most shameful . [I]0-i could only tell [myself]0-i , from its shudderings , that it was something at least that [such a monster]1734-such a monster could be miserable . And then it broke upon [me]0-i that [the bestial mountain]1735-the bestial mountain was shaking with a lonely laughter , and the laughter was at [me]0-i . Do [you]1736-you ask [me]0-i to forgive [him]107-sunday that ? It is no small thing to be laughed at by something at once lower and stronger than [oneself]1737-oneself . ” “[1736-you] Surely [[you]1736-you fellows]471-you fellows are exaggerating wildly , ” cut in the clear voice of [Inspector Ratcliffe]163-ratcliffe . “[1736-you] [President Sunday]107-sunday is [a terrible fellow]1739-a terrible fellow for [one]225-one ’s intellect , but [he]107-sunday is not such [[a Barnum]1741-a barnum ’s freak]1742-a barnum ’s freak physically as [you]1736-you make out . [He]107-sunday received [me]0-i in [an ordinary office]1743-an ordinary office , in a grey check coat , in broad daylight . [He]107-sunday talked to [me]0-i in an ordinary way . But [I]0-i ’ll tell [you]1736-you what is a trifle creepy about [Sunday]107-sunday . [[His]107-sunday room]1744-his room is neat , [his]107-sunday clothes are neat , everything seems in order ; but [he]107-sunday ’s absent‑minded . Sometimes [his]107-sunday great bright eyes go quite blind . For hours [he]107-sunday forgets that [you]1736-you are there . Now absent‑mindedness is just a bit too awful in [a bad man]2258-a bad man . [We]1746-we think of [a wicked man]1747-a wicked man as vigilant . [We]1746-we ca n’t think of [a wicked man who is honestly and sincerely dreamy]1748-a wicked man who is honestly and sincerely dreamy , because [we]1746-we dare n’t think of [a wicked man]1747-a wicked man alone with [himself]1747-a wicked man . [An absentminded man]1750-an absentminded man means [a good‑natured man]1751-a good‑natured man . [It]1750-an absentminded man means [a man who , if [he]1752-a man who , if he happens to see you happens to see [you]1736-you]1752-a man who , if he happens to see you , will apologise . But how will [you]1736-you bear [an absent­minded man who , if [he]1752-a man who , if he happens to see you happens to see [you]1736-you , will kill [you]1736-you]1753-an absent­minded man who , if he happens to see you , will kill you ? That is what tries the nerves , abstraction combined with cruelty . [Men]214-men have felt it sometimes when [they]214-men went through [wild forests]1755-wild forests , and felt that the animals there were at once innocent and pitiless . [They]214-men might ignore or slay . How would [you]1736-you like to pass ten mortal hours in a parlour with an absent‑minded tiger ? ” “[1736-you] And what do [you]1756-you think of [Sunday]107-sunday , [Gogol]124-gogol ? ” asked [Syme]85-syme . “[124-gogol] [I]0-i do n’t think of Sunday on principle , ” said [Gogol]124-gogol simply , “[0-i] any more than [I]0-i stare at the sun at noonday . ” “[0-i] Well , that is a point of view , ” said [Syme]85-syme thoughtfully . “[1756-you] What do [you]1756-you say , [Professor]884-professor ? ” [The Professor]805-the professor was walking with bent head and trailing stick , and [he]805-the professor did not answer at all . “[1756-you] Wake up , [Professor]884-professor ! ” said [Syme]85-syme genially . “[884-professor] Tell [us]1759-us what [you]1756-you think of [Sunday]107-sunday . ” [The Professor]805-the professor spoke at last very slowly . “[0-i] [I]0-i think something , ” [he]805-the professor said , “[0-i] that [I]0-i can not say clearly . Or , rather , [I]0-i think something that [I]0-i can not even think clearly . But it is something like this . [My]0-i early life , as [you]1760-you know , was a bit too large and loose . Well , when [I]0-i saw [Sunday]107-sunday ’s face [I]0-i thought it was too large — [everybody]376-everybody does , but [I]0-i also thought it was too loose . The face was so big , that [one]225-one could n’t focus it or make it a face at all . The eye was so far away from the nose , that it was n’t an eye . The mouth was so much by itself , that [one]225-one had to think of it by itself . The whole thing is too hard to explain . ” [He]0-i paused for a little , still trailing [his]0-i stick , and then went on — “[225-one] But put it this way . Walking up [a road]1764-a road at night , [I]0-i have seen a lamp and a lighted window and a cloud make together a most complete and unmistakable face . If [anyone in heaven]1765-anyone in heaven has that face [I]0-i shall know [him]1765-anyone in heaven again . Yet when [I]0-i walked a little farther [I]0-i found that there was no face , that the window was ten yards away , the lamp ten hundred yards , the cloud beyond [the world]231-the world . Well , [Sunday]107-sunday ’s face escaped [me]0-i ; it ran away to right and left , as such chance pictures run away . And so [his]107-sunday face has made [me]0-i , somehow , doubt whether there are any faces . [I]0-i do n’t know whether [your]1767-your face , [Bull]134-dr. bull , is a face or a combination in perspective . Perhaps one black disc of [your]1767-your beastly glasses is quite close and another fifty miles away . Oh , the doubts of [a materialist]1768-a materialist are not worth a dump . [Sunday]107-sunday has taught [me]0-i the last and the worst doubts , the doubts of [a spiritualist]1769-a spiritualist . [I]0-i am [a Buddhist]1770-a buddhist , [I]0-i suppose ; and Buddhism is not a creed , it is a doubt . [[My]0-i poor]1771-my poor dear [Bull]134-dr. bull , [I]0-i do not believe that [you]134-dr. bull really have a face . [I]0-i have not faith enough to believe in matter . ” [Syme]85-syme ’s eyes were still fixed upon the errant orb , which , reddened in the evening light , looked like [some rosier and more innocent world]3388-some rosier and more innocent world . “[134-dr. bull] Have [you]134-dr. bull noticed an odd thing , ” [he]85-syme said , “[134-dr. bull] about all [your]134-dr. bull descriptions ? [Each man of [you]134-dr. bull]1772-each man of you finds [Sunday]107-sunday quite different , yet [each man of [you]134-dr. bull]1772-each man of you can only find one thing to compare [him]107-sunday to — [the universe]2261-the universe itself . [Bull]134-dr. bull finds [him]107-sunday like [the earth]234-the earth in spring , [Gogol]124-gogol like the sun at noonday . [The Secretary]146-the secretary is reminded of the shapeless protoplasm , and the [Inspector]163-ratcliffe of the carelessness of [virgin forests]1776-virgin forests . [The Professor]805-the professor says [he]107-sunday is like a changing landscape . This is queer , but it is queerer still that [I]0-i also have had [my]0-i odd notion about [the President]2320-the president , and [I]0-i also find that [I]0-i think of [Sunday]107-sunday as [I]0-i think of [the whole world]1779-the whole world . ” “[107-sunday] Get on a little faster , [Syme]85-syme , ” said [Bull]134-dr. bull ; “[107-sunday] never mind the balloon . ” “[107-sunday] When [I]0-i first saw [Sunday]107-sunday , ” said [Syme]85-syme slowly , “[0-i] [I]0-i only saw [his]107-sunday back ; and when [I]0-i saw [his]107-sunday back , [I]0-i knew [he]107-sunday was [the worst man in [the world]231-the world]1780-the worst man in the world . [His]107-sunday neck and shoulders were brutal , like those of [some apish god]1782-some apish god . [His]107-sunday head had a stoop that was hardly human , like the stoop of an ox . In fact , [I]0-i had at once the revolting fancy that this was not [a man]221-a man at all , but a beast dressed up in [men]214-men ’s clothes . ” “[214-men] Get on , ” said [Dr. Bull]134-dr. bull . “[214-men] And then the queer thing happened . [I]0-i had seen [his]107-sunday back from [the street]277-the street , as [he]107-sunday sat in [the balcony]588-the balcony . Then [I]0-i entered [the hotel]597-the hotel , and coming round the other side of [him]107-sunday , saw [his]107-sunday face in the sunlight . [His]107-sunday face frightened [me]0-i , as it did [everyone]271-everyone ; but not because it was brutal , not because it was evil . On the contrary , it frightened [me]0-i because it was so beautiful , because it was so good . ” “[85-syme] [Syme]85-syme , ” exclaimed [the Secretary]701-the secretary , “[85-syme] are [you]85-syme ill ? ” “[85-syme] It was like the face of [some ancient archangel , judging justly after heroic wars]1789-some ancient archangel , judging justly after heroic wars . There was laughter in the eyes , and in the mouth honour and sorrow . There was the same white hair , the same great , grey‑clad shoulders that [I]0-i had seen from behind . But when [I]0-i saw [him]107-sunday from behind [I]0-i was certain [he]107-sunday was an animal , and when [I]0-i saw [him]107-sunday in front [I]0-i knew [he]107-sunday was [a god]1790-a god . ” “[177-pan] [Pan]177-pan , ” said [the Professor]805-the professor dreamily , “[1790-a god] was [a god]1790-a god and an animal . ” “[177-pan] Then , and again and always , ” went on [Syme]85-syme like [a man]221-a man talking to [himself]221-a man , “[177-pan] that has been for [me]0-i the mystery of Sunday , and it is also the mystery of [the world]231-the world . When [I]0-i see the horrible back , [I]0-i am sure the noble face is but a mask . When [I]0-i see the face but for an instant , [I]0-i know the back is only a jest . Bad is so bad , that [we]1793-we can not but think good an accident ; good is so good , that [we]1793-we feel certain that evil could be explained . But the whole came to a kind of crest yesterday when [I]0-i raced [Sunday]107-sunday for [the cab]286-the cab , and was just behind [him]107-sunday all the way . ” “[0-i] Had [you]0-i time for thinking then ? ” asked [Ratcliffe]163-ratcliffe . “[0-i] Time , ” replied [Syme]85-syme , “[0-i] for one outrageous thought . [I]0-i was suddenly possessed with the idea that the blind , blank back of [his]107-sunday head really was [his]107-sunday face — an awful , eyeless face staring at [me]0-i ! And [I]0-i fancied that the figure running in front of [me]0-i was really a figure running backwards , and dancing as [he]107-sunday ran . ” “[107-sunday] Horrible ! ” said [Dr. Bull]134-dr. bull , and shuddered . “[107-sunday] Horrible is not the word , ” said [Syme]85-syme . “[107-sunday] It was exactly the worst instant of [my]0-i life . And yet ten minutes afterwards , when [he]107-sunday put [his]107-sunday head out of [the cab]286-the cab and made a grimace like a gargoyle , [I]0-i knew that [he]107-sunday was only like [a father]1796-a father playing [hide‑and‑seek]178-hide‑and‑seek with [[his]1796-a father children]1797-his children . ” “[107-sunday] It is a long game , ” said [the Secretary]701-the secretary , and frowned at [his]701-the secretary broken boots . “[107-sunday] Listen to [me]0-i , ” cried [Syme]85-syme with extraordinary emphasis . “[0-i] Shall [I]0-i tell [you]1798-you the secret of [the whole world]1779-the whole world ? It is that [we]1800-we have only known the back of [the world]231-the world . [We]1800-we see everything from behind , and it looks brutal . That is not a tree , but the back of a tree . That is not a cloud , but the back of a cloud . Can not [you]1798-you see that everything is stooping and hiding a face ? If [we]1800-we could only get round in front — ” “[1800-we] Look ! ” cried out [Bull]134-dr. bull clamorously , “[1800-we] the balloon is coming down ! ” There was no need to cry out to [Syme]85-syme , who had never taken [his]85-syme eyes off it . [He]85-syme saw the great luminous globe suddenly stagger in the sky , right itself , and then sink slowly behind the trees like a setting sun . [The man called [Gogol]124-gogol , who had hardly spoken through all [their]1800-we weary travels]3393-the man called gogol , who had hardly spoken through all their weary travels , suddenly threw up [his]124-gogol hands like a lost spirit . “[1800-we] [He]1802-he is dead ! ” [he]124-gogol cried . “[1802-he] And now [I]0-i know [he]1802-he was [[my]0-i friend]1334-my friend — [[my]0-i friend]1334-my friend in the dark ! ” “[1802-he] Dead ! ” snorted [the Secretary]701-the secretary . “[1798-you] [You]1798-you will not find [him]1802-he dead easily . If [he]1802-he has been tipped out of [the car]3155-the car , [we]1806-us shall find [him]1802-he rolling as a colt rolls in [a field]1807-a field , kicking [his]1802-he legs for fun . ” “[1802-he] Clashing [his]1802-he hoofs , ” said [the Professor]805-the professor . “[1802-he] [The colts]1808-the colts do , and so did [Pan]177-pan . ” “[177-pan] [Pan]177-pan again ! ” said [Dr. Bull]134-dr. bull irritably . “[177-pan] [You]1798-you seem to think [Pan]177-pan is everything . ” “[177-pan] So [he]1802-he is , ” said [the Professor]805-the professor , “[1802-he] in [Greek]80-greek . [He]1802-he means everything . ” “[1802-he] Do n’t forget , ” said [the Secretary]701-the secretary , looking down , “[1802-he] that [he]1802-he also means Panic . ” [Syme]85-syme had stood without hearing any of the exclamations . “[1802-he] It fell over there , ” [he]85-syme said shortly . “[1802-he] Let [us]1806-us follow it ! ” Then [he]85-syme added with an indescribable gesture — “[1802-he] Oh , if [he]1802-he has cheated [us]1806-us all by getting killed ! It would be like one of [his]1802-he larks . ” [He]85-syme strode off towards the distant trees with a new energy , [his]85-syme rags and ribbons fluttering in the wind . [The others]604-the others followed [him]85-syme in a more footsore and dubious manner . And almost at the same moment [all six men]3399-all six men realised that [they]3399-all six men were not alone in [the little field]3400-the little field . Across [the square of turf]3401-the square of turf [a tall man]3402-a tall man was advancing towards [them]3399-all six men , leaning on a strange long staff like a sceptre . [He]3402-a tall man was clad in a fine but old‑fashioned suit with knee‑breeches ; its colour was that shade between blue , violet and grey which can be seen in certain shadows of [the woodland]3008-the woodland . [His]3402-a tall man hair was whitish grey , and at the first glance , taken along with [his]3402-a tall man knee - breeches , looked as if it was powdered . [His]3402-a tall man advance was very quiet ; but for the silver frost upon [his]3402-a tall man head , [he]3402-a tall man might have been one to the shadows of [the wood]2942-the wood . “[1802-he] [Gentlemen]733-gentlemen , ” [he]3402-a tall man said , “[1810-my master] [[my]0-i master]1810-my master has [a carriage]1811-a carriage waiting for [you]733-gentlemen in [the road just by]1812-the road just by . ” “[1810-my master] Who is [[your]0-i master]1813-your master ? ” asked [Syme]85-syme , standing quite still . “[0-i] [I]0-i was told [you]733-gentlemen knew [his]1813-your master name , ” said [the man]294-the man respectfully . There was a silence , and then [the Secretary]701-the secretary said — “[733-gentlemen] Where is [this carriage]1814-this carriage ? ” “[1814-this carriage] [It]1814-this carriage has been waiting only a few moments , ” said [the stranger]3407-the stranger . “[1814-this carriage] [[My]0-i master]1810-my master has only just come [home]2409-home . ” [Syme]85-syme looked left and right upon [the patch of green field in which [he]85-syme found [himself]85-syme]3408-the patch of green field in which he found himself . [The hedges]3409-the hedges were ordinary hedges , the trees seemed ordinary trees ; yet [he]85-syme felt like [a man entrapped in fairyland]3410-a man entrapped in fairyland . [He]85-syme looked [the mysterious ambassador]3411-the mysterious ambassador up and down , but [he]85-syme could discover nothing except that [the man]294-the man ’s coat was the exact colour of the purple shadows , and that [the man]294-the man ’s face was the exact colour of the red and brown and golden sky . “[1810-my master] Show [us]1817-us [the place]193-the place , ” [Syme]85-syme said briefly , and without a word [the man in the violet coat]3414-the man in the violet coat turned [his]294-the man back and walked towards a gap in the hedge , which let in suddenly the light of [a white road]2120-a white road . As [the six wanderers]3416-the six wanderers broke out upon [this thoroughfare]3417-this thoroughfare , [they]3416-the six wanderers saw [the white road]3105-the white road blocked by what looked like a long row of carriages , such a row of carriages as might close the approach to [some house in [Park Lane]81-park lane]3419-some house in park lane . Along the side of [these carriages]3420-these carriages stood [a rank of splendid servants]3421-a rank of splendid servants , all dressed in the grey‑blue uniform , and all having a certain quality of stateliness and freedom which would not commonly belong to [the servants of [a gentleman]2023-a gentleman]3422-the servants of a gentleman , but rather to [the officials and ambassadors of [a great king]3425-a great king]3424-the officials and ambassadors of a great king . There were [no less than six carriages]3426-no less than six carriages waiting , one for each of [the tattered and miserable band]3427-the tattered and miserable band . [All the attendants]3428-all the attendants ( as if in court‑dress ) wore swords , and as [each man]633-each man crawled into [[his]633-each man carriage]3430-his carriage [they]3416-the six wanderers drew [them]3416-the six wanderers , and saluted with a sudden blaze of steel . “[1810-my master] What can it all mean ? ” asked [Bull of Syme]85-syme as [they]3416-the six wanderers separated . “[1810-my master] Is this another joke of [Sunday]107-sunday ’s ? ” “[0-i] [I]0-i do n’t know , ” said [Syme]85-syme as [he]85-syme sank wearily back in the cushions of [[his]85-syme carriage]3430-his carriage ; “[0-i] but if it is , it ’s one of the jokes [you]0-i talk about . It ’s a good‑natured one . ” [The six adventurers]3432-the six adventurers had passed through many adventures , but not one had carried [them]3432-the six adventurers so utterly off [their]3432-the six adventurers feet as this last adventure of comfort . [They]3432-the six adventurers had all become inured to things going roughly ; but things suddenly going smoothly swamped [them]3432-the six adventurers . [They]3432-the six adventurers could not even feebly imagine what [the carriages]3433-the carriages were ; it was enough for [them]3432-the six adventurers to know that [they]3433-the carriages were [carriages]3434-carriages , and [carriages with cushions]3435-carriages with cushions . [They]3432-the six adventurers could not conceive who [the old man]2469-the old man was who had led [them]3432-the six adventurers ; but it was quite enough that [he]2469-the old man had certainly led [them]3432-the six adventurers to [the carriages]3433-the carriages . [Syme]85-syme drove through a drifting darkness of trees in utter abandonment . It was typical of [him]2469-the old man that while [he]2469-the old man had carried [his]2469-the old man bearded chin forward fiercely so long as anything could be done , when the whole business was taken out of [his]2469-the old man hands [he]2469-the old man fell back on the cushions in a frank collapse . Very gradually and very vaguely [he]2469-the old man realised into what rich roads [the carriage]3438-the carriage was carrying [him]2469-the old man . [He]2469-the old man saw that [they]3432-the six adventurers passed the stone gates of what might have been [a park]3439-a park , that [they]3432-the six adventurers began gradually to climb [a hill which , while wooded on both sides , was somewhat more orderly than [a forest]2146-a forest]3440-a hill which , while wooded on both sides , was somewhat more orderly than a forest . Then there began to grow upon [him]2469-the old man , as upon [a man slowly waking from a healthy sleep , a pleasure in everything]3442-a man slowly waking from a healthy sleep , a pleasure in everything . [He]2469-the old man felt that the hedges were what hedges should be , living walls ; that a hedge is like [a human army , disciplined]3443-a human army , disciplined , but all the more alive . [He]2469-the old man saw high elms behind the hedges , and vaguely thought how happy [boys]3444-boys would be climbing [there]1968-there . Then [[his]2469-the old man carriage]3430-his carriage took a turn of the path , and [he]2469-the old man saw suddenly and quietly , like a long , low , sunset cloud , [a long , low house]3447-a long , low house , mellow in the mild light of sunset . [All the six friends]3448-all the six friends compared notes afterwards and quarrelled ; but [they]3448-all the six friends all agreed that in some unaccountable way [the place]193-the place reminded [them]3448-all the six friends of [[their]3448-all the six friends boyhood]3450-their boyhood .
