When [the carriages]3433-the carriages eventually rolled up to [a large , low , cavernous gateway]3456-a large , low , cavernous gateway , [another man in the same uniform , but wearing a silver star on the grey breast of [his]3457-another man in the same uniform , but wearing a silver star on the grey breast of his coat coat]3457-another man in the same uniform , but wearing a silver star on the grey breast of his coat , came out to meet [them]3448-all the six friends . [This impressive person]3458-this impressive person said to [the bewildered Syme]85-syme — “[0-i] Refreshments are provided for [you]1819-his in [[your]1819-his room]1820-your room . ” [Syme , under the influence of the same mesmeric sleep of amazement]3459-syme , under the influence of the same mesmeric sleep of amazement , went up [the large oaken stairs]3460-the large oaken stairs after [the respectful attendant]3461-the respectful attendant . [He]1819-his entered [a splendid suite of apartments that seemed to be designed specially for [him]1819-his]3462-a splendid suite of apartments that seemed to be designed specially for him . [He]1819-his walked up to a long mirror with the ordinary instinct of [[his]1819-his class]3463-his class , to pull [his]1819-his tie straight or to smooth [his]1819-his hair ; and there [he]1819-his saw the frightful figure that [he]1819-his was — blood running down [his]1819-his face from where the bough had struck [him]1819-his , [his]1819-his hair standing out like yellow rags of rank grass , [his]1819-his clothes torn into long , wavering tatters . At once the whole enigma sprang up , simply as the question of how [he]1819-his had got [there]1968-there , and how [he]1819-his was to get out again . Exactly at the same moment [a man in blue]3465-a man in blue , who had been appointed as [[his]1819-his valet]3466-his valet , said very solemnly — “[0-i] [I]0-i have put out [your]0-i clothes , [sir]2017-sir . ” “[0-i] Clothes ! ” said [Syme]85-syme sardonically . “[0-i] [I]0-i have no clothes except these , ” and [he]0-i lifted two long strips of [his]0-i frock‑coat in fascinating festoons , and made a movement as if to twirl like [a ballet girl]3467-a ballet girl . “[1810-my master] [[My]0-i master]1810-my master asks [me]0-i to say , ” said [the attendant]3468-the attendant , that there is a fancy dress ball to‑night , and that [he]1810-my master desires [you]0-i to put on the costume that [I]1810-my master have laid out . Meanwhile , [sir]2017-sir , there is a bottle of Burgundy and some cold pheasant , which [he]1810-my master hopes [you]0-i will not refuse , as it is some hours before supper . ”[1810-my master] “ Cold pheasant is a good thing , ”[85-syme] said [Syme]85-syme reflec­tively , “ and [Burgundy]142-burgundy is a spanking good thing . But really [I]1823-the servant do not want either of them so much as [I]1823-the servant want to know what the devil all this means , and what sort of costume [you]0-i have got laid out for [me]1823-the servant . Where is it ? ”[1823-the servant] [The servant]1823-the servant lifted off a kind of ottoman a long peacock‑blue drapery , rather of the nature of a domino , on the front of which was emblazoned a large golden sun , and which was splashed here and there with flam­ing stars and crescents . “ [You]0-i ’re to be dressed as Thursday , [sir]2017-sir , ”[1824-the valet] said [the valet]1824-the valet somewhat affably . “ Dressed as [Thursday]100-thursday ! ”[85-syme] said [Syme]85-syme in meditation . “ It does n’t sound a warm costume . ”[85-syme] “ Oh , yes , [sir]2017-sir , ”[1825-the other eagerly] said [the other eagerly]1825-the other eagerly , “ the Thursday costume is quite warm , [sir]2017-sir . It fastens up to the chin . ”[1825-the other eagerly] “ Well , [I]85-syme do n’t understand anything , ”[85-syme] said [Syme]85-syme , sighing . “ [I]85-syme have been used so long to uncomfortable adventures that comfortable adventures knock [me]85-syme out . Still , [I]85-syme may be allowed to ask why [I]85-syme should be particularly like [Thursday]100-thursday in a green frock spotted all over with the sun and moon . Those orbs , [I]85-syme think , shine on other days . [I]85-syme once saw the moon on Tuesday , [I]85-syme remember . ”[85-syme] “ Beg pardon , [sir]2017-sir , ”[1824-the valet] said [the valet]1824-the valet , “ Bible also provided for [you]2017-sir , ”[1824-the valet] and with a respectful and rigid finger [he]1824-the valet pointed out a passage in the first chapter of Genesis . [Syme]85-syme read it wondering . It was that in which the fourth day of the week is associated with the creation of the sun and moon . Here , however , [they]1827-they reckoned from a Christian Sunday . “ This is getting wilder and wilder , ”[85-syme] said [Syme]85-syme , as [he]85-syme sat down in a chair . “ Who are [these people who provide cold pheasant and Burgundy , and green clothes and Bibles]3474-these people who provide cold pheasant and burgundy , and green clothes and bibles ? Do [they]3474-these people who provide cold pheasant and burgundy , and green clothes and bibles provide everything ? ”[85-syme] “ Yes , [sir]2017-sir , everything , ”[3468-the attendant] said [the attendant]3468-the attendant gravely . “ Shall [I]3468-the attendant help [you]2017-sir on with [your]2017-sir costume ? ”[3468-the attendant] “ Oh , hitch the bally thing on ! ”[85-syme] said [Syme]85-syme impatiently . But though [he]85-syme affected to despise [the mummery]1829-the mummery , [he]85-syme felt a curious freedom and naturalness in [his]85-syme movements as the blue and gold garment fell about [him]85-syme ; and when [he]85-syme found that [he]85-syme had to wear a sword , it stirred a boyish dream . As [he]85-syme passed out of [the room]292-the room [he]85-syme flung the folds across [his]85-syme shoulder with a gesture , [his]85-syme sword stood out at an angle , and [he]85-syme had all the swagger of [a troubadour]1831-a troubadour . For these disguises did not disguise , but reveal . AS [Syme]85-syme strode along [the corridor]2091-the corridor [he]85-syme saw [the Secretary]701-the secretary standing at the top of [a great flight of stairs]1834-a great flight of stairs . [The man]294-the man had never looked so noble . [He]294-the man was draped in a long robe of starless black , down the centre of which fell a band or broad stripe of pure white , like a single shaft of light . The whole looked like some very severe ecclesiastical vestment . There was no need for [Syme]85-syme to search [his]85-syme memory or the Bible in order to remember that the first day of creation marked the mere creation of light out of darkness . The vestment itself would alone have suggested the symbol ; and [Syme]85-syme felt also how perfectly this pattern of pure white and black expressed the soul of [the pale and austere Secretary]1836-the pale and austere secretary , with [his]294-the man inhuman veracity and [his]294-the man cold frenzy , which made [him]294-the man so easily make war on [the anarchists]337-the anarchists , and yet so easily pass for [one of [them]337-the anarchists]1116-one of them . [Syme]85-syme was scarcely surprised to notice that , amid all the ease and hospitality of [their]1839-their new surroundings , [this man]360-this man ’s eyes were still stern . No smell of ale or orchards could make [the Secretary]701-the secretary cease to ask a reasonable question . If [Syme]85-syme had been able to see [himself]85-syme , [he]85-syme would have realised that [he]85-syme , too , seemed to be for the first time [himself]85-syme and [no one else]1842-no one else . For if [the Secretary]701-the secretary stood for [that philosopher who loves the original and formless light]1844-that philosopher who loves the original and formless light , [Syme]85-syme was [a type of the poet who seeks always to make the light in special shapes , to split it up into sun and star]1845-a type of the poet who seeks always to make the light in special shapes , to split it up into sun and star . [The philosopher]1846-the philosopher may sometimes love the infinite ; [the poet]1944-the poet always loves the finite . For [him]294-the man the great moment is not the creation of light , but the creation of the sun and moon . As [they]1839-their descended the broad stairs together [they]1839-their overtook [Ratcliffe]163-ratcliffe , who was clad in spring green like [a huntsman]1848-a huntsman , and the pattern upon whose garment was a green tangle of trees . For [he]163-ratcliffe stood for that third day on which the earth and green things were made , and [his]163-ratcliffe square , sensible face , with its not unfriendly cynicism , seemed appropriate enough to it . [They]1839-their were led out of another broad and low gateway into [a very large old English garden]1849-a very large old english garden , full of torches and bonfires , by the broken light of which a vast carnival of [people]2038-people were dancing in motley dress . [Syme]85-syme seemed to see every shape in Nature imitated in some crazy costume . There was [a man dressed as a windmill with enormous sails]1851-a man dressed as a windmill with enormous sails , [a man dressed as an elephant]1852-a man dressed as an elephant , [a man dressed as a balloon]1853-a man dressed as a balloon ; [the two last , together]1854-the two last , together , seemed to keep the thread of [their]1839-their farcical adventures . [Syme]85-syme even saw , with a queer thrill , [one dancer dressed like an enormous hornbill]1855-one dancer dressed like an enormous hornbill , with a beak twice as big as [himself]85-syme — the queer bird which had fixed itself on [his]85-syme fancy like a living question while [he]85-syme was rushing down [the long road]1643-the long road at [the Zoological Gardens]1678-the zoological gardens . There were a thousand other such objects , however . There was a dancing lamp‑post , a dancing apple tree , [a dancing ship]1858-a dancing ship . [One]225-one would have thought that the untamable tune of [some mad musician]1860-some mad musician had set all the common objects of field and street dancing an eternal jig . And long afterwards , when [Syme]85-syme was middle‑aged and at rest , [he]85-syme could never see one of those particular objects — a lamppost , or an apple tree , or a windmill — without thinking that it was [a strayed reveller from that revel of masquerade]1861-a strayed reveller from that revel of masquerade . On one side of [this lawn]1980-this lawn , alive with [dancers]1863-dancers , was a sort of green bank , like [the terrace in [such old‑fashioned gardens]1865-such old‑fashioned gardens]1864-the terrace in such old‑fashioned gardens . Along this , in a kind of crescent , stood seven great chairs , the thrones of the seven days . [Gogol]124-gogol and [Dr. Bull]134-dr. bull were already in [their]1839-their seats ; [the Professor]805-the professor was just mounting to [his]805-the professor . [Gogol]124-gogol , or [Tuesday]125-tuesday , had [his]124-gogol simplicity well symbolised by a dress designed upon the division of [the waters]1867-the waters , a dress that separated upon [his]124-gogol forehead and fell to [his]124-gogol feet , grey and silver , like a sheet of rain . [The Professor , whose day was that on which the birds]1868-the professor , whose day was that on which the birds and fishes — the ruder forms of life — were created , had a dress of dim purple , over which sprawled goggle‑eyed fishes and outrageous tropical birds , the union in [him]124-gogol of unfathomable fancy and of doubt . [Dr. Bull]134-dr. bull , the last day of Creation , wore a coat covered with heraldic animals in red and gold , and on [his]134-dr. bull crest [a man]221-a man rampant . [He]134-dr. bull lay back in [his]134-dr. bull chair with a broad smile , the picture of [an optimist in [his]134-dr. bull element]1870-an optimist in his element . One by one [the wanderers]1871-the wanderers ascended [the bank]2471-the bank and sat in [their]1871-the wanderers strange seats . As each of [them]1871-the wanderers sat down a roar of enthusiasm rose from the carnival , such as that with which [crowds]1617-crowds receive [kings]690-kings . Cups were clashed and torches shaken , and feathered hats flung in the air . [The men for whom these thrones were reserved]1875-the men for whom these thrones were reserved were [men crowned with some extraordinary laurels]1876-men crowned with some extraordinary laurels . But the central chair was empty . [Syme]85-syme was on the left hand of [it]1877-it and [the Secretary]701-the secretary on the right . [The Secretary]701-the secretary looked across the empty throne at [Syme]85-syme , and said , compressing [his]701-the secretary lips — “ [We]3476-we do not know yet that [he]85-syme is not dead in a field . ”[701-the secretary] Almost as [Syme]85-syme heard the words , [he]85-syme saw on the sea of human faces in front of [him]85-syme a frightful and beautiful alteration , as if heaven had opened behind [his]85-syme head . But [Sunday]107-sunday had only passed silently along the front like a shadow , and had sat in the central seat . [He]107-sunday was draped plainly , in a pure and terrible white , and [his]107-sunday hair was like a silver flame on [his]107-sunday forehead . For a long time — it seemed for hours — that huge masquerade of [mankind]2056-mankind swayed and stamped in front of [them]2056-mankind to marching and exultant music . [Every couple]1881-every couple dancing seemed a separate romance ; it might be [a fairy dancing with a pillar‑box]1882-a fairy dancing with a pillar‑box , or [a peasant girl dancing with the moon]1883-a peasant girl dancing with the moon ; but in each case it was , somehow , as absurd as [Alice in Wonderland]180-alice in wonderland , yet as grave and kind as a love story . At last , however , [the thick crowd]1884-the thick crowd began to thin itself . [Couples]1885-couples strolled away into [the garden - walks]1886-the garden - walks , or began to drift towards that end of [the building]1887-the building where stood smoking , in huge pots like fish - kettles , some hot and scented mixtures of old ale or wine . Above all these , upon a sort of black framework on the roof of [the house]1372-the house , roared in its iron basket a gigantic bonfire , which lit up [the land]1889-the land for miles . It flung the homely effect of firelight over the face of vast forests of grey or brown , and it seemed to fill with warmth even the emptiness of upper night . Yet this also , after a time , was allowed to grow fainter ; [the dim groups]1890-the dim groups gathered more and more round the great cauldrons , or passed , laughing and clattering , into [the inner passages of [that ancient house]1892-that ancient house]1891-the inner passages of that ancient house . Soon there were only [some ten loiterers in [the garden]262-the garden]1893-some ten loiterers in the garden ; soon only four . Finally [the last stray merry‑maker]1895-the last stray merry‑maker ran into [the house]1372-the house whooping to [[his]1895-the last stray merry‑maker companions]2754-his companions . The fire faded , and the slow , strong stars came out . And [the seven strange men]1898-the seven strange men were left alone , like seven stone statues on [their]1898-the seven strange men chairs of stone . Not one of [them]1898-the seven strange men had spoken a word . [They]1898-the seven strange men seemed in no haste to do so , but heard in silence the hum of insects and the distant song of one bird . Then [Sunday]107-sunday spoke , but so dreamily that [he]107-sunday might have been continuing a conversation rather than beginning one . “ [We]3477-we will eat and drink later , ”[107-sunday] [he]107-sunday said . “ Let [us]3477-we remain together a little , [we]3477-we who have loved [each other]349-each other so sadly , and have fought so long . [I]107-sunday seem to remember only centuries of heroic war , in which [you]3479-you were always [heroes]3480-heroes — epic on epic , iliad on iliad , and [you]3479-you always [brothers in arms]3481-brothers in arms . Whether it was but recently ( for time is nothing ) , or at the beginning of [the world]231-the world , [I]107-sunday sent [you]3479-you out to war . [I]107-sunday sat in the darkness , where there is not any created thing , and to [you]3479-you [I]107-sunday was [only a voice commanding valour and an unnatural virtue]3483-only a voice commanding valour and an unnatural virtue . [You]3479-you heard the voice in the dark , and [you]3479-you never heard it again . The sun in [heaven]2502-heaven denied it , [the earth]234-the earth and sky denied it , all human wisdom denied it . And when [I]107-sunday met [you]3479-you in the daylight [I]107-sunday denied it [myself]107-sunday . ”[107-sunday] [Syme]85-syme stirred sharply in [his]85-syme seat , but otherwise there was silence , and the incomprehensible went on . “ But [you]3479-you were [men]214-men . [You]3479-you did not forget [your]3479-you secret honour , though the whole cosmos turned an engine of torture to tear it out of [you]3479-you . [I]1900-the black‑browed secretary knew how near [you]3479-you were to [hell]3487-hell . [I]1900-the black‑browed secretary know how [you]3479-you , [Thursday]100-thursday , crossed swords with [King Satan]160-satan , and how [you]3479-you , [Wednesday]128-wednesday , named [me]1900-the black‑browed secretary in the hour without hope . ”[1900-the black‑browed secretary] There was complete silence in [the starlit garden]1899-the starlit garden , and then [the black‑browed Secretary]1900-the black‑browed secretary , implacable , turned in [his]1900-the black‑browed secretary chair towards [Sunday]107-sunday , and said in a harsh voice — “ Who and what are [you]3479-you ? ”[1900-the black‑browed secretary] “ [I]279-the other am the Sabbath , ”[279-the other] said [the other]279-the other without moving . “ [I]279-the other am the peace of [God]95-god . ”[279-the other] [The Secretary]701-the secretary started up , and stood crushing [his]701-the secretary costly robe in [his]701-the secretary hand . “ [I]701-the secretary know what [you]3479-you mean , ”[701-the secretary] [he]701-the secretary cried , “ and it is exactly that that [I]701-the secretary can not forgive [you]3479-you . [I]701-the secretary know [you]3479-you are contentment , optimism , what do [they]3488-they call the thing , an ultimate reconciliation . Well , [I]701-the secretary am not reconciled . If [you]3479-you were [the man in the dark room]3254-the man in the dark room , why were [you]3479-you also Sunday , an offense to the sunlight ? If [you]3479-you were from [the first [[our]3491-our father]3492-our father and [[our]3491-our friend]2340-our friend]3490-the first our father and our friend , why were [you]3479-you also [[our]3491-our greatest enemy]3494-our greatest enemy ? [We]3491-our wept , [we]3491-our fled in terror ; the iron entered into [our]3491-our souls — and [you]3479-you are the peace of [God]95-god ! Oh , [I]701-the secretary can forgive [God]95-god [His]95-god anger , though it destroyed [nations]3495-nations ; but [I]701-the secretary can not forgive [Him]95-god [His]95-god peace . ”[701-the secretary] [Sunday]107-sunday answered not a word , but very slowly [he]107-sunday turned [his]107-sunday face of stone upon [Syme]85-syme as if asking a question . “ No , ”[85-syme] said [Syme]85-syme , “ [I]85-syme do not feel fierce like that . [I]85-syme am grateful to [you]107-sunday , not only for wine and hospitality here , but for many a fine scamper and free fight . But [I]85-syme should like to know . [My]85-syme soul and heart are as happy and quiet here as [this old garden]3496-this old garden , but [my]85-syme reason is still crying out . [I]85-syme should like to know . ”[85-syme] [Sunday]107-sunday looked at [Ratcliffe]163-ratcliffe , whose clear voice said — “ It seems so silly that [you]107-sunday should have been on both sides and fought [yourself]107-sunday . ”[163-ratcliffe] [Bull]85-syme said — “ [l]85-syme understand nothing , but [I]85-syme am happy . In fact , [I]85-syme am going to sleep . ”[85-syme] “ [I]805-the professor am not happy , ”[805-the professor] said [the Professor]805-the professor with [his]805-the professor head in [his]805-the professor hands , “ because [I]805-the professor do not understand . [You]3497-you let [me]805-the professor stray a little too near to hell . ”[805-the professor] And then [Gogol]124-gogol said , with the absolute simplicity of [a child]523-a child — “ [I]124-gogol wish [I]124-gogol knew why [I]124-gogol was hurt so much . ”[124-gogol] Still [Sunday]107-sunday said nothing , but only sat with [his]107-sunday mighty chin upon [his]107-sunday hand , and gazed at the distance . Then at last [he]107-sunday said — “ [I]107-sunday have heard [your]3497-you complaints in order . And here , [I]107-sunday think , comes another to complain , and [we]3498-we will hear [him]107-sunday also . ”[107-sunday] The falling fire in the great cresset threw a last long gleam , like a bar of burning gold , across the dim grass . Against this fiery band was outlined in utter black the advancing legs of a black‑clad figure . [He]107-sunday seemed to have a fine close suit with knee‑breeches such as that which was worn by [the servants of [the house]1372-the house]1905-the servants of the house , only that it was not blue , but of this absolute sable . [He]107-sunday had , like [the servants]1907-the servants , a kind of word by [his]107-sunday side . It was only when [he]107-sunday had come quite close to the crescent of [the seven]1908-the seven and flung up [his]107-sunday face to look at [them]1908-the seven , that [Syme]85-syme saw , with thunder‑struck clearness , that the face was the broad , almost ape‑like face of [[his]107-sunday old friend]1909-his old friend [Gregory]106-gregory , with its rank red hair and its insulting smile . “ [Gregory]106-gregory ! ”[85-syme] gasped [Syme]85-syme , half‑rising from [his]85-syme seat . “ Why , this is [the real anarchist]3499-the real anarchist ! ”[85-syme] “ Yes , ”[106-gregory] said [Gregory]106-gregory , with a great and dangerous restraint , “ [I]106-gregory am [the real anarchist]3499-the real anarchist . ”[106-gregory] “ ‘ Now there was a day , ’ ”[85-syme] murmured [Bull]85-syme , who seemed really to have fallen asleep , ” ‘ when [the sons of [God]95-god]3501-the sons of god came to present [themselves]3501-the sons of god before [the Lord]3502-the lord , and [Satan]160-satan came also among [them]3501-the sons of god . ’ ”[85-syme] “ [You]85-syme are right , ”[106-gregory] said [Gregory]106-gregory , and gazed all round . “ [I]106-gregory am [a destroyer]3503-a destroyer . [I]106-gregory would destroy [the world]231-the world if [I]106-gregory could . ”[106-gregory] A sense of a pathos far under [the earth]234-the earth stirred up in [Syme]85-syme , and [he]85-syme spoke brokenly and without sequence . “ Oh , [most unhappy man]3505-most unhappy man , ”[85-syme] [he]85-syme cried , “ try to be happy ! [You]3505-most unhappy man have red hair like [[your]3505-most unhappy man sister]3506-your sister . ”[85-syme] “ [My]106-gregory red hair , like red flames , shall burn up [the world]231-the world , ”[106-gregory] said [Gregory]106-gregory . “ [I]106-gregory thought [I]106-gregory hated everything more than [common men]3508-common men can hate anything ; but [I]106-gregory find that [I]106-gregory do not hate everything so much as [I]106-gregory hate [you]3505-most unhappy man ! ”[106-gregory] “ [I]85-syme never hated [you]3505-most unhappy man , ”[85-syme] said [Syme]85-syme very sadly . Then out of [this unintelligible creature]1911-this unintelligible creature the last thunders broke . “ [You]3505-most unhappy man ! ”[85-syme] [he]85-syme cried . “ [You]3505-most unhappy man never hated because [you]3505-most unhappy man never lived . [I]85-syme know what [you]3505-most unhappy man are all of [you]3505-most unhappy man , from first to last — [you]3505-most unhappy man are [the people in power]3509-the people in power ! [You]3505-most unhappy man are [the police]2007-the police — [the great fat , smiling men in blue and buttons]3511-the great fat , smiling men in blue and buttons ! [You]3505-most unhappy man are the Law , and [you]3505-most unhappy man have never been broken . But is there [a free soul alive]3512-a free soul alive that does not long to break [you]3505-most unhappy man , only because [you]3505-most unhappy man have never been broken ? [We]3513-we in revolt talk all kind of nonsense doubtless about this crime or that crime of [the Government]115-government . It is all folly ! The only crime of [the Government]3514-the government is that it governs . The unpardonable sin of the supreme power is that it is supreme . [I]85-syme do not curse [you]3505-most unhappy man for being cruel . [I]85-syme do not curse [you]3505-most unhappy man ( though [I]85-syme might ) for being kind . [I]85-syme curse [you]3505-most unhappy man for being safe ! [You]3505-most unhappy man sit in [your]3505-most unhappy man chairs of stone , and have never come down from them . [You]3505-most unhappy man are [the seven angels of [heaven]2502-heaven]3515-the seven angels of heaven , and [you]3505-most unhappy man have had no troubles . Oh , [I]85-syme could forgive [you]3505-most unhappy man everything , [you]3505-most unhappy man that rule [all mankind]3517-all mankind , if [I]85-syme could feel for once that [you]3505-most unhappy man had suffered for one hour a real agony such as [I]85-syme — ”[85-syme] [Syme]85-syme sprang to [his]85-syme feet , shaking from head to foot . “ [I]85-syme see everything , ”[85-syme] [he]85-syme cried , “ everything that there is . Why does each thing on [the earth]234-the earth war against each other thing ? Why does each small thing in [the world]231-the world have to fight against [the world]231-the world [itself]231-the world ? Why does [a fly]3521-a fly have to fight [the whole universe]3522-the whole universe ? Why does a dandelion have to fight [the whole universe]3522-the whole universe ? For the same reason that [I]85-syme had to be alone in the dreadful Council of the Days . So that [each thing that obeys law]3524-each thing that obeys law may have the glory and isolation of [the anarchist]3525-the anarchist . So that [each man fighting for order]3526-each man fighting for order may be as brave and good [a man]221-a man as [the dynamiter]3528-the dynamiter . So that the real lie of [Satan]160-satan may be flung back in the face of [this blasphemer]3529-this blasphemer , so that by tears and torture [we]1912-we may earn the right to say to [this man]360-this man , ‘ [You]360-this man lie ! ’ No agonies can be too great to buy the right to say to [this accuser]3531-this accuser , ‘ [We]1912-we also have suffered . ’ “[85-syme] It is not true that [we]1912-we have never been broken . [We]1912-we have been broken upon the wheel . It is not true that [we]1912-we have never descended from these thrones . [We]1912-we have descended into hell . [We]1912-we were complaining of unforgettable miseries even at the very moment when [this man]360-this man entered insolently to accuse [us]1912-we of happiness . [I]0-i repel the slander ; [we]1912-we have not been happy . [I]0-i can answer for [every one of [the great guards of Law whom [he]360-this man has accused]1915-the great guards of law whom he has accused]1914-every one of the great guards of law whom he has accused . At least — ” [He]0-i had turned [his]0-i eyes so as to see suddenly the great face of [Sunday]107-sunday , which wore a strange smile.­ “[1916-you] Have [you]1916-you , ” [he]0-i cried in a dreadful voice , “[1916-you] have [you]1916-you ever suffered ? ” As [he]0-i gazed , the great face grew to an awful size , grew larger than the colossal mask of [Memnon]123-memnon , which had made [him]0-i scream as [a child]523-a child . It grew larger and larger , filling the whole sky ; then everything went black . Only in the blackness before it entirely destroyed [his]0-i brain [he]0-i seemed to hear a distant voice saying a commonplace text that [he]0-i had heard somewhere , “[1916-you] Can [ye]1917-ye drink of the cup that [I]0-i drink of ? ” When [men in books awake from a vision]1918-men in books awake from a vision , [they]1918-men in books awake from a vision commonly find [themselves]1918-men in books awake from a vision in some place in which [they]1918-men in books awake from a vision might have fallen asleep ; [they]1918-men in books awake from a vision yawn in a chair , or lift [themselves]1918-men in books awake from a vision with bruised limbs from a field . [Syme]85-syme ’s experience was something much more psychologically strange if there was indeed anything unreal , in the earthly sense , about the things [he]85-syme had gone through . For while [he]85-syme could always remember afterwards that [he]85-syme had swooned before the face of [Sunday]107-sunday , [he]85-syme could not remember having ever come to at all . [He]85-syme could only remember that gradually and naturally [he]85-syme knew that [he]85-syme was and had been walking along [a country lane]1919-a country lane with [an easy and conversational companion]1920-an easy and conversational companion . [That companion]1921-that companion had been a part of [his]85-syme recent drama ; it was the red‑haired poet [Gregory]106-gregory . [They]1922-they were walking like [old friends]1923-old friends , and were in the middle of a conversation about some triviality . But [Syme]85-syme could only feel an unnatural buoyancy in [his]85-syme body and a crystal simplicity in [his]85-syme mind that seemed to be superior to everything that [he]85-syme said or did . [He]85-syme felt [he]85-syme was in possession of some impossible good news , which made every other thing a triviality , but an adorable triviality . Dawn was breaking over everything in colours at once clear and timid ; as if [Nature]181-nature made a first attempt at yellow and a first attempt at rose . A breeze blew so clean and sweet , that one could not think that it blew from the sky ; it blew rather through some hole in the sky . [Syme]85-syme felt a simple surprise when [he]85-syme saw rising all round [him]85-syme on both sides of [the road]278-the road [the red , irregular buildings of [Saffron Park]1-saffron park]1925-the red , irregular buildings of saffron park . [He]85-syme had no idea that [he]85-syme had walked so near [London]2-london . [He]85-syme walked by instinct along [one white road , on which early birds hopped and sang]1926-one white road , on which early birds hopped and sang , and found [himself]85-syme outside [a fenced garden]1927-a fenced garden . There [he]85-syme saw [the sister of [Gregory]106-gregory]1928-the sister of gregory , [the girl with the gold‑red hair]1929-the girl with the gold‑red hair , cutting lilac before breakfast , with the great unconscious gravity of [a girl]1930-a girl .
